loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rented house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling shoes at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of competition from other shoe sellers in the market. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of shoes to resell. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of shoes to resell

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es:
La  señora Silvina  tiene treinta y ocho años de edad  , se dedica a la elaboración de comida  desde hace siete años atrás.
Es una señora  muy trabajadora  a parte de vender  comida se dedica a la venta de ropa , obtiene muy buenas ganancias de sus dos   negocios.
Tiene  la cantidad de un hijo de diecinueve  años de edad , cada  catorce días va realizar su pagos ala microfinanciera , le gusta mucho su trabajo   ya que su hijo la apoya en la tienda de comida y en la  venta de ropa , esta muy contenta por que su negocio va creciendo cada día.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para comprar mas  ingredientes para  la elaboración de comida ya que  ha tenido muy buenas ventas sus guisados rápido se le terminan  también vende antojitos mexicanos en la noche. 
Uno de sus sueños  es tener una tienda de ropa  para que su ropa se venda bien ya que  esta muy ocupada preparando las cosas para la comida y no puede  exhibir  la  ropa , teniendo un local  su hijo  le puede ayudar atendiendo solamente el local de ropa.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado , para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños  que tenia para el futuro  y gracias a su apoyo  los esta haciendo realidad
texts.en:
Silvina is thirty eight years old. She has made food for seven years. She is a very hardworking woman who apart from selling food sells clothes. She gets very good income from her two businesses. 

She has one son who is nineteen years old. Every two weeks she makes her micro loan payments. She really likes her job since her son helps her sell food and clothes. She is very happy because the business is growing every day.

She asked for the loan to buy more ingredients to make food. She has had very good sales- her stews sell out fast as well as her Mexican appetizers at night.   

One of her dreams is to have her own clothing store so her clothing will sell well. She is very busy making things for the food and she can't show the clothes. With a locale, her son can help her just sell the clothes.

She is thankful to the foundation for the support it has given her to get ahead and make the dreams she has for the future come true. Thanks to its support this is becoming a reality.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Nyabugando Farmers Association Group

texts.en:
Cledonia, a 32-year-old easy-going mother of three, has been operating a poultry business and selling eggs for the last four years in Rukungiri, located in Western Uganda. In most urban areas, poultry is one of the most profitable business ventures in Uganda today, and in Rukungiri, where Cledonia operates her enterprise, it is growing by leaps and bounds.

Having started this business under the auspices of a government agro advisory scheme, Cledonia's hard work, determination and perseverance have led to success, and she has expansion plans under consideration. With monthly sales revenues of Uganda shillings 400,000, which includes proceeds from a small goat sales business she also operates, Cledonia plans to use this Kiva loan to purchase more chicken and chicken mash.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken and chicken mash.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Джамшед женат и у них один ребенок, который составляет 2 годика. Он очень добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Джамшед занимается купля продажей хозяйственные товары. Он продает  люстры, шкафы, подставки для обувей, коврики для ванн, подставки для ванн и другие принадлежности для дома. Он является владельцем данного бизнеса, и его мать помогает ему. Он занимается этим бизнесом более 5 лет. Джамшед хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента товара и пополнение оборотного капитала.
texts.en: Jamshed is married and has one child who is two years old. He is a very kind and hardworking man. Jamshed is in the business of buying and selling household products. He sells lamps, dressers, shoe racks, bath rugs, bathtub stands and other household appliances. He is the owner of this business and his mother is also helping him. He has been in this business for five years. Jamshed wants to expand his business and maximize his profits. He wants to get a loan in the amount of $3,000USD to buy a new assortment of merchandise and to increase his working capital.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lynett

texts.en:
Lynett is a 33-year-old married woman with 2 children aged 10 and 9. She is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Lynett helps her husband grow rice crops on their land. Lynett has been in rice farming for 10 years.

Lynett has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. Lynett hopes that their farm will grow bigger. She also wishes for her children to be able to go to college and have a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Ailas' Group

texts.en:
Meet Ailas (woman with book in photo).  She is one of this group's members.  Alias is married and the mother of four children: three daughters and a son.  Her oldest daughter is 22 years old.  The next to her is age 19.  Her younger daughter is in 6th grade and 13 years old.  Her son finished his studies until 8th grade and started a mobile phone repairing business.  He runs a shop in the market where he can repair any kind of mobile phone.
 
Ailas is a talented lady.  She owns and operates a sewing clothes business at her home.  She receives orders from neighbors. She also offers customers a variety of ready-made clothes that she sells at reasonable prices.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah.  With the loan, Ailas will buy clothes and a sewing machine to expand her business.  She is hopeful that with a new sewing machine and cloth she will double her income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine & clothes.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  She is 39 years old, married to Njuguna, and they have four school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the existing clients and this is her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs.

In future, Florence hopes to expand her business as well as improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Lucrecia Analia

texts.es:
Lucrecia Analía tiene 48 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene una hija, vive con el esposo y con la hija de 12 años de edad en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.

LA VRC MONTE DE LOS OLIVOS, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina conformada por 14 socios y socias. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao.

Lucrecia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es tener una camioneta para salir a pasear con la familia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  jugar con la hija.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Analía is 48 years old and living in a common law relationship.  She has a daughter. She lives with her husband and 12-year-old daughter in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Monte de los Olivos” communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from this office.  It has 14 members, men and women.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, orange and cocoa bean farming.

Lucrecia is a corn, orange and cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and her sales take place in Chillanes Canton.  She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain her crops in good condition.

The loan will be very helpful because she’ll be able to improve her quality of life.  The challenges she faces are frequent: competition and pests.  Her dream is to buy a van to go out on family trips.  In her free time she likes to play with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Anamer

texts.en:
Anamer is 34 year old and single. She lives in Oroquieta City. 

Anamer has been 10 years in raising crops work, planting & harvesting rice for sale and she earn 40,000PHP a month with this work.

Anamer joined GDMPC in 2005 to gain financial services to help improve her living situation and to improve her ability to engage in business activities. Anamer is requesting a loan of 50,000PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Anamer from GDMPC. Anamer hopes to improve/expand her business to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr:
Mme Ramatoulaye est une dame qui fait du commerce depuis 8 ans. Elle est mariée et vit avec sa belle- famille
Son activité consiste  à vendre des produits halieutiques dans le marché local. Elle a une expérience dans le domaine du crédit car elle est à sa  quatrième  fois.
Avec le prêt  elle veut  augmenter  ses possibilités d’offre et diversifier aussi ses produits.
texts.en:
Mme Ramatoulaye is a lady who has been in business for 8 years. She is married and lives with her in-laws
Her business consists of selling fish products in the local market. She already has experience in managing loans as this is her fourth loan cycle.
She wants to use the loan to increase her offering and diversify the products on sale.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, palm oil, smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Dorotea has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Dorotea became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Dorotea hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La señora Maria Luisa se dedica a comercializar productos de acuerdo a la temporada. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital para poner a la venta de juguetes por las fiestas navideñas. Maria Luisa es divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos. Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda  ubicada en la zona  de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz. Ella es cliente de Impro desde el año  2008 y esta es la tercera vez que su solicitud de crédito es enviada a Kiva para fondeo.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Luisa sells products based on the season. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital so that she can buy toys for the Christmas holidays. Maria Luisa is divorced and has four children. She lives in a rented house in the District of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz.

Maria Luisa has been a client of IMPRO since 2008 and this will be the third time that her loan request has been sent to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy toys to sell during the Christmas holidays.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, aged 47 years-old, is married to Harrison and they are blessed with three children aged between 16 and 24 years. She runs a retail shop that has been in operation for 14 years. The business earns her a monthly income of Kes. 36,500.

This is her first loan with Kiva partner KADET Ltd .She will use the funds to buy stocks of sugar, rice, flour and cooking oil. Mary intends to use the anticipated profits to build more rental houses and hopes to open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice,and flour.

loans.name: Geoffrey Rajab

texts.en:
Geoffrey Rajab is a 40 year old green-grocer in Utange, Mombasa. He is married and a father of six children. 

Geoffrey Rajab has been selling groceries for the past three years successfully. This is his second loan from KADET and he plans to use the loan to purchase more kale, tomatoes, cabbages and potatoes for his business. With the proceeds, he will start a car washing business. He hopes to do well in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more kale, tomatoes, cabbages and potatoes.

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said is a 36-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from five to 12 years old. He describes himself to be honest, committed and responsible. He operates a retail store where he sells sugar, wheat flour, salt, painkillers etc. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a residential area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of goods sold. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more sugar, salt, wheat flour, etc. His business goal is to be the main supplier near his town area within five years.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, wheat flour, salt, sugar etc.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William used the previous loan to buy goats to sell. He is a 28-year-old, hardworking man who lives in Kasese, Uganda. Four years ago, he decided to trade in goats after assessing the lucrative nature of the business. This is due to the fact that goats are used as a dowry during customary marriages in the district, and other traders export them to the Democratic Republic of Congo. His major challenge is inadequate capital to supply the vast market, while his dreams are to own a ranch and also trade in cattle. William intends to use the loan to buy goats and cows to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats  and cows to sell.

loans.name: Edy Lorena

texts.es: Edy de 30 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que habita en vivienda familiar junto a sus padres y sus dos hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad y ella como madre soltera se siente orgullosa de ellos. Edy es una mujer trabajadora que siempre se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia apoyada en su trabajo en el cual se dedica a la venta de refrescos al mediodía y variedad de atoles por la tarde desde hace 10 años. Edy desea construir una fosa séptica en la vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir una fosa séptica y de esta manera mejorar la sanidad de su hogar. Edy espera contar con este apoyo ya que anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual invirtió en la compra de insumos para los atoles y ventas e incrementar las ganancias en su negocio por lo que se siente feliz y agradecida, y espera poder contar nuevamente con este apoyo.

loans.use: Para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir una fosa séptica y de esta manera mejorar la sanidad de su hogar.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is a 47yrs old married and have two children,his wife has no work.his income is not enough for their daily needs and also not enough to cover the needs in school such as the tuition fees.Joy took a new loans to buy a fertilizer for his corn production,and now Joy have an income and they can provide the needs of his two children because he earn on his farm,and they improve his family living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer in his corn farming

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: “No food for the lazy man” seems to be the favorite saying of Auntie Maggie. Despite her age, she still loves to work to improve her standard of living. She sells items ranging from footwear to clothes. She wishes to sell more items than she is now. She is therefore seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva for business expansion. She is a very good and hardworking woman and can pay back the loan duly without default.

loans.use: working capital to expand her business

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is the owner of a convenience store. She began by selling candies from her home. Edita’s siblings helped her open her store when she separated from her husband. Edita will use the loan to invest in purchasing school supplies and convenience items so that she can expand her business to include school and office supplies, as she has noted that these products are not offered in her area. She believes that with this investment, her sales will increase. This will allow her to continue helping her daughter with her university studies. Edita is 50 years old. She has an 18 year old daughter and is separated from her husband. She is totally dependant on her business for the support of her family. She is concerned about her daughter’s education, and she would like to see her become a professional. She is an enterprising woman and she knows that her business will grow, giving her the financial security that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Edita tiene una Tienda donde vende viveres de primera necesidad. Ella comenzo vendiendo confiteria en su casa .Edita empezo su negocio con la ayuda de sus hermanos al separarse de su esposo. Edita usara el prestamo para invertir en comprar en útiles escolares y viveres para asi poder ampliar su negocio con productos escolares y de oficina porque se ha dado cuenta que por sus sector no hay este negocio. Ella esta convencida que con esta inversión sus ventas creceran. Esto le permitirá seguir ayudando a su hija con los estudios universitarios. Edita tiene 50 años, es separada y tiene 1 hija de 18 años. Ella depende totalmente de su negocio para ayudar a su familia. Ella se preocupa por la educacion de sus hija quiere verla una profesional. Es una mujer emprendedora y sabe que su negocio crecera y le dara la seguridad financiera que necesita.

loans.use: Investment in school supplies

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Mrs Nov S. is a 40 year old widow and mother of 4 children, and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. In order to supplement the entire family's expense, she runs a small grocery store on a roadside of her village, which makes on average about $3.50/day in revenue. Three of her children are students, but the rest are too young to attend school. To increase the size of her business and keep investing in her children's education, Nov S. is asking for $800 to purchase more grocery items to satisfy her clients' needs. In the future, S. hopes to have enough money to maximize her store with a great variety of products.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to invest in her store.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich S. is 34 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their two children.  She works part-time at a garment factory, and part-time renting out rooms.  Combined, she can earn $4/day, while her husband earns $6/day working as a bodyguard.  This loan will be used to build more rooms for renting.

loans.use: To build rooms for renting

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
Jose Luiz is 29 years old. He is married and has three young children. For the last seven years, he has been part of his family's business - electronics retail. When his second child was born three years ago, he decided to set forth on his own using the experience he had gained from his family business. His hard work and willingness to succeed have unable him to support his family and expand his business.

In order to increase product variety, he asks for a loan in the amount of US$550.00, that will be used to purchase more merchandise. He commits to repaying it within 6 months. Be the one to sponsor Jose. Along with his family, he truly appreciates your help.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

José Luís tiene 29 años de edad, está casado y tiene tres pequeños hijos. Desde hace siete años José empezó a trabajar en el negocio familiar, donde venden artículos electrónicos, al nacer su segundo hijo, hace tres años, decidió independizarse e iniciar su propio negocio, aprovechando la experiencia que había adquirido continuó con el mismo giro. Gracias al buen trabajo que realiza y a sus deseos salir adelante con su familia ha podido crecer con su negocio.

Para incrementar la variedad de artículos que comercializa, José está solicitando un préstamo de $ 550 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía y se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Decídete a apoyar a José, él y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Rosa Paulo

texts.pt:
Rosa is single but lives with a man with whom she has 5 children. She sells wooden posts used to build “wattle and daub” houses and also sells firewood. She would like to use the money to buy more firewood for resale. She entered the program this year. This is the first loan she will take. She runs the business out of her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 5 filhos. Ela vende estacas que servem para construir casas de pau a pique e vende tambem lenha. Ela quer usar o dinheiro do emprestimo para a compra de lenha para a venda. Ela entrou para o programa ainda este ano. Este e o promeiro emprestimo que ela quer tomar. Ela desenvolve o seu negocio na sua residencia.

loans.use: Rosa would like to use the money to buy more wooden posts and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Toatolu

texts.en: Toatolu is 71 years old and has 9 children. Her talent is making elei (traditional Samoan fabrics). She has turned her talent into a business to meet her family's needs.  Some of her children help her craft the elei from Monday to Friday. They then deliver the goods to shops and flea markets in Savalalo. Toatolu earns $130 WST ($52 USD) daily. She is looking forward to her second loan so that she can expand the business and rebuild her house.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her elei printing business

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Y. Nasiba is 34 year-old loving mother of three children. Seven years ago she lost her husband and since that time all the difficulties were placed to the shoulders of this brave woman.

For 8 years already Nasiba has been selling the housewares, like detergents, washing liquids, tooth paste, air fresheners. Her elder daughter who is 12 now is helping her in the business. Two times a week Nasiba travels to the neighboring city that is about 80 kilometers away from her home to purchasing new goods for selling. In these cases she leaves her kids with her very old mother-in-law.

Nasiba has been loaned for about 2 years by IMON. Today she requests 1000.00 US Dollars. Nasiba is planning to increase the turnover capital which allows her to enlarge the range of housewares. The generated income Nasiba shall spend to pay for the education of her children. Nasiba thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: Increasing the turnover capital and enlarging the range of goods

loans.name: Aysel

texts.en:
Aysel (her husband is pictured) is a mother of one child. She was born in 1975. She is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Fizuli region. She and her family had settled in the Fizuli region at the Ahmadbayli village.

Three years ago, this family started a business in cattle agriculture. Now, they need a loan of $475 to buy a calf in order to increase the number of his calves.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. Sem Y., 44, is a mother of six children and, with her husband, works as a farmer on a plot of  land earning around $1.50 a day. Two of their children are married and live away from home. Two other children work as garment workers and earn a salary of $80 a month. This couple requests a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for their two daughters who commute to work at a factory. They currently commute by  motor-taxi which is very expensive.  The purchase of the motorbikes  will reduce the commute expense and allow the family to save for the future. (Mrs. Sem Y. is not available for pictured, husband only)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Orfelina

texts.es:
Orfelina M. P. es a member of Banco Comunal "Las Victorias." She lives in the San Martin department, in Mariscal Caceres province, Juanjui district. Her produce stand is located in the market "Pomarrosas" in Juanjui city. In this same market, she also has another stand where her husband sells braids, tassels, and other adornments. The idea behind these businesses comes from the need to help their children get ahead in life. Both are very grateful for the opportunity of receiving a loan that will allow them to continue to invest. With a loan of 2000.00 Sols, which will be paid in 6 months, they will invest in buying more fruits and vegetables that come from the region such as: oranges, lemons, bagged yucca, 2 bunches of bananas, plantains, avocado, around 100 lemons, boxes of papaya, among other produce, and for the adornment stand, they will buy thread, lace, elastic bands, ribbons of different colors and types, as well as plastic products that can be used at home. Orfelina is 59 years old, with 7 children who live on their own, and one who still lives with her and her husband. Her husband and child who lives at home help her with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Orfelina M. P. es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Victorias” vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres distrito de Juanjui , su puesto es de ventas de frutas y verduras se ubica en el mercado “Pomarrosas” de al ciudad de Juanjui, además en este mismo mercado tiene otro puesto de ventas de pasamanería que es atendido por su esposo. La idea de estos negocios, surge ante la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos, y ambos están muy agradecidos de tener la oportunidad de contar con un préstamo que les permita seguir invirtiendo. Con el préstamo de S/2000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas y verduras propias de la región como: naranja, limones, yucas, en sacos, 02 racimos de plátanos y guineos en racimos paltas y limones en cientos, papaya en cajas y otros y para su negocio de pasamanería comprara hilos, blondas, elásticos, cintas en diferentes variedades y colores, además artículos de plástico para uso personal y del hogar. La señora Orfelina tiene 59 años, 07 hijos todos independientes, 1 que aun vive con ella que junto asu esposo le ayudan en el negocio.

loans.use: To buy more produce and merchandise for her business

loans.name: Carlos Borromeo

texts.es:
Carlos Borromeo A. lives and works in Sandino, Managua. Carlos runs his own business out of his home. Carlos maintains a full workshop in which he prepares and sells both leather belts and orthopedic footwear.

Carlos fully supports and cares for his one son who is studying in the city. Carlos is requesting this loan to purchase additional materials for his business, specifically various types of leather. Carlos hopes that you accept his request so that he can continue his business and continue to provide for his wife and son.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua, el caballero Carlos Borromeo Álvarez posee su negocio de elaboración y venta de fajas de cuero y zapatos ortopédicos por encargo el cual son comercializados en su casa de habitación donde posee sus herramientas de trabajo.

Es padre de un hijo quien se encuentra estudiando en el municipio por lo que está en el deber y de suplir todas sus necesidades. Es de vital importancia destacar que este caballero está solicitando crédito en Ceprodel con el propósito de comprar los materiales de trabajo como lo son cuero, vaqueta y cuerina. Para esto espera que su petición sea concedida y así obtener el crédito para continuar con su negocio y de esta manera suplir la necesidad de su hijo y la de su esposa en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of leather.

loans.name: Shallotte

texts.en: Shallotte is married with one child. She used to sell only soft drinks and rice in large quantities in the neighborhood but now she has added to her  “breakfast joint” where she prepares breakfast for workers who are not able to prepare meals before going to work.  She wants to use the loan to buy more products to expand her operation. Her dream now is to turn her current place of operation into a snack bar and she has started saving towards that dream. Shallotte believes this loan will help her increase her savings to make her dream come true in the near future. She is a member of the group called El Shaddai. Members agree to guarantee for one another in the re-payment of loans.

loans.use: To buy crates of soft drinks, eggs, bread, bags of rice, etc

loans.name: Egna

texts.es:
Egna is 32 years old and has 3 children that she strongly supports with their studies. She has a popsicle business which supplements her job as a janitor in a radio station. Her popsicles are prepared with the utmost care as her main clients are children. Mrs. Egna tells us that nothing is impossible if you want to get ahead and even more if you have a family to support. She feels blessed to have two wonderful, understanding children and she shows no signs of fatigue...as she says "to get ahead you´ve got to fight hard".

Egna wants to keep growing her business and needs the microloan to build a refreshment stand for her weekend sales.

With your help, Mrs.Egna will achieve her goals in a short span of time.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Construction of a refreshment stand.

loans.name: Marcos Erminio

texts.es:
Mr. Marcos Herminio is a traveling salesman in a market in Managua; he sells watches, wallets, and other such articles. He lives in Concepción de Maria in Managua. He is married, and his wife takes care of their family and home. They have two children, who are 9 and 17 years old. Mr. Marcos’ life was very hard; as a result, he wants to pull his family forward and give them what his parents couldn’t give him. He began his traveling sales 10 years ago, and says that it was very difficult because he was opening a niche in the market with his traveling watch sales, but he has gone forward. His plans are to be able to establish a permanent place in this popular market. He needs this loan to supply more merchandise. He will buy watches and wallets to continue his sales.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Marcos Herminio es vendedor ambulante en un mercado de Managua de relojes, billeteras y demás artículos. Habita en el barrio Concepción de Maria de la ciudad de Managua. Es casado, su esposa se dedica al cuido de su familia y del hogar, tienen 2 hijos de 9 y 17 años. La vida de Don Marcos fue muy dura, es por eso que él desea sacar adelante a su familia y darles lo que sus padres no pudieron darle a él. Empezó hace 10 años sus ventas ambulantes, y cuenta que fue muy difícil porque él estaba abriendo un nicho de mercado en las ventas ambulantes de relojes, pero ha salido adelante y los planes que tiene es poder establecerse en un punto fijo en este populoso mercado. El préstamo lo necesita para surtirse más de mercadería, comprará relojes y billeteras para continuar con sus ventas.

loans.use: To buy watches and wallets

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama S. sells soup, rice, sugar and other goods at Abrobiano in Elmina. Mariama has received junior high school education. She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is a driver.

Mariama has been selling soup, rice, sugar, etc. since 2002. She is responsible for paying for school fees and food for the family. Her loan will be used to add to her capital to buy more grocery items for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 37-year -ld Rosemary from Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child who is 16 years old. Rosemary has been running a tailoring business since 2005, and her business is doing well. She works at the business for 12 hours per day and seven days per week. Rosemary currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 425 USD in order to purchase additional cloth which she uses for making dresses, bedsheets and other items. In the future, she plans to expand her business by adding more sewing machines. Rosemary thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional cloth for her tailoring business

loans.name: Mary Ngwe

texts.en:
Mary is married with six children and lives in Nchaubuh, Bamenda, in Cameroon. Mary has a successful business selling second hand shoes. She hopes to diversify and purchase more stock. She will invest this loan in green spices, tomatoes, second hand shoes, and fowls. She is going to invest 450,000 CFA ($900 USD) of her own personal savings towards her business. Mary has taken time to understand her customers' needs and is happy with the site of the business as there no competitors nearby. She intends to take the green spices and tomatoes purchased in Bamenda to sell in Douala where she believes she will make a larger profit.

This is Mary’s second loan from GHAPE. With the profits from her ventures, she plans to reinvest in her businesses to help them grow. She hopes that one day her income will grow enough that she will be able to help the poor increase their incomes as GHAPE and Kiva have helped her.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Second hand shoes, fowls, tomatoes and green spices

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Unité) Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi  est un regroupement de 10  femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et  4  enfants. Vivant dans des familles polygames avec les beaux parents, et autres parents du conjoint, elles résident dans le village de Yangasso de la préfecture de San(quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
L’activité dominante de ce groupe est la cuisson et la vente de farine de blé et des beignets de haricot. Dans le souci de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux ans. Après voir correctement remboursée les trois premiers prêts, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de groupe.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des sacs de farine de blé,  de haricot et des bidons d’huiles alimentaires auprès des grossistes du grand marché de Yangasso. Elles effectuent leurs ventes aux abords de l’artère principale du village à une clientèle composée essentiellement de routiers en détail et surtout au comptant. 
Ainsi avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 110 000FCFA. de bénéfice par cycle qu’elles utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans les activités. Dans un futur proche elles ambitionnent diversifier les plats alimentaires cuisinés.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of 10 women, all married and with an average age of 30 and, on average, 4 children. Living in polygamous families with parents-in-law and other relatives of their husbands, they reside in the village of Yangasso in the prefecture of San (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The main business of this group is the cooking and sale of wheat flour and bean fritters. In the interest of satisfying the demand of their ever-growing clientele, they decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. After having correctly reimbursed their first three loans, they are now on their fourth group loan.

This loan will be used to buy sacks of wheat flour, dried beans, and jerry cans of cooking oil from the wholesalers of the big open-air market of Yangasso. They sell their food by the side of the main road of the village to a clientele composed essentially of truckers and travelers, retail and mostly for cash.

Thus, with this new loan, they expect to make an average of 110,000 F CFA in profit per cycle which they will use to make payments on the loan, investing any remainder in their businesses. In the near future their ambition is to diversify the dishes that they cook for sale.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of raw materials for food service

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Mrs. Yong S., a villager in Thom Village in Kandal Province, is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. In her second plantation, she grows mushrooms. Since this plantation is going well, she wants grow more so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more mushroom seeds to cultivate in her field. Her husband, Mr. Yun Mo, is a fisherman who can catches a few fish to support the family. Mrs. Yong S. is 36 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom helps her in the field while the remaining three are attending the local school.

loans.use: to buy more mushroom seeds to cultivate in her field.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 37 años, vive con su único hijo, Neo, de 12 años, y con su madre anciana de 72 años; en la casa de su madre. Durante toda su vida de dedicó a labrar la tierra, se levanta a las 4.00am para preparar el desayuno y el almuerzo, antes de salir de casa rumbo a sus chacra les da de comer sus animales, cuyes y conejos que cría para cuando esté baja la venta de sus productos, vende estos animales. En esta oportunidad está sembrando papa y arvejas, para lo cual contrata a 10 o 12 peones a quienes les paga diario 15 soles, incluido el almuerzo.  Mientras tanto su madre e hijo pastean sus vacas que cría con la misma intención que sus conejos y cuyes. Una vez que termina de cultivar su chacra el resto de los días se dedica a pastar sus animales, María está muy contenta con su trabajo. Este es su 4to préstamo consecutivo que tiene con MFP, y todo este tiempo, aunque ella no tiene tiempo de asistir a las reuniones, las fechas cuando debe pagar las cuotas envía a su madre a la reunión para que pague su cuota y no caer en morosidad. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes e insecticidazas.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old and lives with her only son, 12 year old Neo, and her elderly 72 year old mother in her mother’s home. All her life she has farmed. She gets up at 4 AM to prepare breakfast and lunch before leaving her home on the way to her farm she feeds her animals – guinea pigs and rabbits that she raises so that when her products sales are low she sells these animals. At the moment she is planting potatoes and peas, for which she hires 10-12 workers whom she pays 15 soles daily, and includes lunch. Meanwhile her mother and son take care of the cows which she raises with the same purpose as the guinea pigs and rabbits. María is very content with her work. This is her 4th loan with MFP, and all this time, even though she didn’t have time to attend the meetings, the dates when she should make her payments she sends her mother to the meeting to pay her payment and not fall behind in her debt. The money she seeks will be used to buy fertilizer and insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es: Martha Irene O. L. tiene 46 años, está soltera, y no tiene hijos. Martha Irene le gustaría un préstamo para asegurar su futuro. Con un préstamo de Kiva, Martha Irene le gustaría desarrollar su venta de bisutería. Ella ha trabajada en esta manera hace 6 anos, y con el préstamo, le gustaría continuar con el desarrollo del negocio porque no existen negocios similares en su región. El propósito principal es que con el financiamiento pueda tener un ingreso, ya que cada día el costo de la vida está un poco más difícil. Martha Irene quiere un poco más tranquilidad en el pensamiento del futuro así que ella solo depende de su salario fijo. Ella va a pagar su préstamo de C$ 4,300.00 a 8 meses de plazo pagos mensuales.
texts.en:
Martha Irene O. L. is 46-years old, single, and doesn't have any children. She would like a loan to secure her future. With a loan from Kiva, Martha would like to develop her costume jewelery business. She has been running it for six years and with the loan she would continue developing the business, as there are no other competitors in the area. The primary purpose of the loan is to earn income, since every day the costs of living become a little more difficult to manage. Martha Irene wants a secure future, since she relies completely on her own wages. She will repay her loan of 4,300 NIO in eight monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Solaua

texts.en: Solaua T., 57, is married and has five children. She has two years of experience selling ice blocks. She sells to the school and villagers seven days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (~$62 USD). SPBD loans are Solaua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She has children who are working and help her financially.

loans.use: To buy supplies and materials for her business

loans.name: Los Comerciantes De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal, “LOS COMERCIANTES DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; son naturales del distrito de Andahuaylillas,  ubicado a 45 minutos en auto de la ciudad del Cusco.

Estos miembros son muy emprendedores y realizan diferentes actividades, en la mayoría de casos ellos se dedican a la compra y venta de semillas para sembrar en sus terrenos, tales como son (maíz, alfalfa, otros), otros socios especialmente las socias mujeres se dedican a la crianza de animales menores, (cuyes y aves de corral), uno que otro tiene diferentes negocios, cómo venta de CDs de música y películas,  la presidenta del grupo tiene una pequeña tienda y vende ropa; nuestros socios solicitan el préstamo para poder invertir en la implementación de sus negocios y así poder producir más y continuar con el deseo de ver a sus hijos realizar sus sueños y apoyarlos en cada etapa de sus vidas.

Los socios del banco comunal, agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado, así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de su préstamo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank “LOS COMERCIANTES DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS,” (Business people of Andahuaylillas) are from the district of Andahuaylillas, located 45 minutes by car from the city of Cuzco, Peru. These members are very hard-working and are involved in different activities. In the majority of cases they work selling and buying seeds ( such as corn, alfalfa and others), to plant on their land. Other members, especially the women, raise small animals (guinea pigs and poultry). A few have other businesses, such as selling music CD’s and movies. The president of the group has a small store and sells clothes. Our members are asking for a loan in order to be able to invest in the implementation of their businesses and thus be able to produce more and continue with the desire to see their children realize their dreams and support them at each stage of their lives. The members of the communal bank are thankful for and appreciate the loan being offered, and they commit themselves to following through with the payment of the loan in the time period allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of corn, seeds, and small animals

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Benkadi sont  toutes mariées avec en moyenne  35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers populaires de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente  de pomme de terre, de céréales, d’ orange et du bois de chauffe.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle et d’augmenter leur profit  elles  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont au troisième prêt solidaire  et les deux  précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce  prêt, elles comptent acheter, 30 sacs de pomme de terre , 20 sacs de 50 kg de céréales, deux chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe et 100 kg d’orange. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Médine, dans les villages environnants et au grand marché de Sikasso . 
Les marchandises sont vendues au comptant à la foire, dans les familles de  façon ambulante à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 28.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour payer la scolarité des enfants et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five women of the Benkadi group are all married and on average 35 years old with 4 children. They live in polygamous households in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class areas of Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They run various businesses which include among others the sale of potatoes, cereals, oranges, and firewood. In order to meet the rising demand of their clientele and to increase their profits, they are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are seeking their third solidarity (group) loan, and the two previous loans were repaid properly. With this loan, they intend to buy 30 sacks of potatoes, 20 50-kg sacks of cereals, 2 cartloads of firewood, and 100 kg of oranges. They supply themselves at the market in Médine, the neighbouring villages, and the grand market in Sikasso. Their merchandise is sold in cash at the market fairs and to families door-to-door, to a clientele composed of men and women. They foresee realizing an average monthly profit of 28,000 FCFA each, of which one portion will be used to pay for the schooling of their children, and the remaining portion invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Bai

texts.en:
This is Bai T., a local entrepreneur in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Bai sells house-building materials, chairs, and mats. He wants a loan in order to strengthen his business. With a loan, he will be able to buy bags of cement which are currently lacking in his shop.

Bai is thirty-two years of age, married to a businesswoman, and the two of them have four children together, all of whom are still in primary school. Bai was born in Makeni City and has been a businessman for four years now.

This will be the first loan Bai is accessing from Kiva through SMT. He chose to access a loan from Kiva in order to strengthen his business. From this business, Bai feeds his family, sends his children to school, and pays medical bills for members of his family.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es: El Señor Félix Pedro M. Z. tiene 44 años de edad. el es un hombre casado y tiene 2 hijos los cuales están bajo su cuidado y manutención. Don Félix es mecánico automotriz. desde hace 26 años, pues su papa fue quien le enseño este trabajo, por lo que esta es su actividad económica, y hace 20 años inició con un negocio de manera independiente, ha podido seguir con su comercio gracias a la ayuda de Fundación León 2000. Félix necesita este préstamo para invertir en su capital de trabajo y poder comprar equipos automotrices como taladros, esmeril y prensa. Su deseo es tener un taller más grande y acondicionado con equipos modernos y de alta tecnología.
texts.en:
Señor Félix Pedro M. Z. is 44, married, and has two children who still depend on him economically. Don Félix has been an automotive mechanic for 26 years. His father was the one who taught him this work. Twenty years ago, he opened his own business independently. He has been able to keep it going thanks to the help of Fundación León 2000. Félix needs this loan to invest in working capital so he can buy equipment like drills, files, and a press. His dream is to have a larger shop that is fixed up with modern and high-tech equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en: Trương Thị N. (20203050072) is a 51-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Trương is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 13 (13). Trương is married and has two adult children. She operates a family member's business raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over twelve years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month. Trương joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA and is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Nguyễn Thị B. (20203050073) is a 20-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. Trương V. T. (20203050074) is a 25-year-old male who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support his handicraft business. 3. Trương Thị T. (20203050075) is a 56-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 4. Trần Thị M. (20203050076) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Trương Thị N. (20203050072) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Trương là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 13 (13). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Trương thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Trương kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Trương đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Trương đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị B. (20203050073) là 20 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Trương V. T. (20203050074) là 25 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ. 3. Trương Thị T. (20203050075) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Trần Thị M. (20203050076) là 22 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
52-year-old Elma J. always prioritizes her family’s welfare. She always sees to it that their four children are provided with their basic needs and their tuition and school fees are met on time. Thus, together with her husband, Elma strives hard to improve their farm financing business. This way, they’ll be able to provide for these needs especially with greater expenses in the future.

As an active member of the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI), Elma is now asking for a loan of Php 10,000.00 to purchase fertilizer and other farming necessities. Elma is confident that with the help of God through CEVI, she and her husband will be able to improve their family’s financial status.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming necessities

loans.name: Gavina

texts.en: Gavina M. is from the village of Duanguican, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, married, and has nine adult children. Gavina owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising hogs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Gavina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Gavina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate A. sells smoked fish at Nyayeye, which she has done since 2006. She is a widow and has four dependants. She has received schooling through senior high school. Kate uses her income to pay for school fees and other bills. Kate will use this loan to purchase more fish for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Kate plans to save and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 56years old and married with 7 children. She sells provisions. She has been in the business for the past 15 years. She is requesting for a loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam A., a 42-year-old woman from Brgy 25, Purok 5, Gingoog City, is married and has six school-age children. To make a living, Meriam runs a food stall selling specialty food products in her community. Meriam has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In February 2009, Meriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meriam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Meriam is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Meriam's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Barangay 24, Purok 5, Gingoog City, Misamis Orient

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.es:
Nuestro socio se llama Jean Paul, el vive en la urb. Santa Beatriz B-4, el pertenece al banco comunal  grupo esperanza.

El socio tiene 37 años de edad, el es soltero y tiene i hijo, nuestro socio es un hombre trabajador y el amor absoluto a su pequeño hijo, lo hace trabajar de sol a sol, el alterna todas sus actividades con el comercio minorista, nuestro socio se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños. El socio requiere el préstamo para usarlo como capital de trabajo, con este dinero el lo reinvertirá en comprar mayor cantidad de ropa y así mismo venderlas.

Nuestro socio se encuentra sumamente agradecido por el apoyo brindado y se compromete en cumplir con el pago en el plazo estipulado.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 35 year old mother of two who runs a grocery business in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. She has been in this business for three years and hopes to grow it into a wholesale supplier of other retail businesses and to employ other people. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 15,000 to buy cabbage, carrots, butternuts, sukumawiki (kale), and tomatoes.

Flora describes herself as hardworking, business-minded, and empowered. She believes she will achieve her dream to be a great businesswoman and employer.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Kiganda 4 Namakula Rose Group

texts.en:
N. Rose, the group leader, is 30 years old. She is married, with 3 children in school.

For over two years, N. has had a retail shop that sells items such as sugar, rice, salt, and internet air time. She is an active business woman whose dream is to be a good example to her community and her family.

N. is requesting this loan in order to stock more items in her shop in order. She hopes to meet her customers’ needs and thereby expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase stock (such as sugar, rice, salt, and internet air time) to sell at a retail shop.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
Khon C., 39 and his wife, Sambo Mut, 30, (pictured) live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2006, and have two children. Unfortunately, one of their children died. Sambo's sister and father live with them.

Khon has been a locksmith and has repaired watches for ten years. His wife stays at home and does housework. He is requesting his first loan of $700 to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his locksmith and watch repairing business

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en: Mhammad is a 55-year-old man who lives in Saida southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Mhammad has been working as a carpenter since 1980. Mhammad requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase a machine for his work. This machine will help him improve his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. Mhammad is speciA. in his work because he is good at his job since he has a lot of experience. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mhammad decided on this business because he learned it when he was young. In the future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for his work.

loans.name: Rosa Narcisa

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo se encuentra en la ciudad de Azogues,  a unos 30 minutos de la ciudad de Cuenca, Azogues tiene 32.000 habitantes y es la capital de la provincia de Cañar, ubicada en el sur de al misma. A 50 km de Azogues se encuentran las ruinas de Ingapirca, uno de los sitios más visitados del Ecuador. Azogues y Cañar son famosos por su artesanía, especialmente por la manufacturación de los sombreros de paja toquilla y sus productos cerámicos.

La Sra. Rosa C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, tiene ya dos ciclos de crédito con la fundación, vive en la ciudad de Azogues por el centro de su ciudad, tiene 42 años de edad, se encuentra casada y su esposo no se encuentra en el país ya que emigro para darles un mejor futuro a su familia, no tiene casa propia y vive arrendando, en su unión conyugal ha procreado 2 hijas que se encuentran de 22 y 18 años de edad, su primera hija ya egreso de la universidad y ahora es Ing. En Sistemas y su segunda hija se encuentra estudiando en la universidad Politécnica.

Rosa trabaja como empleado en un almacén de ropa, labora en este local hace 20 años y también forma parte del negocio familiar que es un puesto de revistas y periódicos, siendo parte de este negocio hace 4 años, el local donde se encuentra el negocio de la familia es arrendado y como el puesto de revistas se encuentra frente del local de ropa donde labora solo trabaja horas en el negocio familiar, los prestamos que le han entregado en la fundación lo ha invertido en el negocio de revistas permitiéndole seguir incrementando el mismo.
texts.en:
The community bank Mujeres de Trabajo (Working Women) is located in the city of Azogues, some 30 minutes from the city of Cuenca. Azogues has 32,000 inhabitants and is the capital of the province of Cañar, located in the south. The ruins of Ingapirca, one of the most visited attractions of Equador, lie just 50 km from Azogues. Azogues and Cañar are famous for their artesanal work, especially for the manufacture of straw hats, shawls and ceramic products. Rosa C. is a member of Mujeres de Trabajo and has already gone through two loan cycles with the foundation. She is 42 years old, lives in the city of Azogues in the city centre and is married. Her husband does not live in the country as he emigrated to give his family a better future. She does not have her own house but lives in a rented one. She has produced 2 daughters from her marriage who are 22 and 18 years of age. Her first daughter has already finished university and is now a Systems Engineer, and her second daughter is studying in a Polytechnic university. Rosa has worked as an employee in a clothing department store for 20 years, and for the last four years has taken part in running a magazine and newspaper stand which forms part of the family business. The store where the magazine stand is located is rented and as it is in front of the clothing department store she can only work some hours there. Rosa has invested the previous loans that the foundation has granted her in the magazine stall, which has allowed her to continue increasing this business.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase magazines, lottery tickets, scratchies, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza Cobo, nació hace 53 años en San Gil, Santander, pueblo  de gente amable, alegre y con una fuerte vocación comercial;  es una mujer activa, que  forma parte de la  Junta de Acción comunal de la localidad y  es delegada  de la Asociación que rige a las estructuras comunitarias de la ciudad; incursionó como comerciante  en el Popular Barrio Montes desde hace mas de cinco años, tiempo en el que se vinculó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el deseo de formarse empresarialmente y obtener financiación  para vender productos a través de  catalogo. Desde esta época la Fundación le ha otorgado 4 (cuatro) créditos gradualmente aumentados al ser reembolsados; hace dos años, aprovecho la oportunidad de tener un negocio mas estable, pues su hermano por motivos de viaje  le cedió un local dotado de vitrinas y estantería en calidad de arriendo pero sin mercancía; en este sitio inició una droguería combinada con  variedades y la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  le otorgó su segundo crédito por valor de $1.500.000  para ser cancelado en un plazo de 12 meses, con él surtió la droguería y muy pronto sus ingresos empezaron a incrementarse, debido al volumen de ventas que obtuvo, lo cual  le exigió dedicarse completamente a esta actividad; con esta experiencia ha fortalecido su desempeño comercial; su capacidad de observación y formación permanente le ha facilitado identificar un mercado potencial de productos de papelería, hacia el cual planea dirigir su estrategia de ampliación mercadologica. 

Su próximo préstamo de $ 2.300.000, lo emplearía en un 50% para comprar medicamentos alopáticos comunes, suplementos dietarios; cosméticos; productos de tocador, higiénicos y el otro 50% lo invertirá en compra de artículos de papelería, como lápices, cartulinas, hojas, bolígrafos, fólderes resaltadores, cuadernos agendas, portámemos, sacapuntas, papel periódico, carpetas,  CDS, tarjetas, reglas, juegos de oficina, considerado como su plan inmediato de mercadeo.

 Las condiciones de vida de Esperanza han mejorado notablemente; con sus esfuerzos su único hijo ha logrado estudiar y sostenerse en la facultad de música  en la Universidad del Atlántico, él es su máxima motivación, su sueño inmediato es que se convierta en un profesional, su próximo desafío es ampliar su negocio, arrendando un local contiguo a su negocio. Ella  aun vive en la casa paterna, es separada  y sus padres necesitan de su compañía. Su preocupación es la innovación constante, ajustada al requerimiento del mercado, pues siempre esta atenta en ofrecer a la clientela lo que la temporada exige, conoce perfectamente la estacionalidad  de cada grupo de los productos que vende y el comportamiento de su oferta se rige  por  los picos de alta comercialización individual.
texts.en:
Esperanza Cobo was born 53 years ago in San Gil, Santander. It is a town with affable, happy people and strong commercial activity. She is an active woman who is part of the Junta de Acción Communal in the area. She is a delegate to the Association that governs the community structures in the city. She started working as a businesswoman in the popular neighborhood of Montes over five years ago. During that time she connected with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in the hopes of getting business training and a loan to sell products by catalog. From that time on the Foundation has given her four loans. They were gradually increased as they were reimbursed. Two years ago she took advantage of the opportunity of having a more stable business. Her brother, because of travel, gave her a place in rental condition outfitted with display cases and shelves but without merchandise. She set up a drugstore with variety items at this place. The Mario Santo Domingo Foundation gave her the second loan for 1,5000,000 COP, which was to be repaid in 12 months. When the drugstore was stocked, her earnings started to increase very quickly. Her volume of sales required her to devote herself completely to this activity. This experience has strengthened her business performance. Her capacity to observe and the permanent formation of her business have allowed her to identify a potential market for paper products. She is planning to direct her strategy towards increasing her merchandise. She will use 50% of her next loan for 2,300,000 COD for common allopathic medicine, dietary supplements, toiletries, and hygiene products. She will use the other 50% to buy stationery items like pencils, cardboard, sheets of paper, pens, folders, highlighters, notebooks, agendas, memos, pencil sharpeners, newspapers, binders, CDs, cards, and office sets. This is her merchandise plan for now. Esperanza’s life conditions have notably improved. Through her efforts she has been able to support her only child, and he has been able to study music at the Atlántico University. He is her greatest motivation. Her immediate dream is that he becomes a professional. Her next challenge is to expand her business by renting the location next to her business. She still lives in her father’s house. She is separated, and her parents need her company. She worries constantly about innovation and adjusting to the market’s requirements. She always attempts to offer her customers the seasonal requirements. She knows perfectly the seasonal conditions for each group of products that she sells. Her offers are governed by the peaks of seasonal customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her drugstore and for her stationery business

loans.name: Mrs. Sovann Ung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
A village bank loan to a group led by Mrs. Sovann U. is located in Prey Theat village in TaK. province. This village bank loan is to a group consisting of nine people and they will each be using the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sovann U. is a livestock breeder who raises pigs and chickens. Since this business is doing well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food for her pig breeding. Her husband, Mr. Sytha Sean, is a laborer in the local village and he earns a small income for supporting his family. Mrs. Sovann U. is the mother of five children, three of whom are attending the local school while two children are too yoU. to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food for pig breeding

loans.name: Las Viviendas 2 Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Viviendas 2” esta representado por la señora María  Luisa y conformada por 13 miembros que son padres de familia, que trabajan constantemente, para  poder sacar adelante a sus familias con sus negocios, son personas responsables y solidA. como lo han demostrado en lo seis ciclos que llevan juntas se conocen muy bien y saben que son gente trabajadora y emprendedora y por eso continúan juntas. Entre las actividades que realizan son las siguientes esta la venta de comida, costura de prendas de vestir, venta de ropa, venta de refrescos, pan , abarrotes, cosméticos y empanadas, entre los varones se dedican a  la refacción de aires acondicionados así como la reparación de refrigeradores y otros electrodomésticos. Dentro del ámbito competitivo podemos mencionar que no  tienen dificultades donde ellos ofrecen sus productos y sus servicios diariamente la ubicación de sus negocios son en lugares estratégicos de la cuidad de montero donde ellos tienen clientes fieles por tener años de experiencia en el rubro a que cada una de las socias se dedican, en  los casos de los hombres que se dedican a la prestación de servicios de reparación de aires acondicionados donde tienen convenios con instituciones durante una gestión completa por lo que no tienen ninguna dificultad económica. El crédito lo utilizaran,  en mejorar sus viviendas y negocios, la compra de insumos y materiales para la elaboración del pan, masitas, empanadas y salteñas, así como la compra de herramientas y equipos que ayuden a mejorar el servicio que brindan, algunas de las socias desean invertir en negocios nuevos con nueva mercadería para ofrecer.  Sus expectativas a futuro son ver sus negocios llenos de mercadería que se pueda vender y prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así generar mejores ingresos para poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida y mejorar sus productos acorde a las nuevas exigencias del mercado. La gran mayoría de los clientes tienen mucha experiencia de trabajar bajo la modalidad de banca comunal, este grupo es muy responsable por que si una clienta falta o se atrasa todo el grupo cubre la cuota de la persona, dando a conocer que ellos entienden y conocen la solidaridad y la unidad  que se requiere para ser un grupo solidario.
texts.en:
The group “Las Viviendas 2” is led by Sra. María Luisa and consists of thirteen members who are working parents who strive relentlessly to support their families through their businesses. They are responsible and cooperative people who have demonstrated in their previous six loan cycles that they are capable of working together. Now that they have had the chance to get to know each other well through their hard work, they look forward to continuing together as a group. Among the retail businesses represented are the sale of food, handmade dresses, clothing, soft drinks, bread, groceries, cosmetics, and empanadas. The men are engaged in the repair of air conditioners, refrigerators, and other appliances. With regard to the competitive environment, the members do have any difficulties because they offer their products and services every day from strategic locations throughout the city. Many of them have a loyal clientele that they have established as a result of many years of experience. For example, the members who provide air conditioning services do not face financial difficulty because they have agreements with institutions to provide comprehensive maintenance.

This loan will be used to improve their home and businesses. The members will purchase supplies and materials for making bread, snacks, empanadas, and salteñas, as well as tools and equipment to improve the services they provide. Others wish to invest in new businesses by acquiring a variety of merchandise to offer. Their expectations for the future are to see their businesses well–stocked so that they can provide better service to their customers and improve their product offerings so that they can keep up with new market demands, which will help them earn more income so that they can provide a better quality of life for their families. Most of the members are experienced in working as part of a solidarity group. They are aware that the entire Communal Bank is responsible for any shortfalls caused by any member who is late or fails to make a payment. In addition, they know that it takes cooperation and unity to work together as a solidarity group.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Nayef

texts.en: Nayef is a 23-year-old single man. He has 2004 done sanitary work; it’s related to repairing toilets, faucets etc. Nayef is very happy with his occupation and he's grateful for his revenue.  Nayef is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase a speciA. compressor for his work in addition of some tools because he's planning to take the step and enlarge his business by taking more projects and being known by a grand number of customers and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: purchase a special compressor for his work in addition of some tools

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Esmeralda se encuentra el el ciclo Nº14, es decir que ya tiene como siete años formando parte del Centro Focal de German Busch.  Son once integrantes, 10 mujeres y un varon.
Los negocios de los integrantes de la asociación van desde venta de celulares, venta de comida, frituras (papas fritas), tejidos a máquina, venta de abarrotes, venta de ropa, artesanía en ropa, ropa, tejido de alfombras.

En el caso de la presidenta, la señora Margot G. de 40 años de edad, ella tiene el negocio de venta de celulares desde hace unos diez años.  Cuando se le pregunta de cómo se animó a iniciar ese negocio, ella dice que era necesario, pues tenìa muchos hijos (4 varones y 2 mujeres).  Actualmente continua con la compra – venta de celulares con el apoyo de su esposo, en las diferentes ferias del la ciudad de El Alto.
texts.en:
The Esmeralda communal bank is in its 14th loan cycle; that is, it has been part of the German Busch Focal Center for about 7 years. It has 11 members, 10 women and one man. They are engaged in a wide range of commercial enterprises, such as: the sale of cell phones, food, French fries, machine-woven articles, grocery sales, clothing sales, craftsmaking, rug weaving. The group president, Margot Gonzalez, 40, is a case in particular. She has sold cell phones for about 10 years now. When she was asked what motivated her to go into this line of work, she stated that it was necessary because she had many children (4 boys and 2 girls). Currently, she continues as a cell phone merchant, together with her husband, in the various markets in the city of El Alto.
