Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For semi-new and new cell phones.

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita S. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 57 years old. Expedita is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Expedita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Expedita has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Expedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Expedita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her store. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie B. is from the village of Barina-ut, Iligan City. She is 34 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Rosalie owns and operates a specialized retail business, peddling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community with the used of their motor vehicle. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: José Domingo

texts.es: José Domingo L. M. de 44 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de Quezaltepeque, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a sus cuatro hijos de 14, 11, 10, y 7 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. José comercializa carbón, el cual distribuye en los diferentes puestos del Mercado Central, un lugar en el cual todo se vende por mayor, por lo que él cuenta con una gran ventaja, así mismo se dedica a hacer viajes para otras personas y de esta manera transportar verduras o frutas al mercado, por lo que obtiene ganancias diarias por parte de los clientes fijos. José solicita un préstamo para poder comprar leña con la cual hace el carbón que posteriormente comercializa, de manera que pueda hacer mayor cantidad y así tener mucho más que ofrecerles a sus clientes. Este negocio es de mucha importancia para José ya que es gracias a el que puede llevar el sustento diario hasta su hogar.
texts.en:
Jose Domingo Lopez M. is 44 years old and he lives in the village of Quezaltepeque, logcated in the La Libertad region. He lives together with his wife and their four children, aged 14, 11, 10 and 7 years. They are all going to school. Jose sells carbon, distributing to various stands in the Central market, a place where everything is sold in wholesale, which he considers a great advantage. He also transports fruits and vegetables for other businesses in the market, earning him a second income aside from his regular clients. Jose requests a loan to be able to purchase wood to make coal for later resale. This way he will be able to make a greater quantity and have that much more to offer his clients. His business is very important to Jose. Thanks to his business he is able to meet the daily demands of his household.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood.

loans.name: Tuungane Group

texts.fr:
Kavira B. J. est présidente du groupe de crédit  Tuungane, elle lève sa main sur la photo,  âgée de 48 ans, veuve, mère de 5 enfants, parmi les quels 3 ont leurs propres foyers et 2 étudient. Son mari est décédé, il y a 2 ans suite à une longue maladie. Pendant tout ce temps, elle supporte seule la charge de ses enfants orphelins.
Kavira B. J. vend en gros des poissons fumés et frais  au marché central de Virunga, elle a  commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre, gain  de 100$ (profit) d’une petite commission. A ce moment là, elle vivait encore à Vitshumbi, pêcherie située au long  du lac (cote Ouest du lac Virunga) anciennement appelé lac Edouard. Elle fut commissionnaire, intermédiaire, facilitateur entre les acheteurs des poissons en provenance de la ville de Bukavu (sud Kivu) et les pêcheurs exploitants de Vitshumbi. Il y a 22 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité de vente des poissons. 
Avec  le crédit  de  l’IMF Hekima, Kavira B. J. souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 200 poissons environs 2 paniers des poissons fumés et 400 poissons frais environs 3 paniers. Le grand défi de cette activité est la perte due à la pourriture des boissons. Sur ce, elle compte acheter un congélateur (frigo). Pour sa famille, Kavira B. J. souhaite scolariser régulièrement ses enfants orphelins et les voir obtenir leurs diplômes pour qu’ils soient utiles à eux-mêmes et pour la société.
Dans l’avenir, Kavira B. J. planifie construire une maison  de 4 chambres dans sa parcelle, qu’elle mettra à location pour  augmenter son revenu.
Kavira B. J. remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. 
Ce groupe Tuungane  est  composé de 14 membres  femmes.
texts.en:
Kavira B. J. is president of the Tuungane loan group, and it is her raising her hand on the photo. She is a 48-year old widow and mother to five children, three of whom have their own homes and two who are students. Her husband passed away two years ago after a long illness. During all this time she has been the sole provider for her fatherless children. Kavira sells smoked and fresh fish on a wholesale basis at the central market in Virunga. She began her small business with her own funds, a profit of $100 from a small commission. At that time she still lived in Vitshumbi, a fishing village situated alongside the west coast of Lake Verunga (known previously as Lake Edouard). She was delivery girl, intermediary and assistant to fish buyers coming from the town of Bukavi (south Kivu) and the fish farmers in Vitshumbi. She has been carrying out this fish selling business for the past 22 years. With the loan from IMF Hekima, Kavira would like to increase her turnover by buying 200 or approximately two baskets of smoked fish and 400 or approximately three baskets of fresh fish. The main challenge of this activity is not to lose fish as a result of them rotting. For this reason she would like to buy a freezer. As far as her family is concerned, Kavira would like to send her fatherless children to school on a regular basis and see them get their diplomas so that they can do something useful for themselves and for society. In the future, Kavira is planning to build a house with four bedrooms on her patch of land, which she will rent out in order to increase her income. Kavira is grateful to IMF Hekima for her loans which she obtains without any material guarantee, since thanks to these loans she is able to provide for the needs of her children. The Tuungane group is made up of 14 female members.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 200 smoked fish and 400 fresh fish

loans.name: Portia's Group

texts.en:
Portia P. is from the village of Magsaysay Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Portia is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Millions.

Portia is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Portia owns & operates a retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as candies, can goods, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Portia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Portia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Portia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Portia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Portia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou G., age 40, is from the village of Rang-Ayan. She and her husband have three school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou runs a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marilou is now requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items, with the goal of expanding her store's product offering. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items in order to expand her store's product offering

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is from the town of Poblacion, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 34 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Elizabeth owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia C. is a 53-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Lower Natimao-an, Carmen Cebu City. She earns a living by running a tailoring business. Nemesia’s husband, Sotero, is 54 years old and a carpenter. They have six children aged between 19 and 36 years old. All of their children have their own families.
Nemesia joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, Nemesia has been able to increase her family income. She now earns an average monthly profit of 2,500 PHP from her business activities.
Nemesia is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 11,000 PHP was used to purchase a motorcycle, which she and her husband use for the business, and it has made life a little bit easier for them. Now she is borrowing her fifth loan for the amount of 14,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business. Nemesia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Haciendo Un Mundo Mejor (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Haciendo un mundo Mejor esta formado por 13 mujeres que con el trabajo diario buscan mejorar el porvenir de sus familias,  se dedican a varias labores  con un fin en común, el de mejorar la economía de sus familias. Viven por distintos lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica,  su  centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

La Señora Carmen Merchán vive por la parroquia de Turi comunidad Santa Anita, es su primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia; se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos vendiendo sus animales en las ferias de la ciudad, para mejorar mas la economía de su hogar hace 7 meses ha empezado a trabajar en una guardería, laborando de lunes a viernes de 8 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m.
Nuestra socia tiene 26 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 8, 6, 4 y 2 años de edad,  sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo se dedica a la construcción ya que es albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
Ahora con su primer crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y su alimento. Su meta es tener agua potable en su casa y también desea crecer  en su negocio.

La Señora María Q. vive por la parroquia de Turi comunidad Santa Anita, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene 10 hijos de los cuales  5 son casados y viven de manera independiente, 4 son solteros que trabajan y le ayudan económicamente en  su hogar y su última hija este año ingresa al colegio, su esposo trabaja en la área de la construcción como albañil, gracias al trabajo en conjunto han logrado tener su casa propia.
Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de animales como: pollos, chanchos y vacas que le dan leche que consume y vende,  también se dedica a la agricultura sembrando hortalizas como: lechugas, zanahorias vendiendo su producto en las ferias de la ciudad.
Es su primer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para sus chanchos y también desea  hacer una chanchera, su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank known as 'Making a Better World' is made up of 13 women that seek to improve the future of their families with their daily work. They are dedicated to several business with an end in common; that of improving the economy of their families. They live in different areas of the city of Cuenca, a city that is recognized for its architectural beauty. Its historic center was declared a world heritage by Unesco in the year 1999. Señora Carmen Merchán lives in the Turi parish of the community of Santa Anita. This is her first loan that she has requested from the communcal bank. She was invited by a friend who is an associate. She is dedicated to raising chickens and pigs, selling her animals in the markets of the city. To improve the economy of her home, she began working an a preschool 7 months ago, laboring from Monday to Friday from 8 to.m. to the 4 p.m. Our associate is 26 years old. She is married and has 4 children ages 8, 6, 4 and 2 years. Her two first children study in a school of the city. Her husband is dedicated to construction since he is a bricklayer. With their combined work they have managed to build their own house. Now with her first loan she is going to invest it in the purchase of chickens and food for them. Her goal is to have drinking water in her house and she also desires to grow her business. Señora María Q. lives in the Turi parish of the community of Santa Anita. She is 53 years of age, married and has 10 children of which 5 are married and live independently, 4 are single and work to help economically in her home and her last daughter enters school this year. Her husband works in the area of construction as a bricklayer. Thanks to their combined work they have managed to have their own house. Our associate is dedicated to the raising of animals such as: chickens, pigs and cows that give milk which she both consumes and sells. She is also dedicated to agriculture, sowing vegetables like lettuce and carrots and selling her product in the markets of the city. This is her first loan and she is going to invest it in the purchase of food for her pigs and also she desires to buy a sow. Her goal is to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, pigs and feed

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en:
V. Inobat is 29 years old, divorced and has one young child. She has run her own business for the last five years, a small store where people buy shampoos, detergents, toothpaste, brushes and other items. Inobat is very friendly and polite, which makes her customers very loyal. She is applying for a loan for $3,000 to buy more goods to sell to her customers. She is committed to repay her loan on time and extends her sincerest thanks to everyone who decides to support her. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Zulaikhan's Group

texts.en:
Zulaikhan is a resident of a small city called Chichawatni, which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is well known for its agriculture industry. 

She is 28 years old and got married when she was only 16. She is the mother of six daughters. None of them could get an education because Zulaikhan and her husband didn’t have enough resources to pay for their school fees.
 
Her husband is illiterate. He sells clothes and is the only breadwinner in the family. He operates his small shop in the market. He imports clothes from Multan, Lahore and Faisalabad and sells them through his shop. 

Life is not easy for Zulaikhan and her family as her husband’s income is not enough for fulfilling the basic needs of the family. Therefore, Zulaikhan has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy clothes in bulk to reduce the cost of traveling and to offer more variety to his clients.

Zulaikhan hopes that this investment will help her husband in improving his business and her family will be able to improve its living standard. She is a new loan applicant and she is expecting that it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for a clothes-selling business

loans.name: Hivadat

texts.en:
Hivadat M. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and seven children in Bayan-Ulgiy province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest two children are students while the other five children attend a local school. His wife works as a private businesswoman.

Hivadat operates an iron-crafting business in his town. He started his business in 1998 by producing only horseshoes but since then he expanded his product line to include a variety of chimneys and stovepipes. He has gained a many years of work experience as a blacksmith.

Hivadat's business earnings have enabled him to support his entire big family. He is a very modest and honest person. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more iron and steel in order to make his products.

loans.use: To purchase more iron and steel

loans.name: Evangeline Esperanza

texts.en:
Evangeline Esperanza F. is from the village of Namabbalan Norte, Tuguegarao City. She is 26 years old. Evangeline Esperanza is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Evangeline Esperanza owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Evangeline Esperanza has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evangeline Esperanza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline Esperanza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Evangeline Esperanza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Delgertsogt

texts.en:
Delgertsogt E., 28, lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Tuv Province, Mongolia. His oldest daughter, age 7, attends local primary school, while his youngest son, age 4, is in kindergarten. Delgertsogt and his wife own a second-hand raw material trading business in their town, buying raw materials locally and selling the materials in the reprocessing factories for a profit. In addition, he is a welder and makes a variety of steel/iron doors according to customers' orders to supplement his earnings.

With his earnings, Delgertsogt has been able to start building a house. He would like to one day own his own supermarket where he could sell a variety of consumer goods and grocery products. A modest, honest and hardworking man, Delgertsogt is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital and build a new house that will used as a service center.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Liza Fe

texts.en:
Mrs. Liza Fe A. is from the Barangay of Culpan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, married, and blessed with two children, both of whom are students. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (retail) store. Liza Fe has been running this business for the past eight years, and she earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

Liza Fe joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) in April 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. An active member of PMPC under the PDP-LP Program, a microfinance program that reaches out the rural communities, she has repaid a previous 5,000 PHP loan. Liza Fe is now requesting her third loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to be used as additional capital for her store.

Liza Fe plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family, save for the future, make loan repayments and pay for her children’s education, along with paying for insurance and possible business expansion.


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for retail (sari-sari) store

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
El Señor Nicolás V. Cáceres es soltero y no tiene hijos, desde muy pequeño el trabajo para subsistir ya que sus padres fallecieron cuando él era muy joven, su hermano mayor fue padre y madre para él, hace como unos 6 años que el se independizo vive solo y trabaja para tener un futuro muy prospero, él trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato “CARRASCO” en la localidad de Puerto Ivirgarzama, en el cual esta hace mas de 4 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y mejorar el servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.

 Cabe señalar que el señor Nicolás V. Cáceres se apersono a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le  comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución
texts.en:
Sr. Nicolás V. Cáceres is single and does not have children. From an early age, he had to work to support himself since his parents died when he was a very young. His older brother served as both father and mother to him. Six years ago he began living on his own and working to have a more prosperous future. Nicolás works as a motorcycle taxi driver for the Carrasco union in the town of Puerto Ivirgarzama. He has been an active member for more than four years. The service he provides is profitable since many people request this form of transportation because of its ease, speed, and efficiency. The union has designated stops and routes for each of its members in different parts of Ivirgarzama where people request transportation services.

This is the first loan Nicolás has obtained from CIDRE and he will use the funds to purchase a new motorcycle. He has already completed a work cycle and can now improve service to his customers. This will allow him to earn more income and improve his quality of life.

It should be noted that Sr. Nicolas C. V. showed up to apply for a loan after his co-workers informed him about the good credit terms that CIDRE offers.

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Bwashwa Tukore Group A, Kihihi

texts.en: M. Amos is the leader of his lending group, Bwashwa Tukore A. He is 41 years old and married with eight children. He has a tea growing and selling business, from which he is able to make 150,000 shillings as monthly profits. M. also owns banana and coffee plantations, which continue to give him an income after sales. Just like many farmers, Amos has been selling his tea leaves to the factory in the area for over 10 years. He is a determined and focused man with a dream to expand his business further.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es: Claudia Carolina B. V. de 26 años d edad, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como agricultor, y así mismo junto a su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad. Claudia posee una venta de  productos alimenticios y de primera necesidad para el hogar, tales como: pan, huevos, leche, granos básicos y otros más, así mismo se dedica a la elaboración de platillos típicos para comercializar. El negocio cuenta con muy buena ubicación y se encuentra en su casa de habitación, esto le beneficia en gran manera, ya que le permite contar con muchos clientes fijos, ya que es un lugar el cual siempre esta lleno de muchas personas. Claudia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda incrementar sus productos, de manera que pueda ofrecer más a sus clientes. Este negocio es de mucha importancia para ella ya que es una fuente de ingresos fija con la que cuenta.
texts.en:
Claudia Carolina B. V. is 26 years old.  She lives with her husband who works as a farmer.  She has a young child who is 2 years old.  Claudia sells food products and basic household products such as bread, eggs, milk, basic grains, etc.  She also makes traditional meals to sell.  Her business is quite well located and is in her home.  This helps her a lot as it means that she has a lot of regular customers since this is an area that is always full of people.

Claudia is requesting a loan so that she can increase her products and offer more to her customers.  This business is very important to her because it is a regular source of income that she relies on.

loans.use: To buy basic household products

location.town: Opico en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Uldarico

texts.es: Uldarico, de 30 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Jamil de 8 y Yadira de 4 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de cultivo han sido en la vida de Uldarico, una actividad necesaria para vivir, ya que desde muy pequeño sus padres siempre le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra, es por eso que decidió continuar con esta labor familiar y ahora tiene sus propios cultivos, donde tiene sembrados café, cacao y hojas de coca, los cuales una vez cosechados llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende la tranquilidad de su familia, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de los cambios bruscos del clima, ya que eso afecta mucho su productividad. Para más adelante, desea seguir trabajando duro y mejorando sus cultivos. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Uldarico, 30, is an unassuming, hard working man living in his own house with his two beloved children, Jamil, 8, and Yadira, 4, to whom he wants to provide a better quality of life.

Uldarico has spent his life farming, an activity that is necessary to live.  His parents taught him farming since he was a little boy so he decided to continue with this family activity and now has his own coffee, cocoa bean and coca leaf crops which he sells in the city of San Francisco’s market when he harvests them.

What he enjoys most about his work is planting because he knows that his family’s tranquility depends upon this activity.  He has been farming for 10 years and considers the most difficult part to be safeguarding his crops from brusque weather changes since this affects yields quite a bit.  He’d like to continue working hard improving his crops.

This is his 6th loan with MFP.  He knows that the contribution will be beneficial for his activity’s development.  He is a very responsible member of his communal bank which makes him highly respected.

He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy manure and insecticide to improve his crops.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides.

loans.name: María Victoria

texts.es: María Victoria Z. D. G. D. 48 años D. edad, resiD. en Lourdes Colón, en el departamento D. La Libertad, junto a su esposo y una hija D. 18 años D. edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. María con el gran deseo D. brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su esposa, posee un negocio D. venta D. ropa para hombres, mujeres, jóvenes y niños, así mismo zapatos, los cuales comercializa en su casa D. habitación desD. hace 20 años atrás. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. prendas D. vestir, zapatos tanto deportivos como formales, D. manera que pueda contar con una gran variedad D. ropa para final e inicio del año, fechas en las cuales las ventas se aumentan. María es una persona muy responsable quien cuento con todo el deseo D. seguir adelante y tener una vida mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en: María Victoria Z. D. G., 48, lives in Lourdes Colón, La Libertad Department, with her husband and and 18 year old daughter who is in school. María, in order to give her husband all the help she can, has had a business in her home for the last 20 years selling clothing for men, women, children, and infants, as well as shoes.  María is requesting a loan to enable her to purchase a larger quantity of articles of clothing plus sporting and formal shoes, so she can have a good variety of clothing for the end of this year and the new year, a time when her sales always increase.  María is a very responsible person who has a great desire to get ahead, to have a better life for her family.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for sale

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ingrid Sarai

texts.es:
Ingrid, de 31 años de edad, es madres soltera de dos niños menores de edad, los que con sacrificio los ha sacado adelante, es una persona humilde, muy trabajadora, con animos de superacion, se dedica a la actividad comerciante vendiendo mercaderia de ropa, cosmeticos entre otros; de donde obtiene sus ingresos para brindar el pan de cada dia a sus pequeños, ademas cuenta con la ayuda economica del padre de sus hijos, lo cual permite cumplir con sus compromisos de pago fuera de los gastos basicos del hogar.

Ha mejorado su vivienda con creditos, por lo que agradece a Kiva por este apoyo y a la vez  solicita 2do credito para invertir en su pequeño negocio y cubrir con la demanda del mismo, de igual forma esto le permitira crecer en el mercado de la competencia y de esta manera obeter mayores ingresos.  

Su mayor sueño es brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos, que estudien y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 31 years old.  She is a single mother with two dependent children.  Through a lot of sacrifice, she has managed to get her children ahead in life.

Ingrid is an unassuming and very hard-working person who has a desire to improve herself.  Her business is selling clothes, cosmetics and other products.  It is from these business activities that Ingrid makes the necessary income to provide for her children.  She receives financial help from her children's father which allows her to cover her loan repayments at the same time as covering her basic household expenses.

Ingrid has improved her home through loans and she is grateful to Kiva for this support.  She is currently requesting her second loan to invest in her small business and to cover the demand that she has.  This will allow her to grow in her business, to deal with the competition, and to make more profits. 

Ingrid's biggest dream is to provide her children with the best in life.  She would like them to study and to become good people.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her small business

loans.name: Jawas Pankarita Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “JAWAS PANKARITA” (en idioma Aymara quiere decir Flor de Haba) iniciará su  ciclo número catorce en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch.  Estas señoras  se han reunido para solicitar crédito y recibir servicios en salud y capacitación. Siendo una asociación comunal con recorrido, se observa que varias de las socias son antiguas, pero tambien hay socias con pocos ciclos o son nuevas. Las asociación comunal "Jawas Pankarita" está compuesta por ocho integrantes, en la foto se ven diez personas, porque, la señora de chamarra ploma que se encuentra al fondo y la señora de manta a cuadros ploma y blanca, pollera rosada, son socias que este ciclo descansarán. 

Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados:  costura de ropa, elaboración de enaguas, venta de Batidos, tejido y trensado, comercio de mantas, venta de mantas y alfombras, hilado de lana y alpaca.

La A.C. “JAWAS PANKARITA” está dirigida por una mesa directiva, la señora Gladys es la presidenta, la señora Lidia es la tesorera y la señora Verónica es la secretaria de actas. 
La señora Gladys, presidenta de la banca comunal, indica que ya tiene seis ciclos como socia de Pro Mujer.  Conoció de los servicios de la institución a través de su mamá.    Su negocio es la venta mantas y alfombras, desempeña este trabajo desde hace cinco años.  La venta de su mercadería se realiza los días jueves y domingo de 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de noche.
El crédito solicitado le servirá para la compra de mercadería y así surtir su puesto.
texts.en:
The community association "JAWAS PANKARITA” (in Aymara language this means bean flower) will begin its 14th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the 
Centro Focal de German Busch.These women have met to request a loan and receive health and training services. Being a community association with experience, one may observe that many of the members are older but also there are members with few cycles or who are new. The community association "Jawas Pankarita" is made up of 8 members. In the photo, you see ten people because the woman with the feather jacket that is at the back and the woman in the checkered cape and pink skirt are members who recently retired.

The businesses that they work at are various: making clothing, underskirts, selling milkshakes, braided fabric, blankets, rugs, wool and alpaca yarn.

The A.C. “JAWAS PANKARITA” is directed by a board. Gladys is the president. Lidia is the treasurer and Veronica is the secretary. Gladys, president of the community bank, indicates that she already has six cycles as a member of Pro Mujer. She learned about the services of the institution through her mother. Her business is selling blankets and carpets. She's worked at this job for five years. She sells her merchandise on Thursdays and Sundays from 9AM until 9PM. The loan requested will be used to buy merchandise and stock her store.

loans.use: Compra de mantas y alfomfras

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud, age 46, has owned a grocery store for eight years. He and his wife have two children, and he is requesting his fifth loan from A. Majmoua for a number of reasons: to buy extra products to sell in his shop, to pay his children's school fees, and to buy a wedding day gift for his daughter. Mahmoud is a hard worker who retired from his career as a soldier in order to settle down into a lucrative business. All his previous loans have had a positive impact on his business, and he has proved himself to be a highly dependable borrower. He hopes to expand his business more in the future.

loans.use: To buy extra products to sell in his shop, to pay his children's school fees, and to buy a wedding day gift for his daughter

loans.name: Nicolasa Emperatriz

texts.es: Nicolasa Emperatriz se dedica a una panadería. Tiene  más de cuatro años con esta actividad. No es la primera vez que realiza pues han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio, inicio este medio de vida, por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar Nicolasa siempre ha sido una mujer trabajadora y es por medio de la panadería ella ha podido salir adelante. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de harina, huevos, mantequilla, queso, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Nicolasa Emperatriz manages a bakery and has more than four years of experience in this business. This is not the first time she has received loans since they have been a great help to her business. Nicolasa started this business so that she could cover the household expenses. She has always worked hard in order to make her bakery a success.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy flour, eggs, butter, cheese, and other products.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy flour, eggs, butter, cheese, and other products

loans.name: Hilda Consuelo

texts.es:
Doña Hilda, de 40 años de edad, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad, ella inicio un negocio de productos de consumo, lo tiene ubicado en su casa,  lo atiende en todo momento durante el día.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de aceite, azúcar, detergentes, frijoles, papel higiénico, entre otros que son demandados por los clientes, esta inversión desea hacerla para mejorar su atención a los clientes, ofreciéndoles buenos productos.
Ella quiere en el futuro ampliar el negocio, con capacidad de atender a más clientes, con financiamiento para mantener el inventario completo de productos, de esta manera espera garantizar una mejor condición económica a su familia.
texts.en:
40 year-old Hilda lives in Jucuapa, in Usulután department, with her husband and two children aged 8 and 2.  Hilda set up a grocery store in her home where she serves throughout the day.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy oil, sugar, detergents, beans, toilet paper and other products which are requested by her customers.

Hilda would like to make this investment so that she can improve her service to her customers, offering them good products.  In the future, she would like to expand her business so that she can serve more customers, with loans to keep her store fully stocked.  In this way, she hopes to put her family in a better financial position.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, detergents, beans and toilet paper

loans.name: Penh

texts.en: Penh S., age 48, is a married woman who is a good mother of four kids, one of whom is married, while the other three are single. She has two children who are working in different occupations in order to make a daily profit. She and her husband always use different fishing tools to fish in and around Tunle Sap River, where they can earn $8 of income each day. She has depended on this activity for more than ten years. She wishes to build up more fishing tools, such as nets, a machine, and a boat, and is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase them. Currently, Penh S. and her family reside in a wooden house in Siem Reap.

loans.use: to buy some fishing equipment, such as nets, a machine, and a boat

loans.name: Samuel Mwangi

texts.en:
Samuel has operated his cereals shop in Naivasha town for the last two years. He is 43 years old, married to Priscillah Wanjiru, and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of Kshs 40,000 well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more cereals to sell.

In future, Samuel hopes to grow his cereal shop into a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to sell.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Casa Huerta Group

texts.es: Cristina se incorporo en la Alcancía Comunal “EMPRENDEDORAS DE CASA HUERTA” con el afán de ahorrar para el bienestar de su familia y motivada por una amistad es socia en esta oportunidad. Cristina nos cuenta que con la ayuda de su madre trabaja en un mercado de su comunidad vendiendo  frutas, juntamente con ella están alquilando un puesto de venta y están  pagando una renta mensualmente. A sus 33 años  tiene dos jóvenes adolescentes a los cuales ayuda  y les da respaldo uno de ellos ya labora. Con su esfuerzo ha logrado comprar algunos artefactos eléctricos para su hogar. Actualmente reside en la casa de sus padres y por herencia posee un lugar donde desea construir su propia vivienda además si tuviera un capital mas lo invertiría en comprar un puesto de venta propio. El préstamo obtenido será invertido en la compra de frutas como: chirimoyas y paltas. Los  nueve integrantes de la Alcancía Comunal EMPRENDEDORAS DE CASA HUERTA  posan contentos en la reciente reunión de desembolso realizada en nuestras instalaciones. Son personajes emprendedores como se hacen llamar. En la fotografia esta ausente Olga quien llego con retraso a nuestra reunion. Agradecen el apoyo en esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Cristina joined the Communal Bank “Emprendedoras de Casa Huerta” (Entrepreneurs of Casa Huerta) in hopes of saving for her family’s welfare. She was convinced by a friend who is a member to take advantage of this opportunity.

Cristina says that with the help of her mother, she was able to secure work at the community market selling fruit. She and her mother pay monthly rent for their vending post. At the age of 33, she has two teenage children who she supports and they help her in return. One of them already has a job. Through her efforts, Cristina has been able to purchase a few appliances for her home. She currently lives with her parents and there is space on their property on which she wants to build her own house. In addition, she wants mO. capital so that she can invest in the purchase of her own vending stall. The loan being provided to her will be invested in the purchase of fruits such as cherimoyas and avocados.

The nine members of the “Emprendedoras de Casa Huerta” Communal Bank were pleased with the disbursement that was issued to them at their most recent meeting. They are enterprising individuals, just as their name suggests. In the photograph, Olga is absent since she was late arriving to the meeting. They are grateful for the support that was granted on this occasion.

loans.use: to purchase cherimoyas and avocados.

loans.name: Nallivis

texts.es:
Nallivis de 36 años vive en el barrio San Luis de la ciudad de Barranquilla, desde allí comercializa con víveres, pues son productos de primera necesidad que rotan rápidamente, compran las familias para su diario vivir y le dejan a ella su propio ingreso. Su idea de negocio ocurrió cuando se vino de su natal municipio “Carmen de Bolívar” y sus familiares empezaron a enviarle productos propios de esta región, como aguacates, plátanos, carnes, lácteos con tal de apoyarle la generación de sus propios ingresos.  
Nallivis sueña con tener una tienda bien surtida,  para vender muchos más productos y adicionarle a su oferta papelería y variedades en general; así mismo sueña con adquirir una vivienda propia y esta es su gran motivación,  mientras continua en su negocio y genera una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 15% y rota sus inventarios cada 8 días.
El credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará carnes, verduras, tubérculos, abarrotes de contado para ganarse los descuentos y trasladarle buenos precios a sus clientes, con tal de conservarlos ante la competencia del mercado que es su gran desafió.
texts.en:
Nallivis, 36, lives in the city of Barranquilla’s San Luis neighborhood.  She sells foodstuffs there which are basic need items that have rapid turnaround that families buy daily producing income for her.  The idea for the business arose when she came from her native town, Carmen de Bolívar, and her relatives started sending her products typical of that region like avocadoes, bananas, meats and dairy products to help her generate income of her own.

Nallivis dreams with having a well-stocked store to sell many more products and to add stationery and general novelties to her stock.  She also dreams with acquiring a house of her own and this is her great motivator while she continues with her business generating a profit margin of 15% and rotating inventory every 8 days.

The Kiva loan is the first loan she’s had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to pay cash for meats, vegetables, tubers and groceries so that she can qualify for discounts and pass on the good prices to her customers in order to retain them in the face of market competition which is her great challenge.

loans.use: to pay cash for meat, vegetables, tubers and groceries.

loans.name: Esmeraldas De San Francisco Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "ESMERALDAS D. SAN FRANCISCO" EL GRUPO ELIGIO ESTE NOMBRE POR SER BONITO Y PARA QUE SE SOSTENGA FIRME CON EL APOYO D. TODAS SUS INTEGRANTES. EL GRUPO SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO D. MÉXICO. EL PUEBLO SE DISTINGUE POR LA GRAN RESPONSABILIDAD Y AMABILIDAD D. SU GENTE. LA SEÑORA SE LLAMA ANDREA QUIEN ES UNA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO, ELLA TIENE LA EDAD D. 41 AÑOS, SU COMERCIO ES LA VENTA D. SERVILLETAS, SE SIENTE AGRADECIDA CON TODOS SUS CLIENTES PUES GRACIAS A ELLOS ELLA PUED. SALIR ADELANTE AUN QUE TAMBIEN CONSIDERA QUE LO QUE HACE ES REALMENTE MUY BUENO, ES SU LA TERCERA VEZ QUE SOLICITAN UN PRESTAMO. LA SEÑORA ANDREA QUIERE ESTE PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR TELAS E HILOS Y ASÍ HACER MAS SERVILLETAS BORDADAS PUES CONSIDERA QUE EL INCREMENTAR LE DA ANIMOS PARA QUE SU GENTE ESTE CONTENTA. POR EL MOMENTO QUIERE CONTINUAR CON UNA ESTABILIDAD EN SU NEGOCIO Y ESPERA SEGUIR OBTENIENDO GANANCIAS PARA LOGRAR MAS OPORTUNIDADES D. TRABAJO. TAMBIÉN OFRECERLE A SU FAMILIA UNA MEJOR CALIDAD D. VIDA Y APOYO ECONOMICO PARA QUE NO LES FALTE NADA.
texts.en:
This group is called “Esmeraldas D. San Francisco” (San Francisco Emeralds).  The group chose this name because it’s pretty and so that it will remain strong with help from all the members.  The group is located in the State of México.  The town is noted for its great responsibility and the kindness of its people.

Andrea, 41, is one of the group members.  She sells napkins.  She is grateful to all her customers because thanks to them she can get ahead although she also considers that what she does is really good.  

This is her third loan request.  Andrea wants this loan to buy fabric and thread to make more embroidered napkins because she feels that by increasing she is encouraged so that her people will be happy.  For the moment she wants to continue with stability in her business and hopes to continue earning profits to obtain more opportunities for work and offer her family a better quality of life and economic support so that they will lack nothing.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to make napkins and embroidery.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 56 years old and married with one child.

Lucena works hard to provide for her family. For the past five years, she has run a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lucena is requesting a 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store. Before this loan, she has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF. 

Lucena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s food-selling business. He specifically sells roasted chicken to his clients. His food item is very famous among people and they come from different places to taste his food. With the loan, he will buy chickens in bulk quantity to expand his business further and improve his clientele base.  

Rukhsana herself is a caring lady who carries out her responsibilities as a housewife by staying at home. She and her husband are fond of cooking and experimenting with new food dishes. They both help each other on weekends and cook food for the family.  

Rukhsana hopes that the loan investment will be proved beneficial for her husband’s business and improves the living standard of her family as a result.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Gabi

texts.es: Gabi tiene 36 años, convive con Andrés, de 35 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Julisa, de 13 y Anderson de 10 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. Desde las primera horas de la mañana Gaby, comienza la venta de productos de primera necesidad en un pequeño espacio que acondicionó en su casa, cuando termina su venta, ella se dirige a sus sembríos de arveja, papa y maíz, donde hace 15 años comenzó a dedicarse a la agricultura, y según menciona la va muy bien, pues ahora la calidad de sus productos son muy cotizados en el mercado central de Tarma. Según afirma el movimiento económico del mercado es muy bueno, por ello está planeando invertir en la venta de verduras al por mayor los días de feria que son miércoles, viernes y domingo. Y como presidenta de su banco comunal, se siente dichosa de ayudar a las personas a salir adelante, ya que se siente agradecida con MFP, por lograr expandir su negocio y motivarla a seguir avanzando. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de Cumutay” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr sus objetivos, asimismo se compromete en cumplir con puntualidad sus cuotas. Gabi de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en completar la compra de 5 sacos de semilla de arveja.
texts.en:
Gabi is 36 years old and lives with Andrew, 35.  They have two children: Julisa, aged 13 and Anderson, aged 10.  They live together as a family in their own home, which is located in the hamlet of Cumutay. 

From the earliest hours of the morning, Gabi begins selling staples in a small space set aside in her home.  When she finishes selling, she turns to her crops of peas, potatoes and corn.  She has been working in agriculture for the last 15 years, and as she tells us, it's going great, because now the quality of her products is talked about in the central market of Tarma. 

As stated by her, the financial situation in the market is very good, so she is planning to invest in the sale of vegetables at wholesale.  Market days are Wednesday, Friday and Sunday.  And as president of her village bank, she feels lucky to help people get ahead in life, and as is grateful to MFP for being able to expand her business and for motivating her to further progress. 

She belongs to the communal bank “Pioneros de Cumutay” ("Cumutay Pioneers"), and this is her ninth loan through MFP.  She hopes for the support of all of you to achieve her goals, and she also agrees to comply punctually with her repayments.  Gabi, having gained your support, will invest the requested money to complete her purchase of 5 sacks of pea seeds.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of pea seeds.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES EN ACCION”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Compone, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Benedicta; la socia tiene 36 años; la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, de 5, 4 y 7 meses de edad;  La socia se dedica a la crianza de cuyes al por mayor para la venta en las diferentes ferias, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de 50 cuyes ya que ella tiene ahora un total de 60 ella desea incrementar esta cantidad con otra parte del préstamo ella comprara mas corrales y el alimento para los cuyes, La socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de 50 cuyes para la crianza y reproducción de los mismos los cuales serán vendidos una vez que estos alcancen la madures. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar 50 cuyes.

 La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Benedicta is a member of the MUJERES EN ACCION community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Benedicta is partnered and has 3 children: 5-years, 4-years and 7-months old, respectively.  She operates a business raising guinea pigs that she then sells at local markets.  She is applying for a loan so that she can buy 50 guinea pigs--to add to the 60 that she has no-- and the supplies she needs to care for them.  She will raise and breed the animals so that she can sell them when they're ready for market.

Sra. Benedicta is very thankful for the support that this kind of lending provides and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy 50 guinea pigs for animal-sales business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La señora  Esther   tiene treinta y ocho años  de edad, se dedica  a la venta de ropa  desde  hace siete años atrás  con su  esposo , Lorenzo que  tiene  la edad de  cuarenta  y dos años .
Es  una señora muy trabajadora le gusta ayudar a su esposo en lo necesario  cuando su esposo va a ordeñar va con el al campo y  regresando guaja la leche  y se dedica hacer los quesos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  comprar mas ropa ya que rápido se  le termina , y sus clientes  le hacen pedidos y no cuenta con el dinero  suficiente para  cubrir los gasto de envidio de tallas.
Tiene la cantidad de  tres hijos una mujer  Francisca  Yesenia  de doce años de edad  y dos varones Gilberto de  nueve años de edad y Daniel  de  tres años  de edad .
Esta muy contenta con  su negocio   por que cada día va ganando mas clientes  y su negocio va creciendo , le  gusta mucho tener su propio  negocio por que  le ayuda a su  esposo en los gastos  de la casa  y a sus hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando.
Uno de sus sueños es  tener  una tienda de ropa mas grande  de la horita tiene  ya que quisiera  vender también calzado. 
Le da las gracias  a fundación realidad  por el apoyo que les da a las personas que desean tener su propio negocio  y salir adelante  para ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Esther is thirty-eight years old and she has been selling clothing for the past seven years together with her husband, Lorenzo. He is forty-two years old.

She is a very hardworking woman who likes to help her husband in whatever possible. When her husband sets out to milk the cows she goes along with him. When she comes back she curdles the milk and she makes cheeses. She requested a loan to purchase more clothing, especially because it sells out quickly. Her clients place orders but she doesn't have sufficient funds to cover the initial expense. 

She has three children: a girl named Francisca Yesenia, 12 years old, and two boys, 9-year old Gilberto and three-year old Daniel.

She is very happy with her business because she earns new clients every day and her business is growing. She loves having her own business because she is able to help her husband with the household expenses and her children are able to stay in school.

One of her dreams is to have a larger clothing store compared to what she has now. She would also like to start selling shoes.

She is thankful to Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) for the support that they give to individuals who want to have a business of their own, to get ahead to help their families.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Love And Unity Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Love and Unity” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Binta is the leader of this group. Binta is 37 years old and married with one child who is in secondary school. Binta sells palm-oil and has been doing this business for many years now. She has requested this loan in order to expand her business by buying gallons of palm-oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Concepcción

texts.es:
Concepción vive en  una localidad muy bonita en donde la mayoría de las personas se dedican al bordado de las mantas ya que es la cultura de su pueblo, ella es soltera  y tiene diecinueve años de edad.

     Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes como son: azúcar frijol, aceite, huevo, galletas, entre otros, en esta actividad lleva cuatro  meses y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingreso.

     Su  motivo a esta actividad comenzó por si sola   para tener mejor ingreso en su familia, aun a si también se dedica a la compra de mantas e  hilos para bordar camisas y blusas.

    Lo que desea es que con esta actividad pueda mejorar su calidad de vida para que  así sus ahorros sean mejores y salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Concepción lives in a beautiful town where the majority of the people engage in the production of embroideries made of muslin, since this activity is part of the town’s culture. She is 29 years old and single.

Concepción is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise to restock her grocery store such as sugar, beans, oil, eggs, cookies, and other items. She has been in business for four months and says that she is doing well. Concepción earns a good income.

Her reason for starting this business was to generate more income for her family. She uses some of her income to purchase muslin and thread for making embroidered shirts and blouses.

What she wants from her business is the ability to improve her quality of life by acquiring more savings and moving forward.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to restock her grocery store.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil, who is from Iraq, is 38 years old, married and has four children. The owner of a shop for birds and fish since 2010, he has good experience in this field and enjoys a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area and so has good visibility to the many potential customers passing by.

Nabil is requesting a $3000 loan in order to make cages for birds as well as an an outdoor ceiling, and to purchase more inventory for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to expand his shop in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: in order to make cages for birds, an outdoor ceiling and to add more inventory for his shop.

loans.name: Diezan

texts.en:
Diezan is 47 years old and is a married man with two children, aged 6 and 2. Diezan is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He primarily grows rice and corn crops to sell. Diezan works hard to improve his business and continue providing for his family.

Diezan has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm supplies. Diezan hopes to save for his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
"Behind the clouds, the sun is still shining," says Rowena as she sees hope behind all hardships in life that her family is experiencing nowadays. She is already married but she has no children yet. Having a big family is what she dreams of. So far, the couple is focused on improving their businesses.They happily lives in the peaceful village of La Salette. 

She is engaged in hog raising. The profit earned from selling grown-up hogs made it possible for her to build her new variety store, which she now manages. Her husband is in full support of her businesses and they hope that they will be able to further expand those. 

Rowena is requesting a loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos for the growth of her businesses buying feed, vitamins and grocery items. This amount will be of big benefit especially to her general store, which is starting to grow. She hopes that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and grocery items

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en: Khoeun, 39 years old, is a farmer earning $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker earning $5 per day. They have four children, three are studying and one more is working in a factory earning $4 per day. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, and $30 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy cow to raise for farming and sell its baby. She plans to repair her house and would like to sell groceries in front of the house.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise for farming and sell its baby.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.es:
Mercy es una mujer de 35 años de edad, casada y mamá de 2 niños, desde hace 3 años, tomo la decisión de volverse una empresaria independiente, montando un puesto de comidas rápidas ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Medellín en el departamento de Antioquia. 

Mercy sueña con tener un negocio de comidas más grande, donde pueda ofrecer mas variedad de productos a sus clientes y así generar recordación y deseo de parte de su clientela por su negocio, al mismo tiempo que pueda ofrecer empleo a más personas que lo necesiten para lograr generar una cadena en pro del empleo sostenible.

Actualmente esta requiriendo unas parrillas e insumos para su negocio con las cuales podrá ir innovando en los productos que va ofreciendo, tener mas ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mercy is a thirty-five year old woman and a married mother of two children. Three years ago she decided to become an independent businesswoman, starting a fast food stall located in the center of the city of Medellín, in the department of Antioquia.

Mercy dreams of having a bigger food business where she can offer more variety of products to her customers which will make her business more memorable and desirable to her clientele. At the same time she'd be able to offer employment to more people who need it and in this way succeed in creating a chain of sustainable employment. 

Right now she needs some grills and supplies for her business. With these she'll be able to start innovating the products she offers, increase sales, and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy some grills and supplies for her fast food stall.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr:
Ayaba est une femme âgée de 24 ans. Elle est mariée å un commerçant. Elle a 2 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 5 ans et le dernier a 2 ans.  
Ayaba travaille comme coiffeuse depuis 2007. Elle achète et vend des mèches, des pagnes et des robes de marié pour tout client dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seul. Au moment, n’a pas de difficulté. 
Ayaba a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter et vendre des pagnes et des mèches. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ayaba voudrait élargir l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de s’occuper de la famille.
texts.en: Ayaba is a 24-year-old woman. She is married to a storekeeper. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Her oldest is 5 years old and her youngest is two. Ayaba has been a hairdresser since 2007. She buys and sells hair extensions, pagnes [traditional wraps] and wedding dresses for all the clients in her boutique. She purchases supplies in Lomé. She works by herself. Presently, she does not have any problems. Ayaba asked for her 1st loan from WAGES for the purchase and sale of pagnes and hair extensions. She would like to reinvest in this business. In the coming years, Ayaba would like to grow the business. She says that she will take care of her family with the profits.

loans.use: to purchase pagnes [traditional wraps] and hair extensions.

loans.name: Deogratious

texts.en:
Deogratious is a 38-year-old married man with four children. 

His main business is growing maize for sale and he has been doing it for 11 years. He is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather.

His business goal is to diversify his businesses and his personal goal is to educate his children.

Deogratious needs a loan to weed and harvest maize.

loans.use: to weed and harvest maize.

loans.name: Urban Traders Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is a single lady aged 39 .She has two children aged 15 and 19. She lives in Kwekwe Urban with two other dependants who are orphans. Both her children and the two dependants attend school in Kwekwe.
Rosemary buys and sells cellphones and accessories in a rented shop in Kwekwe. She has two employees who assist her in selling her products. She has operated her business for the past five years. The major drawbacks in the business are high competition, seasonal sales fluctuations, and high rentals which end up eating away all the profits realized from the sale of her products.
Rosemary sees her business growing to a larger scale in the next five years so she will need a very big place to put and display her products. If the business grows, then she will be in a position to send her children and other dependants to better schools that offer quality education. She will also build her own house and shop and stop paying excessive rentals.

loans.use: to buy cellphones and accessories.

loans.name: Dalila Sarai

texts.es: Dalila,  solicita un préstamo para la compra de unas carretas de leña y quintales de maíz, además de dos comales, esto para continuar en su dedicación a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio ha mejorado por las inversiones anteriores, esto la ha motivado a continuar siendo buena cliente para gozar de este beneficio.
texts.en: Dalila is requesting a loan to buy some carts of firewood and quintals of corn, as well as two ‘comales’, the pans used for cooking tortillas. She needs all this to continue her work making and selling tortillas. Her business has improved thanks to previous investments, which has motivated her to continue being a good client to enjoy this benefit.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn and pans for cooking tortillas.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 43 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a farmer, and he is her partner in managing their rice farming business. She has been in this business for over 20 years. Her long duration in farming makes her expertise perfect for the task.

Milagros's neighbors seldom see her just having fun. For her, time is money -- that’s why she keeps busy in their field and only visits when their crop is in good condition. Milagros's income from the business depends on the climate. She worries when a typhoon comes or drought and pests hit her crops. Milagros is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy rice seeds to grow and fertilizers and insecticides for plant care.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 34-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 8 years to 14 years. She describes herself as a hardworking and industrious woman. 

She operates a retail shop where she sells products such as sugar, flour, tea leaves, milk, etc. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located a shopping center. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as high prices of the products she sells. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more sugar, salt, flour, etc. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, flour, etc.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a resident in the town of Panglao.  She is very busy managing her livelihood which is preparing meals to neighbors and locals in her community. She sold home-meals like fish soup, chicken adobo( marinated dishes with spices), sauteed vegetables and other native menus. She is 59-year-old married woman and has one dependent.
 

Engaging in food vending is very lucrative in her place. She needs additional capital to cater the high demands on food and other basic necessities.

Justina decided to join CEVI to avail loan and wants to  purchase additional supplies like meat, vegetables,spices, flour and chicken. In that way, she will be able to provide variety of meals at very affordable price.

She is grateful to Kiva for the funds and she is doing her best to become more successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies like meat, vegetables,spices, flour and chicken

loans.name: Akouété

texts.en:
Akouété A. was born in Ahépé in Yoto prefecture on December 11, 1972. Married and the father of five, he also looks after five other people in his family. He left middle school because his parents, as farmers, no longer had the means to support him. He entered an apprenticeship and specialized in automobile air conditioning. An energetic and very talented man, he has complete mastery of his specialization and provides quality service to his customers. He has become very famous, and his shop is quick to take care of its numerous customers, who value his work highly. He currently has seven apprentices. Because of business needs and persistent customer demand, he has decided to sell refrigeration accessories essential to his work, rather than buying them elsewhere in Ghana. But his new plan requires more funding than he has. His keen sense of management and his discipline will allow him to realize his plan successfully. The $1,200 loan that he is requesting will go towards a machine and towards refrigeration accessories to sell in his shop. His plan will bring in additional revenue and allow Mr. A. to provide for his family in a dignified manner.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, a Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Akouété est né le 11 décembre 1972 à Ahépé dans la préfecture de Yoto. Marié et père de cinq (05) enfants, il a à sa charge cinq autres personnes de sa famille. M. A. a arrêté ses études au cours secondaire car ses parents cultivateurs n’avaient plus les moyens de le soutenir. Il entra en apprentissage et se spécialisa en climatisation automobile. Dynamique et très doué, il a une maîtrise parfaite de son métier et offre un service de qualité à sa clientèle. Il est devenu très célèbre et son atelier accueille sans répit de nombreux clients qui apprécient ses services. Il a actuellement sept (07) apprentis. Pour les besoins de ses activités et à la demande persistante de ses clients, il décida de vendre dans son atelier des accessoires frigorifiques indispensables à son travail plutôt que d’en acheter ailleurs au Ghana. Mais cette nouvelle activité demande plus de moyens financiers qu’il ne dispose pas. Son sens aigu de gestion et sa rigueur lui permettront de mener à bien cette activité. Le crédit de $1200 qu’il sollicite va servir à l acquisition d une machine et à l’achat et à la revente dans son atelier des accessoires frigorifiques. Ce nouveau projet apportera un revenu supplémentaire et permettra à M. A. de subvenir dignement aux besoins de sa famille

loans.use: Acquire a machine and buy refrigerator accessories.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William M. has a small piece of land in rural Ecuador that he uses in order to cultivate rice. Although his farm is small, it has been providing for him and his family for over 30 years. He is now seeking to make an investment in order to reap more benefits from the land. He wants to invest in fertilizers and pesticides in order to better care for his main crop, rice. William and his family also raise pigs and chicken on their farm, only selling them when they are in need of money.
