William has his rice processed and commercialized at his associations facilities, where he also works part time.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

William is part of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. Their association works cooperatively to help in the commercialization of the product after it has grown. They will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical micro-entrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Fizuli

texts.en: Fizuli K. (his employee is pictured) owns a welding shop in the town of Khachmaz on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. This is Fizuli’s third loan with Norwegian Microcredit, showing that he has established a record of reliability with previous loans and is therefore at low risk of defaulting on this loan as well. Fizuli is looking for funding so that he can purchase new welding equipment for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase new welding equipment

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Mrs. Kate Ewhrudgakpo is 36 years old and has 4 children. She lives in Nigeria, specifically Benin City in Edo State. She is a fashion designer. She needs this loan to buy an additional machine and fabrics. She has been in this business since 1995.

loans.use: To buy an additional sewing machine & tailoring  materials

loans.name: Azimchon

texts.ru:
Azimchon I. sells children's shoes and men's clothing. He is married and has two children. He has a specialized middle school education. His wife helps him with with his business. The children are in school. He began working in sales 3 years ago. Borrowing money allowed him to significantly increase the diversity of goods he has for sale and secure a sales location. In the future he is planing to secure another sales location where his wife will be working as a sales person.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Исмоилов Азимчон занимается торговлей детской обуви и мужской одежды. Женат, имеет двоих детей, образование среднее специальное. Жена помогает мужу в торговле, дети учатся в школе. Начал заниматься торговлей 3года назад. После неоднократного кредитования и целевого использования Азимчон увеличил наименования товара в несколько раз больше, приобрел новое место деятельности. В будущем планирует открыть ещё одно место для торговли, где будет торговать его жена.

loans.use: to open another activity place for his wife

loans.name: Gafurjon

texts.en:
Gafurjon has been in business for over 7 years. His business is selling sportswear for all ages. His business place is located in the open air, in Panjshanbe market, Khujand. He has good turnover of his inventory, which he brings from Istaravshan's wholesale market. He has established a reputation as a good businessman who sells high quality merchandise. He has a lot of customers who purchase his goods with pleasure. His business place is convenient for clients as it is situated in the center of Khujand.

Gafurjon wishes to receive a loan from KIVA and plans to spend it to put a roof over his place of business. That will give him the opportunity to hang his goods in rainy and snowy weather.

loans.use: building a roof over his stand

loans.name: Lefaima Ah

texts.en:
Lefaima is a seventy-five-year-old widow with sixteen children, and she comes from the village of Afega. She was one of SPBD’s first clients when we started our program in the year 2000. She has had eight loans through SPBD and has fully paid back all of them without difficulties.

Lefaima is a very active woman and is willing to stay in the program for as long as she lives. The financial support that SPBD have provided has helped her in many ways, which she is thankful for. She says that without this support she would never be where she is right now. With her requested loan, she plans to buy a bigger freezer for the ice cakes (popsicles in a bag) which she sells.

loans.use: To buy a new freezer for her popsicle business

loans.name: Erisa B(Iv) Group

texts.en:
Alice is 47 years old and married with four children. She runs a retail store. Betty has a charcoal-selling business. Rita runs a grocery store. Juliet sells cold drinks and Mary is a poultry farmer. With the extra profits made possible by this loan, Alice wants to start a new business raising pigs.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for their businesses

loans.name: Gulaman

texts.en:
Gulaman (her husband is pictured) is a mother of three children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan.

She and her family settled in the Fizuli region, in the village of Kayidish, specifically built for IDPs. Seven years ago, they started this business. Now they need a loan of $1200 to buy a cow in order to continue her dairy business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
I am Kalsoom Manzoora, a widow from the small town Chichawatni, Pakistan. I have seven kids: four boys and three girls. My elder sons are the bread winners of the family. One son does farming and raises vegetables. We need a loan to buy pesticides for his field.

My group includes: Shamshad B., whois borrowing to start a public call office; Suriya B., who wants to expand their grocery store; Rubi B., who will invest her share of loan in her family’s tailoring business; and Anwer B., who needs this loan to expand their general store.

loans.use: Buy pesticides for the farming land

loans.name: Olive

texts.fr: Born March 5, 1979 in the historic city of Abomey in Benin, Mrs Olive A. is married and has two children. She lives in Tanto and sells a variety of products, such as bags of rice, soap and tinned goods, in a small shop in Lokokoukoume, a neighborhoold of Cotonou. She also sells refill cards for the various cell phone networks that operate in Benin, including GSM-type networks. She is very popular and gets a large number of customers every day, which causes her inventory to become depleted very quickly. She is requesting this loan in order to replenish her stock.Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer. Née le 5 mars 1979 à ABOMEY dans la capitale historique du BENIN, dame A. Olive est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Résident à TANTO, elle est une revendeuse de produits divers tels que les sacs de riz, de savons, de boîtes de conserves et autres dans une boutique à LOKOKOUKOUME un quartier de COTONOU. Elle vend également les cartes de recharge des différents réseaux  de téléphonie mobile de type GSM installés au BENIN. Très appréciée, elle reçoit une multitude de clients par jour provoquant l’épuisement de son stock en très peu de temps. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner.

loans.use: To buy 10 x 25kg bags of rice, 5 boxes of spaghetti and other common foodstuffs.

loans.name: Teófilo Ramón

texts.es:
The economic activity that Mr. Teofilo P. dedicates himself to is the sale of food which he does in his own establishment in the municipality of Condega in the city of Esteli in Nicaragua. It is necessary to point out that his business only offered a few food items but through time he has been able to improve his economic condition and increase the variety of food he can offer his clients.

Ceprodel has been a pillar in his business as it has given him loans which he has used directly to improve the conditions of his business and in the purchase of all his ingredients he uses to make his foods. It is for this simple reason that he once again asks for Ceprodel’s support. The loan will allow him to purchase the necessary ingredients to be used in his high quality dishes to satisfy his loyal customers. This will allow him to improve conditions for his family which is made up of his spouse and his young daughter who is of school age.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica el señor Teofilo P. es al negocio de la venta de comida en su propio establecimiento ubicado en el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí en Nicaragua. Es necesario destacar que inició su negocio con pocos alimentos ofertados pero a medida que ha venido transcurriendo el tiempo ha logrado mejorar su condición económica ofreciendo más variedades de comida para los clientes.

Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en el negocio por lo que le ha brindado créditos que los ha utilizado directamente en el mejoramiento de las condiciones del negocio y además en la compra de todos sus ingredientes para elaborar los alimentos. Es por esta sencilla razón que una vez mas busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito que le permita comprar los ingredientes necesarios para preparar los platillos de mas alta calidad para satisfacer a sus fieles clientes en su negocio de comidería y así sacar adelante a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y su pequeña niña que actualmente se encuentra en edad escolar.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make food

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret K. is forty years old. She is married with five children. She is a serious minded and resourceful business woman who works hard to support her husband to provide for her family. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, and skimmed powdered milk.

Through this business, Margaret has supported three children to finish senior high school. She deems this loan a great opportunity that she can use to expand her business. She wants to use the loan to increase her stock of goods available for sale. She would buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, and boxes of body and hair creams.

She belongs to the community group called Timothy Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase her stock of goods available for sale.

loans.name: Mahmadnazar

texts.ru:
Mahmadnazar B. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region of Tajikistan. He is 63 years old, married and has six children. Mahmadnazar has a college degree in education and works as a teacher in the local school. To supplement the family income he also grows wheat and other grains. Mahmadnazar wants to take out a loan to finance the purchase of seeds and fertilizer for the next growing season. He also wants to purchase fuel for his equipment. The loan will guarantee that Mahmadnazar will be able to buy the best quality seeds for his fields and collect a quality harvest next year. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Бекназаров Махмадназар житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 63 года , женат и имеет 6 детей. Имеет высшее образование . Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того работает у себя на участке, который засеивает пшеницей , другими злаковыми культурами. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить семена и удобрения. А так же хочет закупить ГСМ. Это поможет ему без проблем купить качественные семена. Таким образом он сможет получить качественный урожай. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mery Del Rosario

texts.es:
Mery del Rosario, 24, is an intelligent young woman. She finished her accounting studies a year ago but due to a lack of job opportunities she hasn't been able to work in her profession. Now, with the goal of helping her mother who has sacrificed a lot so that she could finish her studies, Mery del Rosario has decided to start a business selling and distributing beer. The business is starting to generate a good income but, above all, it provides a means for Mery del Rosario to support her mother. Mery del Rosario distributes her drinks at various social events in the city. Her hope is to be able to increase the amount of money that she invests every month in the purchase of product so that she can, in turn, increase her earnings and provide a better quality of life for her mother. She's sure that with dedication and effort, she'll be able to build a successful business and, in the future, to practice her profession.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Mery del Rosario es una joven inteligente de 24 años, hace un año terminó sus estudios superiores de contabilidad, pero por falta de oportunidades de trabajo no puede desempeñarse profesionalmente, ahora, con el fin de ayudar a su madre y así corresponderle por el sacrificio que hizo al brindarle estudios superiores, decidió abrir un deposito de cerveza y dedicarse a la venta y distribución de esta bebida. Este negocio que le viene resultando muy rentable y sobre todo le permite apoyar económicamente a su madre.Mery del Rosario distribuye sus bebidas en los diferentes compromisos sociales y días festivos de su ciudad.El deseo de esta emprendedora jovencita es poder incrementar la suma de dinero que invierte mes a mes en la compra de su producto, para así incrementar también sus ganancias, y brindarle a su madre una mejor calidad de vida, está segura que con dedicación y empeño lo podrá conseguir, y en un futuro cercano poder ejercer su carrera.

loans.use: Increase working capital for liquor business in order to buy larger inventories.

loans.name: Jesús Alberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Jesús Alberto y su esposa la Sra. Alicia tiene dos hijos que están en la edad escolar pero tiene un problema en esté momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para la comprar de útiles escolares y los uniformes de la escuela.

El Sr. Jesús trabaja en una compañía de agua el está en el puesto de repartidor de agua por varias colonias de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo y su esposa la Sra. Alicia se dedica a la venta de ropa usada afuera de su casa los fines de semana estos son sus ingresos familiares.

Cuando fuimos ha ser la visita a la casa de la familia M. el Sr. Jesús no se encontraba en su casa el estaba trabajando solo estaba su esposa la Sra. Alicia y sus dos hijos.

El sr. Jesús nos está solicitando un préstamo de $475.00 dlls para la compra de los útiles escolares y los uniformes ya que en la escuela se los están exigiendo a los niños por seguridad de ellos mismos
texts.en:
Mr. Jesús Alberto and his wife Mrs. Alicia have two school-aged children but, at this moment, they have a problem in that they don’t have the money that is necessary to buy supplies and uniforms for school. Mr. Jesús works in a water company. He is a water distributor for various neighborhoods in the city of Nuevo Laredo. His wife Mrs. Alicia sells used clothes outside her house during the weekends. These activities contribute to their household income. When we went to visit their home, only Mrs. Alicia and her two children were home, as Mr. Jesús was working. Mr. Jesús is requesting a loan for $475.00 to buy school supplies and uniforms since the children are required to go to school for their own security.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies and uniforms for his children

loans.name: Atuganile

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Atuganile M. from Dar es Salaam She is single and has two children, ages 13 and 18. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting three other dependants because their parents do not take care of them. Atuganile has been running a mobile phone accessories business since 2004. It is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania. This is probably attributable to the fact that it is the only form of phone communication available to most people, because there are few landlines. Also, mobile phones are relatively cheap in Tanzania. Her business is doing well. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 per week and is assisted by two employees. Atuganile currently earns about $100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $750 USD to purchase additional mobile phone accessories. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Atuganile thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories in bulk

loans.name: Ruby Minerva

texts.es:
Ruby es socia de Banco Comunal El Pino. Ruby es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 3 hijos de 8, 5 y 1 año.Dos de sus hijos están en el colegio.       
Ruby tiene su negocio de venta de ropa como ambulante, ella empezó vendiendo a sus familiares y luego se fue expandiendo, vendía a sus vecinos, amigos. Desde que recibe los préstamos ha mejorado comenzó a comprar mas mercadería.
Ruby necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa, porque tiene pedidos que entregar por campaña navideña. 
Ruby sueña con tener un local grande para poder vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Ruby is a member of El Pino Communal Bank. She is a common-law wife, 26 years old and has three children ages eight, five and one. Two of her children are in school.

Ruby has a business selling clothing as a street vendor. She started selling to her family and later expanded as she began to sell to neighbors and friends. Since she has received the loans, things have improved and she started to buy more merchandise.

Ruby needs a loan for 800 soles, money that will be used to purchase clothing because she has orders to fill during the Christmas season. She dreams of having a large locale where she will be able to sell her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell during the upcoming Christmas season

loans.name: Boret

texts.en:
Mr. Boret C., 27, was married in 2006 and has one daughter. He and his wife live with his parents on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Boret has been a silk weaver for two years, a skill he learned from his sister. His wife used to be a garment factory worker but now she stays at home taking care of her little daughter. Boret sells his finished product to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. He is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials and to set up a loom for a weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and set up a loom for a weaving business.

loans.name: Tuon

texts.en:
Tuon R. is 28 years old and is a resident of Pursat Province. She is a farmer who has been growing both vegetables and rice since 1999 to earn a living. Her husband, Som Ran, 25, makes a living selling carving wood, which he brings from the forest and, using a cart, he transports the wood to sell from village to village in their community, earning approximately US$ 3 a day. The family has no children as yet.

For another income source, R. is seeking a loan to purchase piglets to raise. She would use any remainder of the loan to buy a ox-cart to replace the old one her husband uses to transport carving wood to sell. R.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and an ox-cart

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en: Eloisa is a family woman with a loving husband and three children.  On the day we visited, two of her children were at school, so the picture includes only one daughter.  Eloisa operates a "colomado" that sells fresh food products.  Many of her products she cooks with her daughter.  This loan will finance an addition to the house that includes a kitchen and another room.  This renovation will greatly enhance the family's daily life and the business.  Please help finance Eloisa's dream!  Thank you!

loans.use: a new kitchen

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Nelly D. P. tiene 45 años, vive en el distrito de Paijan,  provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio secundaria completa, además de cursos de costura, tiene un hijo que ya no depende económicamente de ella.
Rosa se dedica a la confección de ropa, inicio su negocio hace ya 15 años con una pequeña máquina de coser, poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida y de clientela, con el tiempo fue ampliando su negocio con la compra de telas  que les vende a sus clientes y mercería que utiliza en la confección, su negocio se desarrolla en su domicilio.
 Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Confianza”, lo invirtió en la compra de mercería y telas.
Con este crédito de 250 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de  telas de verano y mercería. 
Rosa tiene el sueño de comprarse una máquina de coser moderna.
texts.en:
Rosa Nelly D. P. is 45 years old and lives in Paijan district in Ascope province, in La Libertad, Peru. She finished secondary school, in addition to classes in sewing. She has a son who no longer depends on her financially. Rosa makes clothing. She began her business 15 years ago with a small sewing machine, and little by little she became more widely known by her customers. With time, she expanded her business by purchasing fabric that she sells to her customers and hardware she uses for making clothes. She runs her business from her home. With her first loan of 300 soles that she received from her communal bank "Honestidad y Confianza" (Honesty and Reliability), she invested in the purchase of hardware and fabric. With this loan of 250 soles to be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of summer fabric and hardware. Rosa dreams of buying a modern sewing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer fabric and hardware

loans.name: Rodella

texts.en:
Rodella A. is a 33-year-old married mother of three.  Her husband drives a delivery truck for a bakery.  One of their children is an infant, one is in preschool, and the third child is in elementary school.

Rodella used to run a "sari sari" shop, a small general store that sells a variety of goods to satisfy everyday needs, but she closed her shop during maternity.  Now that her children are old enough, she hopes to re-open her shop, so she has applied for a loan to buy inventory to re-stock her store.

Rodella aspires to have a successful business and make enough money to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase cigarettes, shampoo, detergent, oil, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, milk, diapers, napkins and candy for resale.

loans.name: Lane Kuru Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu B., Mohamed K. and Yeabu S.. They named their group Lane Kuru, a Temne phrase for “Believe in God.” They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Makeni.

This is not the first loan this group has received from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans created meaningful impacts in the lives of these people. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They’re also feed and clothed themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans.

Today, they are requesting a loan of Le600,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Mohamed (middle) is the leader of the group. He is fifty-five years of age. He was born in Kamalo, forty-eight miles from Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman, and they have four children. All of his children are in primary and secondary schools. Mohamed sells tobacco.

With this new loan, Mohamed will expand his business. He will use it to buy more bales/heads of tobacco. Each bale is priced between Le300,000 to Le500,000.

So far, Mohamed faces no major challenges. Business is doing fine for him and he enjoys it. With this loan, Mohamed will feel good as he sees his business capital increase.

loans.use: Buy bales/heads of tobacco.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen cuenta con 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja y sus 4 hijos, en su casa propia. Nos cuenta, que su esposo es persona muy conformista, no le gustan los trabajos pesados; pero a ella le gusta mucho trabajar y progresar para el bienestar de sus hijos. Por ello se levanta a las 4.00am para preparar los alimentos y una vez terminada esa labor va rumbo a su chacra para proseguir con el proceso de trasplantar sus matas de café para que no dejen de producir. Todos los fines de semana prepara la carga de plátanos para enviar a los mercados de la ciudad de La Merced. Para Carmen, todos sus cultivos son rentables, porque el plátano le genera ingresos  económicos cada fin de semana, mientras que la cosecha de café es cada cierta temporada. Sus planes a futuro son de incrementar sus sembríos para que aumente su producción y pueda cubrir toda la educación de sus hijos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, en todo este tiempo que viene trabajando ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos, y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal llamado “Alianza al Progreso”. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de herramientas, como machetes y picotas, para que realice la limpieza de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Carmen is 33-years-old and lives with her partner and her four children in their own home. She tells us that her husband is a very conformist person who doesn't like hard work, but that she loves to work and to get ahead for the good of her children. Therefore, she gets up at 4.00 a.m. to prepare food. Once this work is done, she goes directly to her small plot of land to continue with the process of transplanting her coffee bushes so they don't stop producing. Every weekend she prepares a shipment of plantains to send to the markets in the city, La Merced. In Carmen’s opinion, all of her crops are profitable because the plantains generate income every weekend, while the coffee harvest is every season. Her plans for the future are to increase her crops, to improve their production, and cover all of her children's educational costs. This is her second loan with MFP. All of the time that she has been working, she has been on time with her payments. She is very happy to be a member of her communal bank "Alianza al Progreso.” The money she is requesting is to buy tools, like machetes and picks, to clean her plots of land.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de herramientas agrícolas

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en: N. Joyce is the leader of Akutwala ekiro group in Kyebando. She is a hard-working lady and a widow with three children, ages twenty-five, twenty-three and twenty-one. She has run her business selling fresh fruits and vegetables for seven years, and she is grateful that previous loans have helped to expand her business and to attract more customers. Joyce has a dream of starting up a wholesale shop, and she believes she will achieve it. She also hopes to have all her children turn into very responsible citizens. She needs a loan to be able to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Greetings from Bernadette N., a 31-year-old married mother of two children of five and seven years old. Bernadette lives with her family in the Gasabo District of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda.

Bernadette owns a shop selling different kinds of products, both consumable and non-consumable, while her husband does not earn any kind of income. She has been in the same business for six years and employs two people. Her daily work starts at 6am and finishes at 11pm. Bernadette is seeking her second loan worth 600,000 RWF from Kiva partner, Vision Finance Company and will be paid in 12 months. Her first loan was valued at 521,075 RWF. with her first loan Bernadette has earned approximately $145 USD monthly profit. With the new loan she intends to buy another house in which she will be storing merchandise, and with the profits from the loan she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: To buy a house

loans.name: Tamella

texts.en:
Tamella B. is 53 years old and married with four children. She has been running her own small business for 18 years. She built a store in the local market where she sells different kinds of food such as candies, cookies, sugar, etc. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.

Tamella is very friendly and polite which attracts customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase a wider range of goods for her store. This will help her to provide for her children's needs and pay their school fees. Tamella promises to repay her loan without any delay and thanks everyone who decides to support her.

loans.use: purchase more goods for her store

loans.name: Kihara Mothers 3 Masika Levenia Group

texts.en: M. Levenia is 35 years old and married with eight children in school. She has been buying and selling goats for over 12 years. She is using this loan to purchase goats to sell. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase goats to sell

loans.name: Roquesa

texts.en:
Roquesa O. is from the town of Quiboro, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 43 years old. Roquesa is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Roquesa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, and others in the local community. Roquesa has just started this business.

In July 2008, Roquesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roquesa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. Roquesa is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Roquesa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ilda Alejandrina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Campesinas de Ruizho esta ubicado en el sector de Ruizho, perteneciente a la comunidad de San Bartola  de Sigsig, se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Cuenca, su terreno es en su mayor parte accidentado.
Las principales producciones de la región son: maíz, fréjol, cebada, trigo, habas, arveja, patatas. En la parte baja se produce caña de azúcar y variedad de árboles frutales.
La parroquia se encuentra atravesada de norte a sur con yacimientos mineros de plata y hierro, existiendo también en la región sur criaderos de cal.
La principal industria es la agricultura, si bien muchos se dedican a la manufactura del tejido de sombreros de paja toquilla.
Este banco Comunal esta conformado por personas muy colaboradoras, organizadas y puntuales, el desarrollo de sus labores en el campo es la base fundamental para el compañerismo ya que cuando alguien necesita ayuda realizan mingas comunales, así también cuando hay festejos asisten todos.

Sra.  Ilda Alejandra Peñalosa U. tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos, de 28, 18, 15, 12 y 6 años, es también responsable de 3 sobrinos menores de  10 años, cuenta que su hermana es madre soltera, menor que ella, tuvo tres hijos de diferente padres, hace tres años salio y hasta el día de hoy no regresa, Ilda se hace cargo del cuidado y manutención de los tres muchachos, dice que Dios le da fuerzas y paciencia para seguir adelante, y que nunca le falta comida para sus chicos, cuenta que en el campo es más fácil vivir porque la misma tierra les da de comer. Sus tres hijos últimos estudian dos en el colegio de San Bartola y el otro en la escuela Ruizho, gracias a su esposo que le ayuda trabajando porque tiene conocimientos de veterinaria ha podido salir adelante, el pasa trabajando en los lugares aledaños de Ruizho, en especial en haciendas que necesitan veterinario, Ilda vive en casa propia pero es pequeña de adobe y teja, a más de atender a su hogar y cuidar sus animales se dedica a trabajar vendiendo comida en el CREA y el parque el paraíso, lugares comerciales de Cuenca los días Sábados y Domingos, pero en el caso del CREA Ilda tiene que ir a dormir en un cuartito que arrienda por el mercado 27 de febrero de Cuenca porque su trabajo comienza desde las 3 de la mañana y termina a las 12 del día, y los Domingos de 6 a 2 de la Tarde, ella cocina cafés, chocolates, empanadas, secos, tortillas de maíz, tortillas de choclo, y otros alimentos.
El crédito que solicitó Ilda es de 550 dólares los cuales los invertirá comprando abono para su terreno, pollos de cría y mesas plásticas con silletas para su negocio, así también una cocina para el local, su meta es poder seguirles dando el estudio a sus hijos y construir una casa más segura y grande para toda su familia.
texts.en:
The “Campesinas de Ruizho” cooperative bank is located in the Ruizho sector, in the San Bartola de Sigsig community, an hour from the city of Cuenca. The primary crops of the region are: corn, beans, barley, wheat, peas and potatoes. In the lower areas, sugar cane and a variety of fruit trees are grown. The district is bordered on the northern and southern sides by silver and iron mines, and the southern area also has lime. Agriculture is the primary industry, and many people also dedicate themselves to making straw hats. This cooperative bank is comprised of members that are very collaborative, organized, and timely. Carrying out farming endeavors is the fundamental basis for their companionship given that, whenever someone needs help, they group together to help out. They also work as a group when there are celebrations and festivals. Ilda Alejandra Peñalosa U. is 45 years old, married, and has 5 children ages 28, 18, 15, 12 and 6. She is also responsible for 3 young nieces and nephews, all under the age of 10. She tells us that her younger sister, a single mother, left three years ago and never returned. Ilda took charge of caring for her children, and says that God gives her the strength and patience she needs to forge ahead. They are never lacking in food, given that the very land they live on provides sustenance. Two of her three oldest children study at the school in San Bartola, and the other at the school in Ruizho. Thanks to her husband’s help, who has veterinary skills, they have been able to get ahead. He works in the areas surrounding Ruizho, particularly the towns that need veterinary help. Ilda lives in a house they own, but it is small and made of adobe and tile. In addition to tending to the home and raising her animals, she works selling food at the CREA and the Paradise Park, commercial areas of Cuenca, on Saturdays and Sundays. In the case of her work for CREA, she has to sleep in a small room she rents near the 27th of February Market because she starts work at 3 am and finishes at noon. On Sundays, she works from 6 am to 2 pm. She makes coffee, chocolates, empanadas, corn tortillas and other foods. The loan of $550 USD requested by Ilda will be used to invest in the purchase of fertilizer for her land, poultry to raise, and plastic tables and chairs for her business. Her goal is to continue to provide an education for her children and to build a stronger and bigger house for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her land, chickens to raise, plastic tables and chairs, and a stove for her food preparation business.

loans.name: Pilar Jesus

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Jesús, pertenece al banco comunal “señor de la agonía - taray”, ubicado en el distrito de Taray a una hora de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 5 hijos (22,14,10,6,1) años de edad ella es casada tiene 42 años, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de verduras en el mercado central, ella tienen un terreno dónde produce maíz y verduras, al por mayor, la socia tiene este stand en el mercado desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta que la noche la sorprenda, también es una madre muy amorosa y dedicada a sus hijos, la socia requiere el dinero para poder comprar otros productos al por mayor y de este modo surtir su mercadería.

Nuestra socia se compromete en cumplir con el pago total de la deuda en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Jesús is a member of the Señor de la Agaonía - Taray Community Bank, which is located in the Taray district an hour from the city of Cusco. She has five children (22, 14, 10, 6, 1). She is 42 and married. She alternates her activities between her house and selling vegetables in the central market. She has a piece of land where she produces corn and vegetables wholesale. She is at her stand in the market from very early in the morning until the nightfall. She is also a very loving and devoted mother to her children. She needs the money to be able to buy other wholesale products to stock her merchandise. She promises to make all of her payments on time in order to completely repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products to sell

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
The selling of native delicacies made from glutinous rice as well as other types of snacks is the business managed by Esperanza L., who is a resident of Barangay Rizal West in San Isidro, Isabela. She is fifty-seven years old. Esperanza is a loving mother and a caring wife, as well as a business-minded woman. 

She wants to improve her sales by buying more kinds of snacks to sell, which would generate more income. This is the reason why she is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP6,000 for her business growth. Esperanza is married to Marcelino and they are blessed with five children. Three of them are married and the other two are single and currently in school.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: El joven Marlon Antonio de 24 años de edad, reside en el barrio el Pilar en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 2 y 4 años de edad, sus planes es poder tener su propia casa ya que habita en casa de sus padres, su negocio es la venta de cosmético y una variedad de productos, desde pequeño ha trabajado con sus padre ya ellos tiene una abarroteria en el mercado lo que es una ventaja ya que conoce del negocio y ha sido apoyado por ellos, el cual le ha trabajado y con sus ahorros ha logrado independizarse. Con este préstamo es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara gelatina gel, para cabello para vender al mayor y por unidad, ya que también ofrecen en los distintos negocio de la capital, lo que se requiere de mucho capital para poder cumplir con la demanda, entre otros producto vende gaseosa, refresco, golosina, y CD en música y películas, lo que espera que a futuro tener un local propio para su negocio. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible el aumento de su capital el cual le generara ganancias para comenzar hacer su vivienda.
texts.en:
The young Marlon Antonio is 24 years old, and he lives in the neighborhood of Pilar in the capital of Managua. His wife has two children, who are 2 and 4 years old. His plans are to have his own house since he now lives in his parents’ house. He has a business selling cosmetics and a variety of products. Since he was young, he has worked with his parents since they have a grocery store in the market. This is an advantage because he knows a lot about business and has been supported by his parents. He has worked and with his savings, he has succeeding in becoming independent. This is his second loan cycle with Afodenic. He will use the loan to buy hair gel to sell at wholesale and individually. He needs a lot of capital so that he can meet his customers’ demand. The other products that he sells include soda, drinks, sweets, music CDs, and DVDs. He hopes that in the future he can have his own location for his business. He is thankful for Afodenic because they have made is possible for him to increase his capital, with which he is able to generate more earnings to begin building his home.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair gel to sell at wholesale in different areas

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 28-year-old father of one who lives and operates his retail shop in the Mukuru slums. He is requesting a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to increase his stock. He hopes that one day he will set up and operate a well-established company. He describes himself as focused, determined, and strong.




Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add stock to his store

loans.name: Nabisalu 5 Nasubuga Florence Group

texts.en: Florence N. is a 26 year old single woman blessed with two school-age children.  She is the president of her group. She has been running a salon since 2007.   She will use this loan to purchase chemicals, hair extensions, hair foods, etc.  She will also be able to add capital to her business. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to educate her children and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, hair extensions, hair foods, etc.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Mr. Hang P. is a 29-year-old married man and father. He works as an electrician for a hotel in the middle of Siem Reap Province. Another source of income for the family comes from his wife’s poultry business. This couple is blessed with three children who are enrolled in school. Hang P. finds it hard to travel to his workplace because he doesn’t have a vehicle. Therefore, Hang P. would like to request a loan to add to his small personal savings in order to buy a used motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. To earn a living, she sells medicines at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to expand her business in the future by having a maternity home. She hopes for a loan amounting to NGN 50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She is a hardworking woman and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell smoked banana plantains

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
Florentina tiene 55 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en la casa que heredó de sus padres.
Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de gaseosas al por mayor y desde hace un año, ella misma elabora y embotella sus bebidas. Para ello viaja con frecuencia a las ciudades donde distribuye su producto. La época de verano es cuando tiene mayor demanda y puede obtener mejores ganancias, por lo que se abastece muy bien para esa temporada. 
El deseo de Florentina es poder vender sus bebidas en otras ciudades, para ello seguirá trabajando arduamente para incrementar su capital de trabajo.

Es la sexta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas y en esta oportunidad renueva su compromiso de responsabilidad. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de los insumos para la fabricación de su producto; tales como azúcar, esencia, saborizante, entre otros.
texts.en:
Florentina is 55 years old and lives with her two children in the house that she inherited from her parents. For the last three years she has been selling soda in bulk; and this last year she herself has been making and bottling the beverages. In this respect, she frequently travels to cities where she distributes her products. Summer is the time when demand is greatest and she can earn more, so she stocks up well for that season. It is Florentina's wish to be able to sell her drinks in other cities, and for that she will keep working hard to increase her capital. This is her sixth loan from Kiva Field Partner, Microfinanzas Prisma (MFP). Florentina is very responsible when it comes to making the loan repayments and this opportunity is renewing her commitment to responsibility. She will use the money she is now requesting to buy ingredients for making her drinks, such as sugar, essences and flavorings.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make beverages

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has been applied for by four low-income people. One of these people, Mrs. Lay S., has been promoted by the other members of the group to be the leader.

Lay S. was born in 1980 and has been married for many years to Mr. Siem Sok, age 30. This couple now has three young children who are studying.

Lay S. and her husband catch fish in the river to earn their living. Recently they can’t catch as many fish as before because some of their equipment is ruined and needs repair. Lay S. is therefore asking for a loan to repair their broken equipment as well as to buy new items for fishing.

The other borrowers are: V., a fisherman, who requests a loan to buy a fishing boat; S. who catches fish and needs a loan to redecorate her old house; and D. who requests a loan to buy a boat for fishing. D. was not available for the photo so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To repair broken fishing equipment and to buy new items

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Antonio G. González, tiene una propiedad de 90 manzanas de extensión con diferentes tipos de aéreas para explotación, tiene 10 manzanas que las utiliza para cultivar granos básicos (frijol y maíz), 80 manzanas de área apta para el cuido y manejo de ganado, el se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos de consumo como cultivo de frijol y maíz,  la razón para la cual utilizara este financiamiento. Es para comprar 4 toretes para desarrollo o Engorde, cada uno le costara U$ 250.00 DOLARES los cual el espera venderlos a un precio de C$ 350.00 DOLARES, tendrá un margen de ganancia de U$ 400.00 DOLARES al final o cuando él los venda. Este cliente comenzó cultivando granos básicos  únicamente en épocas de invierno, el trabajo lo hacía con ayuda de su familia, el es casado tiene una esposa y 4 hijos quienes son mayores  de edad y le ayudaban en las actividades de trabajo en el campo a sembrar y cultivar hasta la cosecha de estos granos , este cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo y actualmente continua haciéndolo, con la compra de estos toretes el espera tener una ganancia a la  fecha que él los ponga a la venta y de esa forma ir mejorando su actividad de trabajo y ala ves le ayudara a tener otra fuente de ingresos para él y su familia, esto le permitirá mejorar su nivel de vida.
Don Manuel Antonio G. González, ha tenido 6 créditos  desde el año 2005 lleva 5 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permitieron mejorar sus actividades de trabajo lo que le han dado como resultado tener e ir mejorando su nivel de vida teniendo mejores ingresos y oportunidades de trabajo para cuidar o cumplir con las obligaciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Manuel Antonio G. González has a property of 90 Manzanas (1 Manzana = 1.68 acres) and he uses different areas for different activities: he has 10 Manzanas to plant basic grains (beans and rice) and 80 Manzanas are suitable for cattle. He focuses on planting basic grains for consumption such as beans and corn, activities for which he will use the loan. He will also buy 4 young bulls for growing and fattening; each bull will cost $250 (US dollars) and he hopes to sell them for $350 each, for a total profit margin of $400. He started growing basic grains only in the winter season, and he did the work with his family; he is married and has 4 children who are now adults but used to help him with the farm work to plant and harvest the grains. He has been doing this line of work for a long time and he continues doing it now. With the purchase of the bulls he hopes to make some profit at the time he sells them; the profit will help to improve his productivity, and to have an additional source of income for his family; this will allow him to improve their quality of life. Mr. Manuel Antonio G. González has had 6 loans since 2005 and has worked with Ceprodel for 5 years. The impact and benefits he has received from the loans are very important since they have allowed him to improve his agricultural activities which have resulted in a continued improvement of his quality of life; he has better income and more work opportunities to provide and fulfill his family responsibilities.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 4 young bulls for growing

loans.name: Saymakhmud

texts.ru: Мадчидов Саймахмуд проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 27 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Отец, преподает в средней школе. Сам Саймахмуд животноводством занимается более 3 лет. Он откармливает и продает крупно- рогатый скот. Саймахмуд раньше преподавал в средней школе. Он имеет высшее образование. Кредит просит для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Saymakhmud M. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 27 years old. He is married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. His father is a teacher in secondary school. Saymakhmud has been in animal husbandry for more than three years. He feeds and sells large cattle. Saymakhmud used to teach in secondary school. He has high education. He is asking for a loan to buy large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Fatouma

texts.en: Fatouma K. is 29 years old. She has three children and her husband works in the military. Mrs. K. works in the Grand Marché de Hedzranawoé selling snacks and staple food products. She began this business in 2005 and is now asking for her first loan from WAGES. Fatouma will use the majority of this loan to purchase cookies for resale and the remainder will go towards spaghetti and any other products she needs to keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: To purchase of cookies, spaghetti and other food items for resale

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Mr. Cheng S., age 50, and his wife, Mrs. Srey Yin, age 46, (pictured together) live about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. One of their sons has full-time employment, two daughters are garment factory workers and another one stays at home.

Cheng and his wife have been farming for twenty years. Besides farming, they also raise pigs and produce rice wine. Cheng is requesting his first loan of $250 to purchase feed for his pigs.

loans.use: To buy feed for his pigs

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong S., 48, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia — an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She makes silk scarves which brings her an income of about $1 per day.  Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $0.3 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of $700 to buy more raw silk to expand her current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to fix her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more raw silk

loans.name: Enhbaigalmaa

texts.en:
Enhbaigalmaa is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two oldest daughters, aged 22 and 21, attend a university. One of Enhbaigalmaa's daughters helps her with the business.

Currently, Enhbaigalmaa operates a tailoring business at a rented workplace. She is assisted in the business by her entire family and has been successfully operating her business since 2007. Initially her working capital was 80,000 tugrugs (approximately 60 USD), but she has managed to increase her working capital to more than 400,000 tugrugs (approximately 290 USD).

Enhbaigalmaa has been planning to expand her business in the future. She is a very hardworking and open person. She is focused on growing her business and says, “My dream is to one day create my own comfortable workplace for my business.”

Enhbaigalmaa is requesting an 800,000 tugrug loan to purchase more necessary materials, including silk and fabric, for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials, including silk and fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more plumbing materials to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel A. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Maricel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living she sells plastic ware like Tupperware as well as Avon and Fullerlife products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $450 a month from these activities.

In 2006, Maricel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 18th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Huot

texts.en: Mrs. Huot S. is 37 years of age and a resident of Siem Reap Province. To generate a daily income, Huot S. is a local laborer who is hired by people to harvest their mature crops. Additionally, she also goes with her husband to fish in and around the river. This couple has given birth to six children who are public school students. Because their current income is not adequate to serve them, Huot S. is looking for capital to invest in a pig raising business. Mrs. Huot S. and her mother are pictured above.

loans.use: To invest in a pig raising business.

loans.name: Ganhavh

texts.en:
Ganhavh E. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Two of his sons, ages 15 and 12, attend a local secondary school.

Ganhavh has been operating a wooden-products business in his town since 2000, especially a horse-head fiddle-making business, and has found success in his trade. He designs and produces many different styles and sizes of the musical instrument that he sells throughout his community including sales at Nomin Department Store, Flower Trade Center, and Souvenir House. His wife is in charge of the production sales. With the business profit, the family purchased a house.

For the future, Ganhavh says, "My main business goal is to continue to produce quality products and to enlarge my business by completing a newly-built workplace for my customers. I am thinking of hiring four skilled employees."

Ganhavh is very hardworking and modest person and is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials for his new workplace building. Ganhavh is to the right of the picture.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his new workplace

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao M., 31 years old, owns a small shop located along the big road where she sells soft drinks and food. She typically makes around $8.33 of profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable living. She has been married for many years to Pin Phoeun, 30, a local farmer, and they have not any children yet. 

Mao M. is running her business well because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. However, her income is not very much as her business has recently come to a low capacity due to insufficient financial capital. Mao M. wishes to have more funds to increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mr. Mon C. (pictured here), 26, and his wife, Mrs. Savorn Nhem, 18, have been married since 2008 and have no children yet. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mon and his wife have been selling fish since they married. He is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,200 purchase a motorbike to carry fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to carry fish to sell.

loans.name: Fight For Shameness Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Fight For Shameness” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty-business women who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, in order to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Ramda A. who is pictured on the left. 41-year-old Ramda was born in Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone. She is a widow with three children: two in secondary school and one in college.

For many years now, Ramda has been selling locally dyed clothes (called “gara lappers”) soap, and some market food like salt, oil, pepper, etc. She will use her share of the loan to expand her business by buying more of the above mentioned items in large quantity.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making gara lappers, plus soaps and market food in large quantity

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa T. is from the village of Talibon. She is 54 years old and is married. 

To make a living, Teresa owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years.

Teresa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. 

This loan will be the first loan taken out by Teresa from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Blessing Women Group

texts.en:
Comfort N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Blessing Women.  She is 42 years old, married, and has seven children between the ages of six and 18 years old. She was only able to attend school to eleventh grade due to financial difficulty.

For fifteen years, she has been selling lappas(a traditional dress for women) in various communities around Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of lappas (a traditional dress for women). She describes herself as a very hard-working woman whose dreams are to improve her business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Beatrice is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of lappas (a traditional dress for women)

loans.name: Tourn

texts.en:
Tourn S., 63, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of around $1 each per day. S. is also a tailor at home. Two of her children produce cement steps to sell, earning an income of about $3 each per day. Every month the family has to spend $56 on food, $5 on electricity and $6 on transportation.  

S. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more materials for producing more cement steps to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more materials for producing more cement steps to sell

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is a 19 years old single lady from Tyre, with 4 years of experience working as a makeup artist.  Zahra is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for two reasons; she needs to buy a professional hair dryer chair, in addition to beauty cosmetics and tools; Zahra also wants to pay for her brother’s school fees. Zahra previous loan was to improve her business and had an excellent effect on expanding it and improving her family’s financial situation. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and relatives. She attends several workshops, to stay up to date with what is preferred worldwide. She is willing to improve and expand her beauty center to attract more clients.

loans.use: To buy professional hair dryer chair, cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario B. is 53 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Nabbotuan within the municipality of Solana, Cagayan province on the Luzon islands. Rosario runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Rosario has been in business for over thirty years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

Rosario joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. Rosario is requesting a new loan, her fourth from ASKI, of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Zenon Gustavo

texts.es:
El Señor Zenon Gustavo L. C., curso solo hasta el nivel secundario, no es casado y  tiene 2 hijos, su pareja lo dejo hace como 1 año atrás desde entonces se  el dedica al servicio de moto taxista en Ivirgarzama hace mas de 1 año, el está afiliado al sindicato de moto taxista "CARRASCO", el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una motocicleta para asi mejorar la vida que lleva el y su familia, también poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.

Cabe señalar que el señor Zenon Gustavo L. C. se apersono a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le  comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Zenon Gustavo L. C. has a high school level education, he is not married and he has 2 children. His partner left him about a year ago and since then he has been providing taxi services on his motorcycle in Ivirgarzama. He is affiliated with the syndicated taxi company named "Carrasco". The service he provides is profitable for the great demand, its availability, and for the speed and efficiency of the service. The company has stations in various locations across Ivirgarzama and operates using rotating schedules for the affiliates. 

This is the first time that he accesses a loan through this organization. The loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle. This purchase will contribute to an improvement in the quality of life for himself and his family. He will also be able to provide his clients with a better service.  This will translate into improved earrings and a better quality of life.

Zenon Gustavo L. C. requested a loan soon after his colleagues commented to him on the excellent credit terms offered by the organization.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Juan Alejo

texts.es: El señor Juan tiene 4 hijos que son menores de edad y él se hace cargo de ellos. Cabe señalar que sus productos algunas veces los compra en Managua al por mayor para obtener mejores precios y obtener mayores ganancias. Don Juan dio inicio a su negocio hace 6 años, buscando una fuente alternativa de ingresos para brindarle manutención a su familia. Poco a poco fue haciéndose de inventario y fue de esta manera que consiguió sus clientes que ahora solicitan pedidos grandes. Este crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercancías, ya que desea surtir con una mejor variedad de productos para ofrecer distintas mercancías en la búsqueda de vender más pues se acerca una buena temporada.
texts.en: Juan has four dependent children who he takes care of.   He sometimes buys his products in Managua wholesale so that he can obtain better prices and better profits.  Juan started his business 6 years ago, looking for an alternative source of income to support his family.  Little by little he added inventory and attracted customers who now make large orders with him.  This loan will be invested in buying a larger quantity of merchandise since he would like to stock his business with a better variety of products to offer different merchandise.  He is looking to sell more since a good season is approaching.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana Graciela

texts.es: La señora Juana es una cliente que trabajo desD. la gestión 2003 en el grupo Suma Sarnakani, la señora demostró responsabilidad y puntualidad en la cancelación D. sus cuotas, en la actualidad la señora saco un crédito individual  y dejo su grupo momentáneamente, ella se dedica a la confección D. ropa D. bebe esta actividad la realiza con su esposo, ellos acumulan mercadería hasta cada quincena y las venD. en el departamento D. Santa Cruz, la pareja tiene amplia experiencia en la confección D. ropa D. bebe en cantidad, en su taller tienen aproximadamente tres maquinas para la confección, su casa esta ubicada en la zona huayn a potosi y su taller esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, este negocio necesita D. mucho sacrificio, la pareja tiene que levantarse muy temprano para la confección D. sus prendas, ellos tienen tres hijos que están estudiando y que en sus momentos libres ayudan a la confección D. prensas para bebe, el destino del crédito será invertido  en la compra D. rollos D. tela.
texts.en:
Juana is a client who has worked with the Suma Sarnakani group since the 2003 cycle.  She demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in her repayments.  She is now requesting an individual loan and has left the group for the moment.

She manufactures infant wear with her husband.  They accumulate merchandise for two weeks and then sell it in Santa Cruz department.  The couple has ample experience making infant wear in quantity.  They have approximately three sewing machines in their workshop located in their home in the Huayn a Potosi area.

The business requires much dedication.  The couple has to get up very early in the morning to make their items.  They have three children who are in school and that help make the infant wear during their free time.

The loan will be used to buy bolts of fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric to manufacture infant wear.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria G. D. U. D. 40 años D. edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 17 y 11 años D. edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. DesD. hace 10 años que Victoria posee  una panadería, en la que junto a su esposo se dedican a elaborar el pan que posteriormente su compañero D. vida sale a vender D. manera ambulante por las calles D. Soyapango, mismo municipio en el cual resiD.. Victoria solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, manteca, levadura y otro horno para poder hacer más pan. Tanto para ella como para su esposo contar con la panadería es una gran bendición debido a que es a través D. esta como obtienen el dinero para pagar todos los gastos del hogar y D. su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria G. D. U. is 40 years old.  She is a very hard-working woman who lives together with her husband and two children aged 17 and 11 who are studying.

Victoria has owned a bakery for 10 years.  She works there making bread with her husband which he then goes out to sell as an itinerant street trader in the streets of Soyapango, the town where they live.

Victoria is requesting a loan so that she can buy flour, butter, yeast and another oven so that she can make more bread.  Having the bakery is a great blessing for Victoria and her husband since it makes them the money they need to cover all their household and family expenses.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making bread

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en: Diosdada T.'s main source of income comes from running a tricycle transport service. She is 43 years old, married and has four grown-up children. They are from the village of Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Diosdada has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2004, Diosdada joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Diosdada is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to repair her vehicle for better service. This will be her 14th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle for better service

loans.name: Aracely Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Aracely del Rosario A. R., es trabajadora de una empresa de acueducto y alcantarillado, desempeñando el cargo de Conserje, desde hace 10 años.

Es soltera de 30 años de edad, tiene 2 personas que dependen de ella una es menor de edad. Vive en la ciudad de Managua, en el Municipio de Managua desde hace 11 años.

Este es el primer crédito con CEPRODEL agradece por este préstamo ya que le ayudará a Reparar su vivienda y poder darle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Aracely del Rosario A. R. is employed by a water and sewage company where she has worked as a janitor for ten years.

She is 30 years old, single, and has two people who are dependent on her, one of whom is a minor. Aracely has lived in the city of Managua, municipality of Managua, for eleven years.

This is her first loan with CEPRODEL. She is grateful for this loan since it will be used to help repair her home and provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: Pay for home repairs

loans.name: Sumac Soncco Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SUMAC SONCCO”; el banco  comunal está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac,  provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luzina; La socia tiene 21 años D. edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia tiene un bar Restaurant club llamado Dayane; La socia invirtió todos los ahorros junto a su conyugue y les está yendo muy bien y desea invertir en la implementación del local y ponerlo cada vez más acogedor para que sus clientes se sientan a gustos rodeados D. una atmosfera relajante y muy bien decorada. La socia también alquila este su local a diferentes instituciones públicas y privadas en ocasiones especiales como eventos D. confraternidad entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. muebles y equipar con la decoración el restaurante bar club.

Los otros socios se dedican la carpintería, docentes, tenemos dos odontólogos, venta D. ropa, zapatero, un albañil y un maestro D. obras.

La socia valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el pL. establecido.
texts.en:
Luzina, 21, is a member of the “Sumac Soncco” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province and department.

She has a live-in partner and a son.  She has a restaurant/bar called Dayane.  She invested all her and her spouse’s savings and they are doing well.  She wants to invest in the locale making it even more welcoming so that her customers will feel comfortable surrounded by a relaxing and well-decorated ambience. She also leases out her locale to various public and private institutions on special occasions like fraternal events, among others.

She needs the loan to buy furniture and for the décor of the restaurant/bar.

The other members are carpenters, teachers, we have two dentists, clothing sales, a cobbler, a bricklayer and a master construction worker.

Luzina values the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.
