loans.use: To buy furniture to equip her restaurant/bar.

loans.name: Epse Degbe Flanti

texts.fr: Madame Flanti  a  55 ans  et  mère  de  5 enfants.   Elle  habite  quartier  Attiégou.  Elle  fait  le  commerce  de  charbons  de  bois pour participer  au  foyer.  Elle  a  commencé  en  1997  et  s’approvisionne à Kpalimé.  Elle  revend  les  charbons  à  la devanture de  sa   maison.  Elle  sollicite un  crédit  pour  acheter  20 nouveaux  sacs de  charbons  de  bois.
texts.en: Mrs. Flanti is 55 years old and the mother of 5 children.   She lives in the district of Attiégou.  She is in the business of selling charcoal in order to help meet household expenses.  She began in 1997 and gets her supplies in Kpalimé.  She resells the charcoal from her home.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy 20 new sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es:
Maria de 37 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un comedor llamado “Dos Hermanas”. Ha trabajado con esfuerzo y dedicación hace 5 años atrás para aumenta su negocio. 

Comenzó con vendiendo 5 almuerzo y ahora tiene un pequeño comedor en un local bien distribuido. Trabaja con sus hijos desde las 07h00am haciendo la comida hasta la merienda 21h00pm. Cada desayuno lo vende a $ 1.00, los almuerzos a $ 1.25 y las meriendas a $ 1.50. Para continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo sillas y mesas para mejorar el ambiente del negocio.
texts.en:
Maria, age 37, is a hardworking woman who manages a diner called “Dos Hermanas” (Two Sisters). For the past five years, she has worked with effort and dedication to grow her business.

Maria started out selling five lunches and now she has a small diner in a good location. She works with her children preparing food and snacks from 7am until 9pm. Maria sells each breakfast for $1.00, lunches for $1.25, and snacks for $1.50. In order to continue with her business, she wants to use this loan to buy chairs and tables to improve the facilities in her business.

loans.use: To purchase chairs and tables.

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Mrs. Thach L. (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Mr. Yon Chuon, got married in 1972 and have four sons. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Thach is a weaver, while her husband is a wooden house builder. Some of his materials have broken down and do not work well; he wants to repair his materials so he can continue his business. Hence Thach is asking for a loan of $300 to help with her husband’s business by making those repairs.

loans.use: To repair construction materials for her husband.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha B. is from Tawi-Tawi, Aloran, Mis Occ. She is 33 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store and a hog-raising business. She has been engaged in this business for three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to buy other pigs. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used for additional capital for her business. This will be the first loan taken out by Juditha B. from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standards of her family. 

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es: Nubia tiene 39 años, su negocio es la venta de refrescos y crianza de cerdos. Tiene más de 5 años con este medio de vida, ella inicio este negocio porque es muy rentable ya que en frente de su casa está un colegio y la mayoría de estudiantes llegan a buscar a su vivienda los diferentes refrescos que ofrece como linaza, cebada, naranja, cacao,  melón, mango entre otros. A pesar de los desafíos que enfrenta como es el tiempo ya que tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo y tiene que realizar los quehaceres del hogar, pero es algo que ha sabido manejar. El crédito es para la compra de frutas, bolsas, pajillas, azúcar, hielo, baldes entre otros.
texts.en: Nubia, 39, has a business selling refreshments and raising pigs.  She’s been earning her living this way for five years.  She started the business because it’s quite profitable because there’s a school across from her house and most of the students come by her house seeking the various refreshments, like flax, barley, orange, cocoa, melon and mango, among others that she makes.  Despite the challenges she faces, like time because she has two minor children in her care and she has to do the household chores, she has learned how to manage everything.  The loan is to buy fruit, bags, straws, sugar, ice and buckets, among others.

loans.use: to buy fruit, bags, straws, sugar, ice and buckets, among others.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad, tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposo e hijos, la cual cuenta con servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en el distrito Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.   Zona que desarrolla la actividad agrícola,  ganadera y artesana (alfarería y metalurgia).

Luz se dedica a la comercialización de chicha de jora (bebida realizada a base de maíz molido que lo dejan fermentar y luego le colocan otros insumos y está lista para consumirla), de harina de maíz y cajas de cervezas, la chicha de jora lo prepara en su mismo domicilio, actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años  y lo ofrece a sus clientes que la conocen, de esta manera tiene ingresos  económicos para poder solventar los gastos familiares.

A solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles mediante Capital Semilla para comprar insumos para seguir elaborando la chicha de jora, la harina de maíz y cerveza que vende, los pedidos  que le hacen le permite tener mayores ganancias, ya que su clientela se ha incrementado considerablemente,  para poder pagar su crédito y de paso mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Luz es unapersona dedicada a su trabajo y muy responsable a pesar de la competencia desea que su negocio crezca, ya que su meta es que con los ingresos  que obtenga pueda  darles un mejor futuroa sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz is the mother of a family, 52 years old, and she has a house of her own where she lives with her husband and children. It is only equipped with electricity and it is locate din the district of Tambogrande, at 40 minutes from the department of Piura. This region's primary activities are agriculture, farming and crafts (pottery and crafted metals).

Luz sells chicha de jora (a drink made from a crushed corn base which is left to ferment and later other ingredients are added before it is ready to be consumed), corn flour, and boxes of beer. She prepares chicha de jora in her own home. She has had her business for 5 years and she offers the product to her clients that know her. This is how she earns an income to provide for her family's expenses.

She requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles through Capital Semilla. She will purchase ingredients to keep making chicha de jora, corn flour, and to resell beer. The orders that are placed help her to increase her profits, especially since her clients have increased considerably. It will help her repay her loan and to improve the quality of life for her family. Luz is a person who is dedicated to her work and she is very responsible. Despite the competition she wants to develop her business and her goal is to provide her children with a better future with the help of her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make chicha de jora and to purchase beer.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 46 year old married man with nine children.  He lives in his own semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after his family lies solely with him, and his desire is to help his children get a university education. For ten years he has been farming as well as purchasing other people’s tea plantations during the harvest season. This has enabled him to pay his children’s school fees despite the challenges of seasonal changes. His desire is to own at least twenty acres of land. John needs this loan to plant tea.

loans.use: to plant tea.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jacinta is 43 years old. Four of her children are in school.

Jacinta has an eatery business in the Philippines. Jacinta requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jacinta has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jacinta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Sadaf's Group

texts.en:
Sadaf has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s painting business. He is a painter by trade. He paints walls, doors and windows. He gets work on a contract basis. He gets good money after finishing the work.  He has some permanent and some new clients. His permanent clients always approach him whenever they are in need of painting work due to his good services. The earned income allows him to manage the household expenses. 

Sadaf is a very caring lady, takes care of her family and providing them comfort by fulfilling their needs. She cooks  good and healthy food for them so they remain healthy. She specially takes care of her husband’s health because she knows that his job requires lots of hard work and struggle and his good health is very necessary. 

With the loan, he will buy paint brushes and also some paint to provide better services to his clients and earn better. 

Sadaf is hopeful that the loan investment will have a positive impact on his business and improve the living standard of her family as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sadaf.

loans.use: To buy paint brushes and paint for painting business.

loans.name: Josias

texts.es: Josias es  natural de la ciudad de Kimbiri, tiene 73 años, es un hombre sociable, argumenta que por motivos personales llegó a separarse de su pareja y por ello esta a cargo de cubrir los gastos de  educación de su menor hijo Josias de 22 años, ambos viven en su propia morada. Josias es un hombre de valor y perseverancia no se amilanó ante los problemas que pasó, al contrario tuvo el valor de superar y sobre salir adelante con el apoyo de su menor hijo. Gracias al esfuerzo de su juventud construyó su propia casa de 03 pisos situada en el distrito de Kimbiri, donde hoy solo le queda las fuerzas para administrar  los cuartos que ocupan sus arrendatarios y con ello cubre los gastos de educación de su hijo, pero el dinero no cubre todas sus necesidades por eso acude a los prestamos para llevar consigo el mejoramiento de las fachadas de su vivienda y así brindar una buena comodidad a sus ocupantes. Para la tranquilidad de sus años posteriores solo desea brindar buenas habitaciones a sus inquilinos ya que de eso dependerá el buen ingreso de su economía. Este será su décimo crédito y esta muy contento de trabajar con MFP a la vez espera el apoyo de todos ustedes, que contará una vez mas con el apoyo para llevar consigo el propósito de mejorar las habitaciones de su morada. Con los 1500 nuevos soles que solicita, le servirá para la compra de materiales como pintura, selladores y rodillo.
texts.en:
Josías is from the city of Kimbiri.  He’s 73 years old.  He is a sociable man.  He relates that due to personal reasons he separated from his wife and because of this he’s in charge of covering education costs for his youngest son, Josías, 22.  The two of them live in their own house. Josías is a brave, persevering man who was not discouraged by the problems he went through.  On the contrary, he had the valor to overcome and continue forward with help from his youngest son.  

Thanks to the efforts of his youth, he managed to build a three story house located in Kimbiri District.  Today, he only has strength enough left to manage the rooms his tenants rent and uses profits from that to pay for his son’s education.  However, the money doesn’t suffice to meet all his needs so this is why he depends on loans to carry out improvements to his dwelling in order to provide more comfort for its occupants.

In order to have more peace of mind in his later years, all he wants to do is provide good accommodations for his tenants since that is what good income for him depends on.  This will be his 10th loan with MFP.  He hopes to get support from all of you to once again have the support he needs to improve the rooms in his house.  He will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy supplies like paint, sealants and a paint roller.

loans.use: to buy paint, sealants and a roller.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.fr: Evariste est né  au Rwanda. Il est marié, il  a 30 ans, il a 1 enfant de 6 mois. Il  a 2 ans des études secondaires. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour entretien de son taxi minibus. Il  n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est posséder plus d’un minibus pour le taxi. Pour ses ambitions il voudrait fonder l’agence de voyage internationale en utilisant des grands bus, et payer les frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Evariste was born in Rwanda. He is married, is 30 years old, and has a 6-month-old baby. He has had two years of high school education. This is his second loan with ACB. He is going to use his loan to maintain his minibus taxi. He has no foreseeable reason not to repay his loan. His strategy to expand his business is to have more than one minibus for his taxi business. Regarding his ambitions, he would like to open an international travel agency using big buses and pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: to maintain his minibus taxi

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Xiomara del Carmen es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre de dos hijos de los cuales solamente uno tiene a su cargo a los que ha tratado de darles lo mejor y una buena educación, se desempeña como Bibliotecaria en una Institución de la localidad por más de diez años para la buena educación de los niños.
Cuenta con su propia vivienda con buenas condiciones, la que ha mejorado gracias a su salario y a los distintos créditos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel, también ha adquirido varios bienes para su hogar, una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un préstamo para comprar una computadora portátil para su hijo con el fin de que agilice sus trabajos en la escuela, por tal razón decidió solicitar su crédito número once en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad.
texts.en:
Xiomara del Carmen is from the town of El Sauce.  She is the mother of two children, but only one is still at home.  She has tried to give them a good life and a good education.  She started working in the library of an institution in her area more than ten years ago so that her children would have a stong education.
She has her own house that is in good condition.  She has improved it thanks to her salary and to various loans that she has received from Ceprodel.  She has also acquired some items for her home, but now she needs a loan to buy a laptop for her son.  This will make his work easier at school and so she decided to request loan number eleven from Ceprodel for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Takeu

texts.en: Takeu is 29 years old and is married with two children. For the past five years, he has been a wheat farmer. He learned about KADET through an advertisement and is applying for his second loan with KADET. Takeu will use his loan to buy wheat seed to plant and chemicals for spraying. He plans to use the proceeds from his loan to reinvest into his farm.

loans.use: to buy wheat seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela es casada y vive en la localidad muy bonita en donde la gente se dedica a trabajar todo el tiempo en el campo a la siembra de  maíz, frijol, para tener sus propios ingresos.

    Ella se dedica a su hogar y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, como son; azúcar, frijol, aceite, galletas, jabón, avena, entre otros, en esta actividad lleva practicando cinco meses y comenta que le va bien.

    Lo que lo motivo a esta actividad fue su familia ya que quiere tener una mejor calidad de vida, trabajando con algo que le deje ingresos y pueda apoyar también a su esposo quien trabaja en el campo.

     Lo que más desea es que con el préstamo que le han estado otorgando pueda seguir incrementado mas su actividad continuar trabajando con su actividad que tanto le está apoyando.
texts.en:
Gabriela is married and lives in a very pretty place where the people spend all of their time working in the countryside cultivating corn and beans to earn a living.

Gabriela has a home-based business, and she is requesting a loan to invest in merchandise to stock her grocery store, such as: sugar, beans, cooking oil, cookies, soap, oatmeal and other items.  She has been doing this work for 5 months, and she says that it is going very well.

Her family was the motivation for her to start this business, because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in income and allows her to support her husband, who is a farmer.

What she wants most is to expand her store with the loan that has been granted to her, and to continue with this type of work, which is providing her with so much support.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: San José Obrero Group

texts.es:
El comité San Jose Obrero está conformado D. 11  integrantes D. la ciudad D. Curuguaty. Actualmente están en el segundo ciclo, y lo han logrado trabajando con responsabilidad y así salir siempre adelante con solidaridad y unión entre todas. Ellas se definen como personas muy trabajadoras, sacrificadas y muy responsables en cuanto al cumplimiento D. sus obligaciones.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Francisca, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que desD. muy temprano empieza su jornada laboral. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo tipo D. productos. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, pues la mayoría D. las personas del barrio van hasta su negocio. Lo que la ayuda en las ventas es su amabilidad para con los clientes. Desea poder ir creciendo paulatinamente y D. esa forma ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. comestibles, bebidas, carne y otros para abastecer su local, con lo cual podrá cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes. Está agradecida con la Fundación, pues D. obtener el crédito le será D. gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Jose Obrero consists of 11 members from the city of Curuguaty. They are currently in their 2nd cycle and have achieved this by working responsibly. As such they always come out in front with solidaity and unity amongst all.  They describe themselves as very hardworking, self-sacrificing and very responsible people in meeting their obligations.

One of the members is Señora Francisca. She is a very hardworking woman whose working day starts very early. She has a store well stocked with all kinds of products. She says that she has a lot of customers as most of the people in the neighbourhood frequent her business. What helps her sell is her friendly manner with the customers. She wants to be able to grow slowly and in this way help her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy groceries, beverages, meat and other products to stock up her store to meet the demands of her customers. She is grateful to the Fundacion as obtaining the loan will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy groceries, beverages, meat and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Telma

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, viuva e mãe de 1 filho que frequenta a escola. Fez 10ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os pais enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas dispesas. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é comerciante ha mais de 2 anos e tem um rendimendo de cerca de 5.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (óleo, arroz, amendoim,sumos, peixe, e outros.) para aumentar o volume do negocio.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para ampliar a sua actividade comercial e construir um salão,irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Born in Maputo city, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique, the borrower is a widow and the mother of a son who goes to school. She completed Grade 10 but did not continue as it was too expensive. She lives in her own house with her family, and supports her parents by sending money to assist with their expenses.

She has never left her homeland. She has been running a small business for more than two years and earns about 5,000 MT (Mozambican Meticals) per month. She uses this for household expenses and saves some in her bank account.

She has never had loans with other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 15,000 MT. With the loan she will buy more products (oil, rice, peanuts, juices, fish, and others) to increase the volume of business.

In the future she will try to grow her business and build a space for it. She will ask for more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: buy products for sale (oil, rice, peanuts, fish and other items.)

loans.name: Djogbe

texts.fr: Rafiatou est mariée et a à charge 2 enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle vit en couple avec ses enfants. Son époux est agent comptable dans une société de la place. Les charges familiales reviennent au couple. Rafiatou est coiffeuse de formation, fonction qu'elle exerce présentement. A cela, elle a associé la vente des mèches, des produits cosmétiques, des sacs, des chaussures, des pagnes et autres articles qu'elle vend a une clientèle diversifiée et variée. Ses approvisionnements se font auprès des grossistes de la place. La cliente souhaiterait que son commerce connaisse une parfaite évolution, raison pour laquelle elle a sollicité et obtenu à FINADEV son 1er microcrédit afin de jouir d'une autonomie financière susceptible de l’aider à augmenter le volume de son stock pour une meilleure satisfaction des attentes de ses clients. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par ce micro crédit lui permettra de faire face à ses charges personnelles et de contribuer à l'épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en: Rafiatou is married and has two children in her care, both attending school. She lives with her husband and the children. Her husband is an accountant in a local company. Household expenses are shared by the parents. Rafiatou is a trained hairdresser and currently works in her profession. In addition, she sells hair extensions, cosmetics, handbags, shoes, pagnes (colorful West African cloths) and a few other articles to a diversified clientele. She gets her supplies from local wholesalers. Rafiatou would like to see her business in steady expansion. Therefore she came to the microfinance institution Finadev and applied for her first microloan. The loan was granted and it will enable her to become financially self-sufficient and to expand her inventory and thus better meet the expectations of her customers. The additional income that she expects thanks to this microloan will enable her to provide for her personal needs and contribute to her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy 25 units of Hitarget cloth.

loans.name: Nakri

texts.en: Nakri, 40 years old, is a farmer earning $2 per day. Her husband is a chief of construction workers earning $7 per day. They have two children, and both are studying. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, and $30 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband to use to get to work. Nakri wants to buy peanuts to boil and sell in Phnom Penh city because she saw her villagers do it and can make good income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use to get to work.

loans.name: Natalia Jacqueline

texts.es:
Natalia Jacqueline tiene  26 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos  vive con los padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de  Bolívar.

La VRC Vuelve la Esperanza esta conformada por 13 socios y socias, está ubicada en la Parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la Oficina.

Natalia  se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, soya y cacao las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.

 Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insumos, abonos  para los cultivos. 
Con la ayuda del préstamo aumentará y mejorara la producción, le ayudará a suplir necesidades económicas, Enfrenta desafíos que son muy frecuentes como la competencia y las plagas a los cultivos.
El sueño es poderse comprar una casa para poder vivir tranquilos sin preocuparse de los arriendos.
En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo, es solidaria, tranquila, trabajadora y le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
Natalie Jacqueline is 26 years old, single, does not have children and lives with her parents in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

The communal bank Vuelve la Esperanza is composed of 13 members and is located in San  José del Tambo parish about 60 minutes from the field partner’s office.

Natalie is a farmer who plants corn, soy and cacao. She buys and sells in San José del Tambo every weekend.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost and other farming supplies for her crops. With the help of a loan she will increase and improve production which will help her provide for economic necessities. She frequently confronts challenges such as competition and plant pest infestation. 

Her dream is to be able to buy a house in order to live peacefully without worrying about rental payments. In her free time she enjoys taking walks: she is supportive, congenial, hardworking and enjoys the festivities of carnival.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost and other farming supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Rotchelyn

texts.en:
Rotchelyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Rotchelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Rotchelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rotchelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has been in the quarry business of extracting stones from quarries in Naivasha town for the last 3 years.  She is 24 years old, married to John, and they have one child.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our existing clients and this will be her 1st loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy quarrying tools and equipments so that she may increase her production and income.  In the future, Susan hopes to expand and own many quarries.

loans.use: To buy quarry tools and equipments

loans.name: Abisunganye Corimi Mgsr Nygtng Sk Group

texts.fr:
Diogène fait partie du groupe Abisunganye CORIMI MGSR NYGTNG SK. Il a 31 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 4 à 7 ans, dont 1 scolarisé, il a 1 personnes en charge autre que ses enfants. 

Diogène est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de suivre tous les conseils donnés par les agronomes. Dans les prochaines années, Diogène voudrait être le fournisseur dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en: Diogène is a member of the Abisunganye CORIMI MGSR NYGTNG SK group.  He is 31 years old, married, and has two children who are 4 and 7 years old.  One of his children attends school.  He also supports one additional person.  Diogène is a rice farmer.  He is requesting his second loan from ACB.  This loan will allow him to buy chemical fertilizers for rice production.  To ensure the growth of his business, Diogène is carefully following the advice given by agronomy experts.  In the coming years, Diogène would like to be the supplier for his region.  With the profits, he plans to take care of his children's health and education.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers for rice culture.

loans.name: Dinora Marlene

texts.es:
Dinora, vive con su esposo y una hija de 5 años de edad, es empleada de una maquila, lleva un año trabajando.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de frisser, ya que tiene un negocio en su casa de venta de bebidas, esta inversión le ayudara para mantener frías las gaseosas, jugos, para vender  a los clientes.
La aspiración de ella es hacer una buena inversión con el préstamo, tener resultados positivos ya que su familia cuenta con sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Dinora lives with her husband and her five year old daughter. She works at a factory. She has been working there for one year.
She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a freezer since she now has a business selling beverages in her home. This investment will help her keep the soft drinks and juices cold while selling them to customers.
Her aspirations are to make a good investment with the loan and to have good results since her family counts on the income.

loans.use: purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Amévi

texts.fr:
Amévi est une femme  âgé(e) de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un  entrepreneur et a 02 enfants.
Amévi travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale  depuis 2000. Elle vend à domicile après s’être approvisionné dans les marchés environnants.
Amévi a requis son  premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des marchandises pour répondre à la demande de la clientèle. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité avec les profits réalisés.
Dans les prochaines années, Amévi voudrait augmenter son activité afin de mieux s’occuper de son ménage.
texts.en: Amévi is a 29-year-old woman.  She is married to an entrepreneur and has two children.   Amévi has been reselling general food products since 2000.  She buys her products at nearby markets and sells from home.  Amévi has required her first loan from WAGES in order to buy merchandises to meet her customers' demand.  With the profits, she would like to reinvest in her business.  In the coming years, Amévi would like to increase her activity in order to take better care of her household.

loans.use: To buy general food items.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a single mother of four and owns a salon which has been in operation for thirteen years. She was first employed in a salon, saved some money and purchased her equipment before opening the salon.

She is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase salon products such as cosmetics. Her aspiration is to open a larger salon despite this challenge of a seasonal sales period. Emily will save the extra income from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase salon products such as cosmetics.

loans.name: Mayen

texts.en:
Mayen is a 27-year-old, married woman with two children, all of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Mayen is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en: Erdenetsetseg is 56 years old and lives with her two daughter and two nephew in a house in Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. She started her business in 1996 by selling meat at the local black market. Her daily sales is from 20 to 30 kg. She is gradually expanding her business. She has many regular suppliers and buyers. She want to expand own business." She is requesting a 2,000,000MNT loan to purchase meat for her business.  She has been doing this business consistently. She is a hard-working and energetic woman.

loans.use: To purchase more meat.

loans.name: Weldon

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Weldon, a 40 year-old farmer from Cheborgei location in the South Rift region of Kenya. Weldon has been married for 6 years. Gladys, his hardworking spouse, has given him a boy- 2 years old- and a girl- 9 months old.

To provide for this lovely small family, Weldon practises dairy and poultry farming on a single acre piece of land. He owns 10 birds of poultry and a dairy cow named Birirmet (vernacular meaning 'a brown-headed cow').

Weldon is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed in order to offer protection to his cow and prevent her from harsh weather conditions.

Your loan investment will help Weldon create a conducive environment for his cow to improve milk production. The income he makes from selling milk will increase as a result and his family will be positively impacted through increased income and improved diet.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a single woman, 24 years old with two children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur.

Jocelyn has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dry goods products to sell to her stall.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods products to sell to her stall

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a primary school dropout and has no formal training. He is not yet married but he supports his younger sisters, one in primary school and the other in secondary school. In 2001, Bernard received the equivalent of $51 from his Uncle to start a hawking business, following failure to raise school fees.  With the loan of $150 from PEMCI, he intends to boost his stock in order to improve his income.  He is a very confident young man and we believe he has a good future with us.

loans.use: Buy Assorted Items for Hawking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I intent to expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Aida Delia

texts.en:
AIDA IS 29 YEARS OLD, MARRIED, THREE CHILDREN. HER HUSBAND WORKS AS A TEACHER AT A PRIMARY SCHOOL. SHE WORKS BUYING FABRICS AND MAKING ARTICLES OF CLOTHING, AND SHE SELLS THEM AMONG THE PEOPLE OF HER COMMUNITY. SHE IS PART OF THE GROUP "FLOR DE LIZ 2". THE OTHER GROUP MEMBERS WORK IN THE FOLLOWING FIELDS:

CINDY J. MORENO BONIFAZ (SELLING WOMEN'S ACCESSORIES)

MARIA BONIFAZ VASQUEZ (SELLING CRYSTALWARE AND TOYS)

ROSALINDA M. DOMINGUEZ (SELLING WOMEN'S CLOTHING)

THIS LOAN WILL BE DIVIDED PROPORTIONALLY BETWEEN THE GROUP MEMBERS TO STRENGTHEN THEIR BUSINESSES.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

AIDA TIENE 29 AÑOS , CASADA , TRES HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO PROFESOR EN UNA ESCUELA PRIMARIA , ELLA SE DEDICA A COMPRAR TELAS Y CONFECCIONAR PRENDAS DE VESTIR Y LAS VENDE ENTRE LAS PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD, ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO FLOR DE LIZ 2 , LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SE DEDICAN A :

CINDY J. MORENO BONIFAZ ( VENTA DE ACCESORIOS DE MUJER )

MARIA BONIFAZ VASQUEZ ( VENDE CRISTALERIA Y JUGUETES )

ROSALINDA M. DOMINGUEZ ( VENDE ROPA DE MUJER )

EL PRESTAMO SERA DIVIDIDO PROPORCIONALMENTE ENTRE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO PARA FORTALECER SUS NEGOCIOS .

loans.use: MAKING CLOTHING

loans.name: Sadatu

texts.en: Mrs. Sadatu B. is 36 years old and married with four children. She hails from Benin City, Edo State in Nigeria. She sells men's & ladies' wear and she needs the above amount to buy clothes, shoes and bags to sell. She has 15 years of experience in her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Dr. Nathan M. is an obs/ gynecology practitioner managing his own private facility in Kitale, Kenya. He is 47 years old and lives with his wife and four children. He initially set up a small clinic in the center of town but gradually moved to a larger facility to cope with increased clientele from the initial 10 clients a day to 30.

Dr. M. offers a wide range of health services including general medicine, family planning, maternal and child health services. He also has a pharmacy and a laboratory.

Dr. M. attributes his success to hard work, perseverance and assistance from KMET’s two previous microfinance loans. He has received and fully paid back a total of Kshs 500,000 (approximately US $ 7140). As he plans to further expand and integrate other services in his facility, he has applied for a loan of US $ 1200.

loans.use: Facility expansion

loans.name: Abdujabor

texts.en:
Abduchabor is a cheerful person. His business is selling sports clothes for children and teenagers. He has been in business for over 10 years. His stand is located in Ovchikalacha, Khujand; it is very profitable since it is situated in the centre of the clothing market.

Abduchabor buys his goods from Istaravshan's wholesale market every week. Because of his years of work in this business, he has plenty of experience with serving his customers and knows their style preferences and needs. He always tries to sell fashionable but serviceable clothes. He says that his goods are competitive so as to attract more customers. His business is going well and he is going to spend his hoped-for loan purchasing warm sports clothes for the winter season.

loans.use: Purchace of warm sports clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her clothes business

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en: Farogat B. ives in the Nausky region and is married with 3 children. She applied her first loan to MicroInvestin in 2005 and thanks to the received loan she improved her business tremendously. She now trades mens wear n the flea bazaar and has several repeat customers. She is experienced and has been in the business for 6 years.  She is now requesting a loan to purchase new inventory and increase her assortment of clothing.

loans.use: For purchasing new inventory

loans.name: Jariantu

texts.en: Jariantu L. is  a 52 year old married mother of 6 children. She hails from Mushin, Laagos state, Nigeria. She sells cooked food and has been in business for the past 30 years. She requests a loan of $450 to enable her to buy  foodstuffs for cooking.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Emy

texts.en:
Emy is 28 years old and is a single woman. She takes care of two other people, ages 18 and 15. Emy is a clothes seller; she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7 AM to 6 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa works with great care and patience in her home and happily embroiders multicolored flowers on the costumes that the beautiful ladies wear in her city’s festivals. Her tasteful and superb finishes of each outfit have increased her list of customers and her list orders from now until a few months before the beginning of the city’s festival month. Her work has very important applications and for that reason she is seeking a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Elisa, trabaja con mucho esmero y paciencia en un espacio D. su hogar y con muy buen gusto va bordando flores multicolores a los trajes que lucirán las bellas damas D. su ciudad en las fiestas costumbristas.Su buen gusto y los excelentes acabados D. cada uno D. sus trajes han acrecentado su lista D. clientes y pedidos, desD. ahora y a pocos meses D. iniciarse el mes D. festejos en su ciudad tiene solicitudes muy importantes y esa razón atienD. su solicitud D. un préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of fabric and thread to continue her work and fulfill each one of her client's requests.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Ordóñez’s General Store’s owner is Leonor Rodríguez Ordóñez, who runs the business from her own home which is located in the “Five Pines” district of the town of Chinandega. She is a woman whom for a long time has devoted herself to this business, managing to stock her shelves with consumable goods and personal and home products which are highly sought-after by her customers.

In order to develop the business, today Leonor needs to invest in the General store in order to move forward: so she has very wisely sought the help of CEPRODEL in order to obtain a loan which will allow her to buy more products and offer them to her business’ customers. The business benefits not only her but also her family, which comprises of her two small children.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La pulpería Ordóñez es un negocio cuyo dueña es la señora Leonor Rodríguez Ordóñez el cual administra en su propia casa de habitación que se ubica en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es una dama que por mucho tiempo se ha dedicado al negocio logrando surtir sus estantes de productos comestibles, personales y caseros los cuales son muy solicitados por los clientes.

Por ser un negocio en desarrollo hoy en día la señora Leonor requiere invertir en la pulpería para salir adelante, para ello muy sabiamente ha buscado el apoyo en CEPRODEL para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los productos y así ofrecerlos a sus clientes en su negocio. Con el negocio es beneficiada tanto ella como su familia que está compuesta por sus dos pequeños hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Lace cloth is very adorable and it is used to beautify homes as curtains, tablecloths, and decorations. This has created high demand for lace in Ghana. Mary, a married woman with two children, has made hawking of lace an enjoyable business and wants to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her to save. She would use her savings to register to join the national health insurance scheme to enjoy free medical care and also to support her husband to pay their children’s education.

Mary is a member of the group called Gift. Members agree together to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of lace cloth.

loans.name: Heanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Heanh L. and her husband Mr. Nguon Hem are subsistence farmers in Trapaing Ronas Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They have seven children. One child is employed in a garment factory. Three other children attend the local school. The remaining three are too young to work or enroll in school.

Although the family members have different business activities, they still live under poor conditions. Thus, Mrs. Heanh L. has asked for a loan to start a grocery business and to buy fertilizers for her rice field. Previously, Mrs. Heanh L. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding. She has fully paid off this loan. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To start a grocery business and to buy fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.name: Verónica Antonieta

texts.es:
Verónica is 21 years old. Her greatest difficulty in life was to have had to begin her adult life at age 16 when she became pregnant with her first child. She had to begin working to support her new family and started off selling food in the city of Catac. She now provides meals for 30 clients, all mine workers in the Alpaquita mine in Aija, where her partner also works. She has to have provisions brought by dump truck from the city of Huaraz once a month after she leaves the mine and goes into the city to make her purchases. What really bothers her is thinking about when the time comes for her two children to start school, as she does not know how she will get a chance to see them.

Verónica, who belongs to the communal back “Señor de Ramos” in Catac, spends time in the mine teaching her children the alphabet and she hopes one day to have a chain of restaurants in Lima specializing in regional food and “chifa,” a fusion of the cuisine of Lima and the traditional Chinese food brought to Peru by Cantonese immigrants. With this loan of 500 Soles ($175 USD) which will be provided by the Manuela Ramos Movement and which will be repaid in four installments, she will purchase a sack of rice, sugar, a box of oil and other products she will use in her cooking.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Lo mas difícil para Verónica, de 21 años, ha sido iniciar su vida de adulta a los 16 años, cuando se embarazó de su primer hijo, tuvo que empezar a trabajar, en un inicio vendía comida en la ciudad de Catac, ahora brinda pensión a 30 clientes, todos ellos obreros de la mina “Alpaquita ”, en Aija, donde también labora su conviviente. Tener que llevar los víveres en volquete desde la ciudad de Huaraz ya se le ha hecho costumbre ,donde una vez por mes baja de la mina y compra al por mayor los víveres. Lo que le atormenta es pensar cuando sus 2 hijos tengan que entrar al colegio y no saber como poder ver por ellos. Verónica, que pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Ramos”de Catac, se dedica en la mina a enseñar a sus hijos las vocales, ella espera tener una cadena de restaurantes en la ciudad de Lima y especializarse en la preparación de comida regional y chifa. Con el préstamo de 500 soles que le brindará el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, el mismo que será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará un saco de arroz ,azúcar ,una caja de aceite y algunos otros insumos para que pueda cocinar.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of supplies

loans.name: Khady Sy

texts.fr: Khady Sy Sall est née le 14 mars 1964 à Bargny. Elle habite au quartier de léona dans la commune de Bambey.Elle s'active dans le commerce de produit d'entretien depuis cinq ans.
texts.en:
Khady Sy Sall was born on March 14, 1964 in Bargny. She lives in the city of Bambey. She's been selling cleaning products for five years.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell cleaning products

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher N. is thirty years old. He is single and loves work. He has been spray-painting cars for the past three years. He also does car welding when the need arises. He owns a car spray-painting shop, where customers bring their cars to paint. He also paints rusted durable goods, such as refrigerators, stove, and microwaves. 

He is requesting a loan to buy additional tools and materials, such as assorted paints, sand paper, and spraying machines, to expand his operations. 

He belongs to the "Action Faith Trust" community group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. His picture was taken at his business site.

loans.use: To buy additional tools and materials for his painting business

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos tiene 67 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Dios Guía Nuestros Pasos, vive en la Avenida 12 D. Noviembre 1212 del distrito Florencia D. Mora en la provincia D. Trujillo en el departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudio hasta segundo año D. Primaria en el distrito D. Huaranchal en la provincia D. Otuzco. No continuó estudiando porque sus padres eran muy ignorantes y no les interesaba que sus hijos estudien.
Se casó D. 22 años y ahora tiene 4 hijos, todos casado, a su cargo tiene un nieto.
Santos se dedica a la fabricación y venta D. zapatos, busca compradores, los que van a su casa a comprar el calzado por docena.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas, empezó a trabajar por docena, es decir ha hacer zapatos en serie.
Con este crédito D. 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará material para hacer zapato en serie.
Santos sueña con ir a ver a su hija a Argentina.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos is 67 years old and belongs to the God Guides Our Steps Community Bank. She lives at Avenida 12 D. Noviembre 1212 in the Florencia D. Mora district of the Trujillo province within the La Libertad department of Peru. She studied through the second year of primary school in the Huaranchal district of the Otuzco province. Santos wasn't able to continue her studies because her parents were very ignorant and were not interested in their children's education. Santos married at age 22 and now she has four children, all of whom are now married. Santos cares for one of her grandsons. Santos makes and sells shoes. She looks for buyers who can come to her home and buy footwear by the dozen. With her first loan of 300 soles she began to work by the dozen, or rather, to produce shoes in a series. She repaid the loan in four installments. With this loan of 500 soles Santos will buy material for a new series of shoes. She'll repay the loan in four installments. Santos dreams of visiting her daughter in Argentina.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make footwear.

loans.name: Maleïka (Nom D’Une Personne Honoré) Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de cinq femmes mariées vivant dans des familles nucléaires  avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans le quartier Koko de la préfecture de Koutiala(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali), le groupe Maleika a une moyenne de 35 ans et 4 enfants.
L’activité dominante de ces femmes qui se sont connues par des relations d’alliances et de parenté est essentiellement la vente du bois de chauffe. Elles sont en relation avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier à 100.000 FCFA pour le sixième.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter un stock important de bois de chauffe. Elles s’approvisionnent auprès des paysans ayant une autorisation de coupe dans les villages environnants de la ville de Koutiala. Ensuite à bord de camions 10 tonnes elles acheminent leurs marchandises qui seront vendues en détail au comptant quelques fois à crédit aux ménagères et aux revendeurs.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 100 000 CFA. de bénéfice par  cycle. En dehors du remboursement des prêts, elles utiliseront une partie du revenu  pour les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Made up of five married women who live in nuclear families with their spouses and children in the Koko neighborhood of the prefecture of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali), the Maleika group has an average age of 35 with 4 children.

The primary business activity of these women who met through relatives and in-laws is essentially selling firewood. They have been members of the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso for three years. The amount of their loans has gone from 50,000 F CFA for the first to 100,000 F CFA for their sixth.

This loan will be used to buy a big supply of firewood. They buy it from rural people who have a permit to cut wood in the villages surrounding the town of Koutiala. Then they use 10-ton trucks to transport the wood which will be sold retail and on a cash basis, or sometimes on credit, to housewives and other retailers.

With this loan they expect to make on average 100,000 F CFA in profit per cycle. Apart from the reimbursement of the loan, they will use a part of the income for everyday expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of firewood for re-sale

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam L., 55, is married and lives with her husband in Toul Sangke district, Phnom Pehn, Cambodia. She started her business in 1979, selling fruits and cooking Num Ansorm, a Khmer traditional cake made from piece of pork, banana, sticky rice wrapping with banana leaf. This kind of cake is very popular and well known for locals. Sam L. can typically make about $5 a day of income from her business activity.

Her husband can moderately make $3 each day from working as a motor-taxi driver. Moreover, Sam L. has four children. One of them is enrolled in school, two of them are electricians, and the last one is a factory worker. For her monthly expenses, Sam L. usually spends about $110 on food and $20 on utilities. The expenses are covered 50% by help from her children.

Sam L. would like to request a loan to purchase more fruits to meet her clients’ needs and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Gilma

texts.es:
Pertenece al Banco Comunal  “Juntas hasta el final”, tiene 32 años, no tiene hijos, es soltera, la mejor forma de poder trabajar era poner un negocio, pero no sabía cómo hacerlo, su vecina le invito a participar en el movimiento Manuela Ramos.

Su primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300 Nuevos Soles, compro gaseosas, Yogur, néctar  y golosinas, comenzó poco a poco a crecer.

Con este préstamo  de S/. 2000  Soles puso en su local una cabina telefónica, compro una vitrina para mostrar sus productos y un refrigerador para poder atraer mas clientes.

Esta muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella y se siente muy optimista en las cosas que ella quiere lograr.
texts.en:
Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final”, tiene 32 años, no tiene hijos, es soltera, la mejor forma de poder trabajar era poner un negocio, pero no sabía cómo hacerlo, su vecina le invito a participar en el movimiento Manuela Ramos. Su primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 300 Nuevos Soles, compro gaseosas, Yogur, néctar y golosinas, comenzó poco a poco a crecer. Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 Soles puso en su local una cabina telefónica, compro una vitrina para mostrar sus productos y un refrigerador para poder atraer mas clientes. Esta muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella y se siente muy optimista en las cosas que ella quiere lograr.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a display case to show her products and a refrigerator to increase her sales.

loans.name: Mrs. Pheun Khoem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank consists of eight members and is located in Trapang Kor village in Kampong Chhnang province. They plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. PheU. K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a seller a mall restaurant that sells rice soup. Her husband, Mr. Noup Suth, is a musician who has been hired by the people to perform at wedding ceremonies, parties, and others events. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn too little income to build a new house for their family. Thus, Mrs. PheU. K. has decided to ask for a loan so that she can build a house for her family. She is a 54-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are employed in garment factory while the other helps the mother’s business.

Two members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To build a house for her family.

loans.name: Dezilantah's Group

texts.en: Dezilantah P. is the leader of the Grace loan group in Lugazi. She is 43 years old with 9 children of her own and a cares for the daughter to her late brother. She has a tailoring business that she has been running for the over 15 years.  She specializes mainly in making school uniforms, gomes’s (traditional Ugandan dresses), shirts, trousers, and children’s wear. Her recent loan helped her make enough profits throughout the Christmas season so that she was able to meet the expenses of sending her children to school at the beginning of the school term. This time round, she needs a loan to help buy more clothing material for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing material for the tailoring business.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.es:
La Sra. Restituta J. nació en la ciudad de Capiata el 09 de diciembre del año 1962. Vive desde hace mas de diez años con Emiliano Reyes Acosta.  Ella tiene una hija llamada Andrea de 20 años de edad quien esta estudiando la carrera de obstetricia y a la vez prestando servicios en el Hospital Materno Infantil de Capiata. El Sr. Emiliano trabaja como guardia de seguridad en el horario nocturno mientras la Sra. Restituta tiene una muy surtida despensa en su domicilio. 

Opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2002 accediendo a créditos que facilitan el aumento de su inventario y asi obtener un mayor ingreso familiar a traves del comercio de productos comestibles, a granel bebidas entre otras mercaderías como tambien cubrir los gastos escolares de su hija.
texts.en:
Mrs. Restituta J. was born in the city of Capiata on December 9 of 1962. She has been living with Emiliano Reyes Acosta for more than ten years. She has a daughter, Andrea, who is 20 years old and studying to be an obstetrician and at the same time working at Hospital Materno Infantil of Capiata. Mr. Emiliano works as a security guard during the nights, meanwhile Mrs. Restituta has a well stocked store in her residence. She has been with the Fundacion Paraguayana since 2002 obtaining loans which help her to increase her inventory and improve her family income through the sale of edible products, beverages in bulk among other merchandise. This way she can also cover her daughter's educational expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of edible products, and merchadise in bulk for her general store.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo tiene 39 años de edad, vive con su pareja con la que tiene 3 hijos, actualmente viven en su casa propia. De soltero trabajaba en un hotel como camarero y le pagaban una propina mínima; por ello que decidió regresar a su tierra natal con metas de retomar sus cultivos de cacao, frutos cítricos y café, dándoles el cuidado necesario para que crezcan y den buen fruto. De ese modo, su esfuerzo, se convierta en una actividad rentable, para ello, tiene que abonar cada 6 meses para apresurar el proceso de maduración. Las cosechas que realiza las comercializa inmediatamente en el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced, donde acumula ganancias para cubrir las necesidades primordiales de su hogar. Guillermo y su esposa están muy contentos de ser agricultores, ya que en cada cosecha de café tratan de comprar provisiones y ropa para sus hijos, por ser las únicas fechas donde se puede acumular mayores ganancias, por ello que sus metas son de incrementar sus cultivos de café. Esta es la segunda que viene trabajando con MFP, y tiene toda la predisposición de pagar con puntualidad, ya que no quiere fallarles a los demás socios de su banco comunal. El dinero solicitado en esta ocasión es para la compra de fertilizantes para el abonado de sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 39 years old, lives with his spouse with whom he has 3 children. They currently live in their own house. When he was single he worked in a hotel as a waiter, getting paid a minimal wage; for this reason he decided to return to his birthplace and take up again in the growing of cocoa, citrus fruit and coffee crops, giving them the necessary care so that they grow and produce fruit. In order for his efforts to be profitable he needs to fertilize every six months to accelerate the growing process. He sells his production in the markets of the city of La Merced, where he makes money to cover the necessary expenses of his home. Guillermo and his wife are happy to be farmers, with every coffee harvest they try to buy provisions and clothes for their children. These are the only times that they have sizable income and that is why their goal is to increase the coffee crop. This is the second time that they are working with MFP, they have been paying their installments on time since they do not want to fail the other members of their community bank. The loan that is currently requested is for the purchase of fertilizers for the coffee fields.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Virgen De Urkupiña Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Virgen D. Urkupiña"  se organizaron bajo la dirección D. su presidenta la señora Jahana Vanessa para acceder al financiamiento que les otorga agrocapital cursando juntos su segundo siclo demostrando ser gente honesta y capaz para el cumplimiento D. sus obligaciones y con la premisa D. seguir creciendo junto a la institución. La finalidad del financiamiento es  respaldar el crecimiento D. las diferentes actividades que desarrollan dentro D. la comercialización D. productos metalúrgicas, comida, cosméticos y alguno D. los socios desea independizarse y empezar un nuevo negocio siendo su actividad actual cuidador D. viñedos y empleadas domesticas todo con el afán D. buscar nuevas oportunidades D. mejor su calidad D. vida y la D. sus familias. La competencia en el mercado no es un impedimento para salir adelante por lo que no temen a ningún obstáculo para poder llegar a su objetivo, una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias.
texts.en:
The members of the Community Bank "Virgen D. Urkupina" organized themselves under the direction of their president, Jahana Vanessa, to access financial support through Agrocapital (Kiva Field Partner). They are currently on their second loan cycle and they have shown themselves to be honest and capable individuals with respect to their obligations and wth the premise of continued growth. The goal of loan is to support the expansion of the different business activities including the comercialisation of metallurgical products, foods, cosmetics, and some members have expressed their plan to make themselves independent and start out a new business, especially those that have their own vineyards and those who work in the cleaning industry. They hope to discover new and opportunities and find a better way of life for themselves and their family. The market competition is not a roadblock for their success because they are not intimidated by any obstablce to achieve their goal, that is, a better life for their family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Esperance, 28 years old and married with two children, 9 and 7 years old. She lives in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda. Her husband produces a monthly income of $550.

Esperance owns a jewelry shop in Nyarugenge town. She starts the business at 8:00 a.m. daily and closes at 7:30 p.m. She has worked in the same business since 2007 and now has two full-time employees to help her in that business.

Esperance is seeking her first loan worth 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company which will be paid back within 8 months. Before the loan, Esperance earned a monthly profit of approximately $455. With the loan from Vision Finance Company, Esperance will buy more jewels and from the increased profits she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en: Their education is the most important inheritance Mukaddas and her husband can give to their four, dear children. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband and children, she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenditures, and she would like a loan in order to increase their capital by increasing their production. Mukaddas and her family are waiting for your quick response. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle and young cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Ndeye Mareme

texts.fr: ndeye mareme M. vend des produits cosmetiques depuis 2006.elle est parent beneficiaire et a une experience de plus de trois ans.a cause de l'accroissement progressive de ses ventes elle sollicite un credit de cinquante mille frs pour renforcer son fond de roulement afin de satisfaire sa clientele.
texts.en:
Ndeye Mareme M. has been selling cosmetics since 2006. She is a parent and member of the credit union and has an experience of more than 3 years. Because of the progressive growth of her sales, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 frs to bolster her working capital so that she can satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Jonathan Moisés

texts.es: Jonathan Moisés I. de 22 años de edad vive en el municipio de San Cristóbal departamento Cuscatlán con su esposa que trabaja en su propio negocio. Jonathan se dedica a la venta de sorbetes en la zona de Cojutepeque sus ventas son diarias ya que él se pasea por todos los lugares hasta acabar con su mercadería (sorbete), el crédito que solicita Jonathan es para la compra de materia prima para la producción de sorbete ya que obtendría mayores ganancias si el produjera su sorbete sin necesidad de comprarlo todos los días, de esta manera aumentaría su margen diario en sus ingresos por ventas.
texts.en:
Jonathan Moisés I. is 22 years old and lives in the San Cristóbal municipality of Cuscatlán with his wife who has her own business. Daily Jonathan sells sorbets in the Cojutepeque zone, strolling until he sells all his merchandise (sorbets). The loan Jonathan seeks is to buy ingredients to make sorbet as he can obtain higher profits if he makes his own sorbet without having to buy it every day, and in this way increase his profit margin on his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make sorbet

loans.name: Ana Basilia

texts.es:
En el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Ana Basilia R. desde hace mucho tiempo se ha destacado por ser una excelente trabajadora por lo que vende sus artesanías de madera ofreciéndola a los clientes que le visitan a diario en el mercado.

Actualmente, ella ha buscado la manera de como surtir sus estantes con las artesanías de madera y para esto ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de dichos productos y de esta menera comercializarlos en su localidad en el mercado. Actualmente ha realizado varios créditos con Ceprodel los que le han sido de mucho beneficio en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Basilia R. has worked in the central market of the city of Chinandega for a long time. She has stood out by being an excellent worker, offering her wooden craftwork to customers who visit her daily in the market. At present, she has looked for a way to increase her stock of crafts, and for this she has turned to Kiva partner Ceprodel for help purchasing said products and then selling them in the market. She has taken out a number of loans with Ceprodel that have been very beneficial to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wooden crafts

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia Sabina, pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de la Agonía de Taray”, situado en el distrito de Taray, a 1 hora de la misma ciudad del Cusco.

La socia  tienen 41 años de edad, ella tiene 4 hijos (22, 19, 15, 8 meses), la socia es casada y alterna sus labores del hogar con la artesanía, ella lleva hasta el mirador cada mañana sus productos para venderlos a los turistas, la socia aprovecha que este es un sitio obligado de paso para todos los visitantes que van en dirección a Calca, Pisac, Urubamba, Ollantaytambo y de hay continuarán a Machupicchu, la socia requiere el préstamo en razón de invertir en la compra de mayor número de artesanía para la venta.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el dinero prestado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos mensuales en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The member Sabina belongs to the community bank “Señor de la Agonía de Taray" located in the district of Taray, about an hour from the city of Cusco. The associate is 41 years old, has 4 children (22,19,15,and 8 months old). She is married and splits her time between house work and craft making. She takes her products to the vantage point every morning to sell to the tourists, she benefits from the fact that this is a place that every visitor needs to go by on the way to Calca, Pisac, Urubanda, Ollantaytambo and from there to Machupicchu. She is requesting the loan to invest in more crafts for resale. Our member is very thankful and appreciates the money that is lent to her and promises to comply with the monthly payments in the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for the purchase of supplies for the making of crafts.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora I., aged 47, is a married woman with 5 children. She and her husband are putting all their effort into the farming of potatoes and wheat which they sell to wholesalers. This is paying off since they have recently started the construction of their own house. They wish to improve the quality of their products through a better use of raw materials and seeds. They are requesting a loan for $1700 USD which will help them in their undertaking and allow them to finish the construction of their dream house.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Tamemsuba Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata C., Rugiatu T., Isatu S. and Rebecca C.. They named their group Tamemsuba, a Temne phrase meaning “give us a try.” They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone.

This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. Attached to the group photo is a group member who was not present at the time the group photo was taken.

Fatmata C. is the leader of the group. She is forty-two years of age and was born in Lunsar small town, in northern Sierra Leone. Her husband is a head teacher in one of the schools in Makeni.

Fatmata Cotneh has been a businesswoman for five years now selling firewood. She will use this loan to buy a truckload of firewood. A trip costs something between Le 400,000 – Le 500,000 in the villages surrounding Makeni.

loans.use: To buy a truckload of firewood

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a widow. She lives and runs her venture in Pavlograd. She sells women’s outer clothing items. Tamara owns a vending kiosk in the central marketplace of her hometown. She launched this enterprise 12 years ago. Currently, she has about 30,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her net profit is about 5,500-8,000 Grivnyas a month.

Tamara is seeking a loan of 9,400 Grivnyas to increase her working capital. She is hoping to buy durable and high quality inventory, which will definitely sell well this fall/winter season. Tamara lives with her daughter and a grandson. She always says their welfare is the main goal of her life. Therefore, she is willing to work hard to make sure her family has everything it needs. 
Note: In the picture, Tamara is in red shirt.

loans.use: To increase working capital to buy more inventory

loans.name: Barracks 1 Tendo Max Group

texts.en: Group leader T. Max is a business woman of twenty-six years-old, married with one child and two additional school-age dependents. For the last four years, she has had a cosmetics business. The products are now more expensive so she requires more capital for her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase products such as chemicals, lotions, creams, etc. and she will expand her business. She feels with the loan that she will have the strength to work and be encouraged to work harder. She is a hard working woman whose dream is to purchase a plot of land and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for sale.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie Sanggat is an outspoken yet soft-hearted woman. Since she was young, Tessie was fond of cultivating the land for farming the way Mother Nature takes care of its resources. Planting rice, vegetables, and root crops were her family’s source of living then. When Tessie had her own family, this same activity became her source of income to support the needs of her four children who are now 19 to 25 years old. After many years of doing such business, her family's standard of living has changed very little because all the profit she and her husband make farming is barely sufficient to cover her family's basic needs.

By becoming a member of ASHI and through the loan she can access, Tessie thinks that the livelihood activity she and her husband are doing will become a business someday and through cultivating the land she will also be cultivating her own potential as well as her children’s potentials despite of their low educational attainment. She will used the loan to purchase rice seed, peanuts, and string beans seedlings for her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, peanut, and string beans seedlings

loans.name: Sirri Maria

texts.en:
Sirri Maria is married with eight children. She lives Alabukam, Mankong, Cameroon. Maria and her entire family are currently living in a home with seven rooms.

Maria had to overcome some significant challenges in life such as inadequate funding to pay her children's school fees, ill health and the passing of several relatives. This has made life for her difficult but she is hopeful for her future based on her children and her small business. Maria currently sells meat for a living. Should she receive a loan, she plans on putting the funds towards buying a cow.

This would be Maria's seventh loan from GHAPE. She has been a member since 1998. She has been quite successful in the past with her business which she attributes to her location and her reasonable prices. To date she has enjoyed good profits from her business but is hopeful for additional growth.

Part of her profits from this loan will be used to take care of her children, buy necessities for the family and give them good medication whenever they are sick

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchasing meat for resale

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
