El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de un motor y caja de cambios para reparar su vehículo. Es su primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Esteban lives in a rented home located in the city of La Paz in the Pasankeri neighborhood. He has 2 children and his wife works embroidering dance outfits. Esteban works in public transportation as a driver. He has his own vehicle and drives on routes organized by the Eduardo Avaroa union. This is his main source of income. With the loan, he will buy a motor and a gear box to repair his vehicle. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a motor

loans.name: Shahen

texts.en:
Shahen G. is from the village of Bavra in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is the proud father of a 4-year-old daughter and a 2-year-old son. Shahen and his wife have been engaged in raising cattle for the past 15 years.  Shahen also financially supports his brother’s family.  

Shahen is looking for a loan to purchase calves and feed.  According to his business plan, the proceeds from the loan should increase the family income by 20%.  Shahen dreams of saving enough money for his children to attend college and purchasing a tractor for the family business.  He considers himself fortunate to live in the clean environment of Bavra, close to extended family and friends.  Shahen looks forward to continuing his business in the place of his birth.

loans.use: purchasing calves and feed

loans.name: Twuzuzanye Group

texts.fr: Deogratias AG., un des membres du groupe Twuzuzanye ces membres sont tous commerçants, il est mariée, il a 26 ans. Son niveau d’étude est tronc commun secondaire, il a 1 enfant de deux ans et demi. Il est commerçant avec experience dans ce domaine de 4ans. Deogratias et son groupe s’organisent pour augmenter leur force financière, et valoriser leur business. En fait, le groupe a contracté n prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les articles pour ravitailler leur business quant à lui c’est pour acheter l’huile, savons, sucre,... le profit venant de leur commerce une partie est réinvesti pour maintenir la stabilité financière du groupe et une autre est épargnée afin de préparer pour le bon futur des familles.
texts.en: Deogratias AG. is a member of the Twuzuzanye group composed of entrepreneurs, is married and 26 years of age. He has finished the general academic part of secondary  school cycle. He has a child 2.5 years old. He is an entrepreneur with four years of experience. Deogratias and his group join their forces to strengthen their financial capital and grow their business. The group has taken out [one] loan from Amasezerano Community Banking in order to restock goods needed in their business—in Deogratias’ case, this means oil, soap, sugar etc. A part of the profit is reinvested in order to maintain financial stability of the group and the other is put away in savings in order to plan for a better future for their families.

loans.use: Purchasing oil, soap, sugar etc to retail in his store

loans.name: Yaa Kwaa Gladys

texts.en:
Yaa Kwaa Gladys M. sells 'Fante kenkey' (fermented corn dough, a staple food) and serves it with fried fish and pepper sauce at Abura. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Yaa has been in this trade for some time now. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan will be added to her initial capital to help her expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop to sell provisions.

She has displayed to the left of her table with a few "Fante kenkey"s for sale.

loans.use: add to her initial capital

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena B. is from the pottery capital of Antique, Bari, Sibalom, Antique, Philippines. She is 36 years old, a widow and the mother of three children. Her eldest child is 15 years old while the youngest is 7 years old. They are all students.

Like other mothers she is always hoping for the betterment of her children and the whole family. When she became a widow, she had difficulty in providing for the needs of the family, but she is the kind of mother who does not give up, especially in providing the needs of her children.

Because of her personality and abilities, she was elected as center chief of Bari center 6 of the ASHI Antique Southeast Branch. As a member, she maintains her good performance because she believes that a leader must be a good follower.

She earns an income through buying and selling pottery. The income that she earns from this business really helps her to sustain the basic needs of her family, especially the educational expenses of her children.

For her next loan, she wishes to apply for 25,000 PHP. This amount will be used as additional capital in her pottery business.

Her greatest dream is that all of her children will finish their studies so that they can get a better job. She also dreams of getting a bigger income out of this business so they can own a house and lot someday.

loans.use: To buy more pottery to sell

loans.name: Pedro Toribio

texts.es:
Pedro de 45 años, vende cangrejos en un mercado. Vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos de 12, 10, 9, 8 años  en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Comenzó con las ventas de cangrejos como vendedor ambulante frente a un Banco con dos sacos de cangrejos, después de un tiempo le dieron la oportunidad de tener un puesto fijo donde se comercializa mucho mariscos desde ese tiempo ya tiene 13 años en el puesto vendiendo cangrejos a los compradores. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. Diariamente comprar 25 a 30 planchas de cangrejos  (en cada plancha viene 24 cangrejos) para venderlos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cangrejos para tener mayores ingresos. En el futuro quiere tener más clientela y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Pedro is 45 years old and sells crabs in a market. He lives with his wife and 4 children - 12, 10, 9 and 8 years old in a district called Playas, one of the tourist spots in Ecuador with a diversity of seafood.

He began selling crabs door to door outside a bank with 2 sacks of crabs. After a time he was given the opportunity to have a fixed stall where he sold a lot of seafood. Pedro has had this stand for 13 years, selling crabs to the buyers. He works from 7am until 7pm every day. He purchases 25 to 30 sacks of crabs each day (there are 24 crabs in each bag) to sell.

With this loan Pedro wants to purchase crabs to generate better earnings. In the future he wants to have more customers and wants his children to finish studying with success.

loans.use: Purchase crabs

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa G. is from the village of Barangay 18, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old. and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Elisa sells fish like sardines, mackerel and milk fish caught by her husband. She also makes and sells Filipino snacks like buchi, siakoy, waffle and biko. Elisa has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which was used as working capital and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Elisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 52 años, es una madre de familia dedicada, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su hija. El negocio al que se dedica Rosa, es la venta de accesorios de ferretería, ofreciendo este servicio de manera delivery.  Es así que siempre esta en constante actividad, entregando los pedidos y realizando los cobros progresivos de los créditos que da a sus clientes, quienes aún confían en su negocio, a pesar que en un inicio fracasó su comercio de ferretería cuando lo ejercía en su casa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la comunicación que tiene con sus clientes, además le resulta muy rentable. Es así, con el pasar del tiempo, vende accesorios de ferretería de acuerdo a lo que le piden, exceptuando los materiales de construcción. Su mayor anhelo, es volver a reaperturar su negocio y de esa manera llevar un vida más sosegada. Es su noveno crédito con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar a tiempo sus cuotas  para acceder a posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita, incrementará más mercaderías entre brocas, clavos, enchufes, entre otras herramientas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 52, is a devoted mother living in her own house with her husband and daughter.  Rosa’s business is selling hardware accessories that she home delivers.  She is in constant activity this way delivering orders and collecting progressive payments from her customers who trust her business despite her having failed when she installed a hardware store in her home.  What she enjoys most about the work is the communication she has with her customers.  Besides it’s quite profitable.

This is how with the passage of time she’s been selling hardware accessories according to orders she gets excepting major building materials and supplies.  Her greatest hope is to reopen her business in order to have a more calm existence.

This is her 9th loan with MFP and knows that she has to pay on time in order to access future loans.

She will use the loan to increase stock merchandise like: drill bits and electrical plugs, among other things.

loans.use: To buy more tools and accessories to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 44  ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli, préfecture de Barouéli; Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et d’amitié, elles font le commerce de tissus et de condiments tels la pâte d’arachide.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire.                                                                          
MAH K. compte acheter quelques sacs de 100Kg d’arachide au marché de Barouéli, après transformation en pâte d’arachide, elle vend au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Tiessiri are all married and average 44 years of age and three children living in traditional extended families in Barouéli City, Barouéli prefecture, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know one another through ties of kinship and friendship. They do commerce in cloth and in condiments, such as peanut butter. The group members are now on their sixth solidarity loan.  

Ms. MAH K. intends to use her loan to buy a few 100-kg sacks of peanuts at the Barouéli market. She will then process them into peanut butter. She accepts cash or credit in her sales to a customer base composed essentially of women.  

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover the loan payments and to meet expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Buying peanuts

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov K. is 20 years old and lives with her young child and her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She is a good housewife, stays at home and cooks for her family members. Her husband works at a rubber plantation, and typically makes US $4 per day. To earn more money, Pov is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a plot of land to grow yams. (Pov K. is pictured with her husband and her young child.)

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Phork

texts.en:
The man shown in the picture is Mr. Phork N., 63, a fisherman. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish in the river next to his house. He catches around eight kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers who are retail sellers in the market. 

He has no life partner because he was divorced from his wife years ago. He has eight children, four of whom are single and working in various jobs, while the other four are married and live independently. 

Mr. Phork N. will use his loan to purchase nets, traps, hooks, and other fishing implements so he can catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps, hooks and other fishing implements.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La sra. Estela P. de 35 años de edad está casada hace 17 años con el señor Ever Cristaldo de 39 años, el matrimonio cuenta con dos hijos de 17 y 8 años respectivamente, el primero terminará este año su secundaria y el otro va empezar el tercer grado.
La señora Estela empezó el negocio hace 5 años con un pequeño capital que le dio su esposo, quien se dedica a la fabricación de muebles, con eso compró ropas usadas y con el correr del tiempo lo convirtió en una ropería.
La señora quiere que su negocio crezca cada día  y con el crédito aumentará sus ingresos para que el día de mañana pueda hacer estudiar a sus hijos una carrera universitaria y que  en el futuro sean unas personas de bien.
Solicita este préstamo para compra de mercaderías como pantalón, short, zapatos, blusas, conjunto para criaturas, camisa, remeras, zapatillas y materia prima para su marido que está en el rubro de carpintería y así ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Estela P., 35 years old, has been married for 17 years to Ever Cristaldo, 39 years old. This marriage has produced two children who are 17 and 8 years old. The first will finish high school this year, and the other is going to start third grade.

Estela started her business five years ago with a little bit of money that her husband gave her. He builds furniture. With the money she bought used clothing, and over time she turned this into a clothing business.

She wants her business to grow each day, and with this loan she will increase her revenue so that someday she can pay for her children to go to college and be successful people.

She is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise such as slacks, shorts, shoes, blouses, children's outfits, shirts, t-shirts, and sneakers, as well as materials for her husband who does carpentry so that she can offer a variety of items to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase women's and men's jeans, shorts, shoes, blouses, children's outfits, shirts, t-shirts, underclothes, sneakers, and perfumes.

loans.name: Deth's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Deth is the leader of this group loan. She has been selected by five members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to  improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Deth was born in 1962. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Young, is a construction worker. They have two children who are seamstresses in garment factories.

Currently, she faces an obstacle because her roof is leaking. So to solve this problem, Mrs. Deth is requesting a loan to buy zinc to build a new roof.

loans.use: To buy zinc to build a new roof

loans.name: Chroeng

texts.en: Chroeng K. is a 50-year-old rice farmer who lives in the capital, Phnom Penh. She doesn’t have a life partner because her husband died of senility, many years ago. Chroeng K. is blessed with four children who are no longer in school. To help support the family’s needs, two of her kids work in construction, while another one is employed in a garment factory. Chroeng K. has a plot of farmland, located away from the watering system. For this reason, she cannot irrigate her crops easily. In order to deal with this problem, Chroeng K. is requesting for a loan to purchase a machine that she can use to pump the water for her crops. She will also buy a few sacks of fertilizer for her crop to grow well. She hopes to use the remainder of the funds to buy a sewing machine for her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase a pumping machine and a few sacks of fertilizers for her crop growing well.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia con su familia en una comunidad rural en el distrito de La Matanza, en el norte de Perú. Desde hace 2 años, se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para ayudar con los gastos escolares de sus hijos menores. Este préstamo permitirá que Alejandro trabaje más tranquilo  sin  tener que recurrir a prestamistas informales que le cobrarían tasas altísimas, lo cual perjudica su liquidez diaria y retrasa su crecimiento tanto comercial como familiar. 

Alejandro es muy trabajador y responsable. Es cliente recurrente  para Edpyme Alternativa y ha cumplido con sus otras obligaciones de manera puntual. Es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 42 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in his own home with his family in a rural community in the District of La Matanza in northern Peru. He has been raising small animals for two years. When the animals have reached the proper level of development, he offers them for sale to traders who frequently visit the area where he lives.

Alejandro is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN to help pay the school expenses of his young children. This loan will enable him to work more peacefully without having to resort to informal lenders who charge very high rates that would impact his daily liquidity and slow the growth of both his business and his family.

Alejandro is very hardworking and responsible. He is a returning client of Edpyme Alternativa and has fulfilled his other obligations in a timely manner. This father is devoted to his family and always looking after their welfare and development. The people who know him have great respect and affection for him. His greatest wish is to continue working so that his family can get ahead.

loans.use: To pay the school expenses of his young children.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Sangaré est une femme mariée de 30 ans et mère d’un enfant. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire, avec son enfant chez son époux dans le  quartier Dougounina de la ville de Bougouni.
Pendant des années elle fréquenta l’école coranique, qu’elle abandonna suite à la pauvreté de ses parents. Afin de s'insérer  dans la vie active, elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente d’articles divers de boutique qu’elle a appris auprès de son petit frère. Avec une expérience de 2 ans, elle maîtrise son activité et est très sollicitée.
Fatoumata, qui est à son premier prêt, intègre le programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers sa belle mère. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter d’importante quantité de marchandises pour sa boutique. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et à Bougouni, et effectue sa vente en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata Sangaré is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. She lives in a nuclear family with her child at her husband’s place in the Dougounina district of the city of Bougouni. For years she attended Koran school but dropped out when her parents were stricken by poverty. In order to join the working world, she became interested in revenue-generating work, especially the buying and selling of various shop goods. She learned this business from her younger brother. With two years of experience, she is mastering her business and is much in demand.

Fatoumata, who is on her first loan, joined the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso through her mother-in-law. She intends to use her loan to buy a major quantity of merchandise for her shop. She gets her supplies in Bamako and in Bougouni. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales retail to a diverse and varied customer base.

With this loan, she plans on making a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA. With the profits, she envisions expanding her shop.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items for her shop

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is 39 years old. She has six children who are between the ages of 3 and 16 years old. They are all in school. Epiphanie sells sorghum on a wholesale scale. This business has enabled her to pay school fees for her family and feed her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and make more profits in order to reach her goals.

loans.use: To buy sorghum.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is from the village of Macao, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years-old. Jenny is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Jenny owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling bananas, coconuts and fire wood in the local community. Jenny has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Jenny joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenny is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas and coconuts. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas & coconuts.

location.town: Macao, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a talented 49-year-old mother. Mariam and her husband Waleed still have three young children to support. Waleed works in shoe business, but that is not enough for them. Mariam started a small business five years ago making wooden and metA. masterpieces using her talent, creativity, and her ability to do so. She bought all the tools and equipment that she needed and began to create her first artistic piece.

At first she decorated her house with those pieces so when people visited they would ask about them and then ask her to make one for them. That’s how she started. Now she has been running her business for five years, but it is still in a small area at home.  Now Mariam has applied for a loan to rent a workspace and shop outside of her home so she can grow her customer base and sell more crafts.

Since Mariam is a conservative person, her husband Waleed agreed to appear in the picture with some of her work behind him.

loans.use: To rent a workshop to make her crafts more accessible to her customers.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is 35 years old. She has two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She and her husband have been running a small cafe selling beverages and food to people in the local community since 2004. They have requested a loan to buy furniture and a variety of different foods for the cafe in order to attract more customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and helps her to improve her income and living conditions.

loans.use: To buy furniture and stock for her cafe

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is 44 years old and he lives in Aknaghbyur village of Tavush area.  Rashid lives with his mother and his brother’s family. 
Rashid and his family engage in cattle and chicken breeding, beekeeping and land cultivation. Rashid’s mother is retiree, but she also helps her sons with their farming. Thanks to profit from their occupation they solve their family’s needs.
Rashid asks for a 700.000 AMD loan to improve his harvesting process and will use the funds to buy a fuel for his harvesting machine, to pay for mowed hay transportation from field to his farm, and also to pay a rent to village administration for a plot of land, because hay from his own field doesn't enough for his farm animals, as well as to buy 3 or 4 bee families.

loans.use: to pay for fuel for harvesting machine, to pay a rent for a plot of land, and to buy 3 or 4 bee families.

loans.name: Uulkan's Group

texts.en:
Uulkan is the leader of her borrowing group. Eight years ago she opened a kiosk, where she started to sell foodstuffs and detergents. Her monthly profit is 7,000 soms. 

Uulkan is 45 and married to an electrician, whose monthly salary is 12,000 soms. She and her husband have three children -- two sons and a daughter. The family lives in Tamchi, a small village near Isykul Lake. The first son makes money by renting parasols on a local beach, the second son is a student, their daughter helps Uulkan in running the family business.

Uulkan applied for this loan because she needs more money to buy foodstuffs for her kiosk, with the hopes of increasing her turnover and sales at the kiosk. In the future Uulkan hopes she might earn enough to open a grocery store of her own.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs to sell at a kiosk

loans.name: Elsa Beatriz

texts.es:
La  Sra. Elsa es D. la ciudad D. Santani, tiene 46 años D. edad, está casada con el Sr. Eleuterio D. 49 años D. edad, tienen 2 Hijos, todos mayores D. edad, los cuales trabajan D. forma independiente.
Se dedica a la venta ambulante D. Artículos D. Mercerías, comenta que tiene una clientela bien formada, lo cual le genera un buen ingreso. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Por medio del trabajo que ella hace ha logrado mantener a sus hijos y D. paso ayuda a su marido en los gastos D. la casa. Dice que su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos sigan una carrera universitaria y se vuelvan buenos profesionales.
El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra D. artículos D. mercería, como ser cubiertos, ropas, souvenires y demás. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Elsa is from Santaní.  She’s 46 years old and is married to Eleuterio, 49.  They have two children who are both adults and work independently.

She is a general merchandise vendor.  She comments that she has a well formed clientele which generates a good income.  She defines herself as a very hard working, enterprising woman.  Through her work she’s managed to support her children and along the way has helped her husband cover household expenses.  She says that her greatest wish is that her children study university careers and become good professionals.

She is asking for the loan to buy general merchandise like: cutlery, clothes, souvenirs, etc.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it provides her.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise.

loans.name: Te

texts.en: Te, 58, is a farmer. With her husband, their income is $2 per day. The couple have two children, one of whom works in a factory for $2 per day. Each month, Te has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on rent, $15 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a cow for feeding with the plan to sell its baby. In the future, she wants to feed chickens and pigs at home because it is an easy career from which she would be able to make a good income.

loans.use: to buy a cow for feeding with the intention to sell its baby.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y tiene dos hijos D. 24 y 28 años D. edad, ella trabaja en la Universidad desD. hace 14 años, con un horario D. 7:00am a 6:00pm, uno D. sus hijos  estudia en la Universidad, por el momento inicia un nuevo ciclo D. estudio, doña Ana, no tiene la solvencia económica para pagar la inscripción, por lo que a través D. un préstamo pretenD. pagar no solo la inscripción, sino que todo el ciclo D. estudio.
Esto ayudara para apoyar a su hijo y que este pueda cursar las materias indicadas, sin tener atrasos, logrando avanzar en su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and has two children, ages 24 and 28.  She has been working at the University for 14 years.  Her schedule is from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  

One of her children currently attends the University and is starting a new period of studies.  Ana does not have the financial solvency to pay for the enrollment.  She intends to use the loan to not only pay for enrollment, but to also pay for the entire course of studies.

This will help support her son so that he is able to take the subjects listed without have any delays.  That way he will move forward in his professional career.

loans.use: to make university payments.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.es:
La señora  Bonifacia   tiene  treinta y tres años de edad , se  dedica  a la venta de ropa  desde hace siete años y a  la venta de cosméticos desde hace tres años  con su esposo , Rolando   tiene la edad de  cuarenta años quien se dedica  mas a la tienda de ropa.
Es una  señora muy trabajadora  le gusta  ayudar  a su esposo  en lo necesario  cuando  ella  
No tiene tanto trabajo  con los cosméticos y la ropa  le ayuda a su esposo en una tienda de  abarrotes que tienen en su casa .
Tiene la cantidad de tres hijos  una  mujer  Michel y dos varones Cristopher  y Rolando.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para comprar  más  mercancía para su tienda mas ropa ya que en  ocasiones sus clientes  le piden ropa por  mayoreo  y no cuenta  con los recursos necesario para  hacer el pedido.
Esta muy contenta  con su negocio  cada día gana más clientes  tanto en la ropa  como en cosméticos.
Uno de sus sueños  es hacer su tienda de ropa mas grande para  ofrecer un mejor servicio  a s sus  clientes.
Le da las gracias  a fundación realidad  por el apoyo que les da a las personas que desean tener su propio negocio  y salir adelante  para ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Bonifacia is 33 years old. She has been selling clothing for seven years and cosmetics for three years along with her husband, Rolando. He is 40 years old and he mostly sells the clothing.

She is a very hardworking woman and she likes to help her husband with things when she isn’t too busy with the cosmetics and clothing. She helps her husband with a small grocery store they have in their house.

She requested the loan to buy more merchandise for her store, more clothing, because sometimes her customers ask her for wholesale quantities of clothing and she doesn’t have the resources necessary to fill those requests. She is very happy with her business. Each day she gains more customers, both for the clothing and the cosmetics. One of her dreams is to have a larger clothing store so she can offer improved service to her customers.

She thanks the Fundación Realidad for the support it gives to people to want to have their own business and get ahead in order to help their families.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her clothing business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 38-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has owned a cattle farm in his town since 2001. He works independently on his farm. His work consists of purchasing cattle, feeding them and reselling them to cattle farms, butcheries etc. He is the only income provider of the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more cattle for his farm. He hopes that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for his farm

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
San Sebastian se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita, desde el año 2010, gracias a que la actual Directora Finanzas la Señora Julia contactó con la asesora para pedirle una reunion para el nuevo grupo que estaban conformando en el barrio, logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el tercer ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La señora Julia, es quien se encarga de la parte financiera del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, como ser pantalones, camisas, remeras, y otros. Mediante esto ella logra tener los ingresos necesarios para mantener a todo su familia. Comenta que lleva un tiempo en esto por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien definida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, remeras, y otros, para la posterior venta. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da a su microempresa.
texts.en:
San Sebastian is the name of this excellent group of women.  The group was founded in the city of Ita in 2010, thanks to the current Finance Director, Señora Julia.  She contacted the counselor to ask to set up a new group which was put together in the neighborhood.  She managed to bring together 17 women who find themselves enjoying their work.  They are in their third lending cycle, and are united and committed to each other through the program.

Señora Julia is in charge of the financial affairs of the group.  She works selling all types of clothing, such as trousers, shirts, T-shirts and other things.  Through this she has been able earn the income necessary to support her whole family.  She comments that it has taken a while, but she has a well defined customer base.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of trousers, shirts, T-Shirts and other things for later sale.  She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that it is giving to her micro-business.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, T-shirts, and other things for later sale.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 33, married, and has two school-age children. She owns and manages a variety store in their village to generate income for the sake of their children. They aim to continue sending their children [to school] as they want them to earn a degree and become professionals someday. They work hard and endure hardships to attain their goals. 

Due to financial difficulties, Aileen is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell in her variety store. She believes that this loan will help her to increase their product offerings and income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Sergey

texts.ru: Сергею нужно закупить партию товара, так как он расширил свой бизнес и сейчас у него две торговых точки. Он поставил свего сына менеджером в отдел сумок в торговом центре в Новомосковске, а сам возобновил торговлю на рынке. Получив кредит Сергей планирует поехать на оптовый рынок в Одессу на своем Фолькваген КАДИ белого цвета, который он использует как для бизнеса, так и для семьи. Вместе со своей женой Еленой Сергей проживают в частном доме в пригороде. Вместе с ними живут их дети и внуки.
texts.en: Sergey needs to buy another inventory of merchandise because he expanded his business and now has two retail outlets.  He put his son in charge of the purses department in a Novomoskovsk wholesale center and resumed sales at a market.  Having received this loan, Sergey plans to go to a wholesale market in Odessa in his white Volkswagen Kadi, which he uses for his business and family.  Together with his wife Yelena, Sergey lives in a private house in a suburb.  Their children and grandchildren live with them as well.

loans.use: to purchase purses, backpacks and suitcases

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is a married woman with four school aged children.  Her husband is a contractor, and financially they both help meet the family's basic needs. 

She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Florah has operated a grocery store for the past five years.  She is also a farmer.  Clients are local residents.  Florah says her major challenge is theft of goods.  She hopes to expand her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase more vegetables for her grocery store.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for her grocery.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 16 years. He is 51 years old, and he and his wife Margaret have four children who are all going to school.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of their existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

In future, Joshua hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en:
Kefa is a 41-year-old housewife who has seven sons and daughters. Two years ago, she opened an extended room from her house as a small food market to help her husband to support their large family. With the profits that she made during those two years, she was able to enhance her food market by adding more shelves and more food products.
Now Kefa wants to apply for a loan to buy new types of food products that she was not able to buy before.

loans.use: to buy new types of food products for her store.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a 59-year-old farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been growing and selling rice for quite some time now. Carmelita works hard to improve her business and support her family financially. She has applied for a loan to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. Carmelita hopes that her business will grow. She also hopes to help send her nieces and nephews to school.

loans.use: to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru:
Назгул 35 лет, замужем, воспитывает  пятерых детей. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, 10 лет назад Назгул начала свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота, использовав стартовую сумму в 12,000 сом (KGS).   
Благодаря упорному труду Назгул, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день приносит около 8,000 сом в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков на откорм. Доходы Назгул планирует вложить в постройку нового удобного сарая для скота, и в будущем – в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Nazgul is 35 years old, married and is raising five children.  In search of a source for financial support for her family, she started her own business of fattening up and reselling livestock ten years ago, using an initial sum of 12,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her persistent work, Nazgul's business currently yields about 8,000 som per month from sale of milk and meat products.  In order to further grow her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase bulls for fattening up.  Nazgul plans to invest the profits from this loan into building a new, comfortable barn for the livestock, and, in the future, further increasing livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a farmer in Kitale and she has 5 solid years of experience in farming. She currently produces vegetables and onions for the local market. Grace works as a food vendor in the local market and her food is sold mainly at construction sites in the local town.

Grace has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and  insure a dairy cow. She says this will improve her farming income and enable her to take better care of her children's basic needs, especially their education. She hopes to scale up her farming business; however, she says that farmers are facing a great challenge occasioned by animal diseases and poor infrastructure.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Faustine

texts.en:
Faustine aged 36 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 3 and 12 years. 2 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 8 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers of maize and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy fertilizers of maize and pay workers.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 27 year old hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a retail shop as her main source of income and also practices crop farming to earn an extra income for her family.
She started the business with the proceeds from her farming business. Her business has grown and is worthy expansion so she now dreams of having a wholesale store though her capital is still not enough. 
Annet is requesting a loan to buy more stock like crates of soda, soap, sugar, rice and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock like crates of soda, soap, sugar, rice and other items to sell.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Glorious Fashion Home is owned by Miss Gifty A.. She is a fashion designer who also sells items such as earrings, ribbons, slippers, polyester materials etc. She lacks sewing machines and other equipment like scissors, threads, needles in her shop. She also has lots of customers. The lack of these machines cause delay in meeting the demand of her customers. She is therefore seeking a loan of $775.00 from Kiva. Miss Gifty A. is a very hardworking lady and can pay back this loan.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 49 years old and a widow catering for the needs 4 children at various levels of education. She has been selling used clothes and bedding (bed spreads)for the past 6 years to maintain her family.

Gradually the business has grown over the years resulting in higher stocks. Her current need is to secure a structure (shop) in which the items would be safe from rain and theives.

As a beneficiary of the 'TEACH' learning sessions of KRABAN, she intends to use the KIVA loan to acquire a secured shop to sell her wares.

loans.use: Acquire a Structure[shop]

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en: G. Antoinette a 44-year-old dynamic and ambitious woman. She has 4 children and lives with her family in Yopougon, a township in north of Abidjan. G. Antoinette sells salt and various aromatic products in the Yopougon-Selmer open market. Antoinette's third child will start grammar school in September and she wants to be able to pay the school fees. She wants to sieze a good business opportunity that consists of wholesale selling of aromatic products to a cooperative of tradeswomen near her market.

loans.use: Gbeyo Antoinette will use the loan to purchase a stock of aromatic products

loans.name: Soum

texts.en: Mrs. Soum S. is 50 years old and works as a seamstress in Phnom Penh, earning $1/day.  She lives with her husband, a bodyguard, who earns $4/day, and their 5 children.  Mrs. Soum S. will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to help her business, and also to help the family cut down on transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.en:
MARIA Mary Magdalene X., 34, began selling drinks and snack foods in her store called "Paola" after coming to the realization that her husband's income was not sufficient to support their growing family. Slowly but surely the word got around and the customers started to come. Now her corner store is firmly established but it is not quite enough to make ends meet so in the afternoons she sells sweet drinks made of corn called atol and also lunch food called tostados. She works hard from early morning to late at night caring for her family, preparing the food for the day and running the two businesses. She is one busy person.

Maria also cares for her oldest daughter (age 15), who suffers from cerebral palsy resulting in mental and physical disability as well as speech problems. The daughter no longer receives treatment at the Fundabien Institution so the burden falls on Maria's shoulders Sometime she gets depressed and feels overwhelmed. But she has 6 other children that need her love and care, so she carries on the best she can. Her dream is to make sure the rest of the children get an education so they can get a good start in life. So she tends the store in the morning and sells her prepared food in the afternoon and cares for her family. Every day is a struggle; but, for the sake of her family, she fights on knowing someday things will get better.

Interviewed by Lucia Tunay Ixcol
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase supplies for the store

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Mrs. Felicita belongs to Comunal Bank Sol Naciente (Rising Sun), at Jr. F. Jhon Kenedy 999 del A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. She is 75 years old and has 6 kids, her husband works at a sawmill, but his health is very bad, so Felicita decided to open a small place to sell typical food with her first loan from Manuela Ramos.

Currently she has a small space in the corner of her hose to sell food that she prepares (juanes, patarashca, smoked fish, and tacacho with steak). Every day she wakes up very early to take care of the household and from 5pm on she attends the business until mid night.

With the new loan of $/.2,500 ($833 approx.), which will be paid in 6 months, she will build a small ceiling so she won’t have difficulties when it rains, she will also buy 5 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, a bunch of plantains, 3 kilos of fish and 1 sack of charcoal.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.



La señora Felicita pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, del Jr. B. Leguia 1098 del A. H. Nuevo Paraiso del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 57 años y es madre de 6 hijos, su esposo trabaja en un aserradero, pero su salud es delicada, es así que Felicita, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos decide poner un pequeño puesto de venta de comida regional. En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño espacio en la esquina de su casa para vender la comida que prepara (juanes, patarashca, pescado ahumado y tacacho con cecina). Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para atender los quehaceres de la casa y a partir de las 5.00 pm atiende el negocio hasta la media noche. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500 (US$ 833.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, armará un pequeño techo para no tener dificultades cuando llueve, además comprará 5 kilos de arroz, 5 pollos, un racimo de plátanos, 3 kilos de pescado y 1 saco de carbón. Felicita esta muy contenta de tener este negocio por que así puede atender a su familia en las mañanas y en las noches vender su comida para generar ingreso para los gastos de la casa.

loans.use: To install ceilings and buy supplies.Instalación de calaminas (techo).  Compra de insumos.

loans.name: Elimeness

texts.en:
This is Elimeness T., commonly known as Mama Joshua (in reference to her 1-year-old son, Joshua). In 2005 she established a business selling both Western clothing and African batik clothing. Mama Joshua now needs a loan of $450 to expand her colourful and interesting range. The business enables her to assist her husband Alpha to support their son, as well as Alpha’s daughter, Evelini, 12.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation for women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of Western and African clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Nabweru South East 2036(I) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for one year and five months. Sarah is 32 years old and married with four children. She sells fresh foods in the market. She wants to start up a retail shop alongside her current business. Both Julian and Proscovia own beauty salons and they want to use the loan to buy more salon equipment. Note: This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the current business

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Mrs. Hortencia is part of the Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, located on Jr. Ricardo Palma #383, Calleria distric, Ucayali department. She is 53 years old and is a mother of 3 children; one of them is still a dependent. She is married and her husband is a machine operator. She decided to invest her first loan of $103 USD from Manuela Ramos in the buying and selling of soft drinks. Currently she continues with the sale of cold drinks such as sodas and ice; she also sells carbon. She gets up early to prepare breakfast and at the same time lend her attention to her small business with much care and dedication. She will use the loan of $516 USD to buy 5 boxes of soft drinks, 5 bushels of carbon, and 2 boxes of beer. The loan will be paid back over the course of 5 months. Hortencia says everything is doing very well in her business since her first loan. She is also very grateful for the support provided to her by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Hortencia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, ubicado en Jr. Ricardo Palma Nº 394, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años, es madre de 3 hijos y uno de ellos depende aún de ella, es casada y su esposo es operador de máquinas. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles, decide invertir en la compra y venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad continúa con la venta de bebidas heladas como gaseosas, hielo, también vende carbón. Se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno y al mismo tiempo se dedica a la atención de su pequeño negocio con mucho esmero y dedicación. Con el préstamo de S/ 1,500 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 5 cajas de gaseosas, 5 sacos de carbón, 2 cajas de cerveza. Hortencia nos dice que desde su primer préstamo todo le está saliendo muy bien en su negocio y también está muy agradecida por el apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, carbon and beer.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 54 years old and is married with five grown children. Juliana owns a small food store, which she opened in 2000. She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $15 from her sales.
She would like a loan of $150 to buy more food items to stock in her store.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her small grocery store

loans.name: Mwanahija

texts.en:
Mwanahija is 25 years old and is a singe woman with 1 child, who is 8 years old. Mwanahija is a fish seller, she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 7am to 4:30pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.
